story: After my 1st short filmmaking experience bringing a sacred part of myself back to life for everyone to see, I learned a great deal as the writer, director, producer, and finally actor the magic and how necessary it is telling a story...a true one! "Last Tonight" holds as a common trip down memory lane filled with emotional twists and turns, and the lure of the unknown to come. This campaign will help everyone on the building and detailed work involved, making movie magic of this true story of mine. Reaching $10K together and spreading the word will help guide me towards making my dream in this industry...my reality. Blessed with a great team in production and castings in development, this campaign can make it all possible...with your contributions. Festival invites, film screenings, and film copies is the icing and perks for all that donate! Looking forward to sharing with you all behind the scene pictures, film trailer, about the actors and film poster to come.

story:
Abortion in Film

The plot of Friday Afternoon revolves heavily around an abortion - the main character's abortion, based upon my own. 

Despite the emotionally-charged, public debates surrounding reproductive rights, we only very rarely hear about women's actual abortion stories. We almost never see them represented in film and television, and when we do they are often unrealistic. When an estimated one third of women will have an abortion in their lifetimes, it's ridiculous that less than one hundred abortions have ever been portrayed on American network television, and even fewer in American movies.

Friday Afternoon is a scripted drama, but it is my abortion story, and I want to tell it. By contributing to our fundraiser, you can help us to chip away at the stigma surrounding abortion in film. You can help us to normalize the experience of abortion, and to portray it as it is: common and safe.

(If you'd like to hear a little bit more about the way abortion figures into the plot of Friday Afternoon, check out the video below!)

 

What We Need 

We are raising $15,000 for production of Friday Afternoon. All funds will go towards the practical costs of producing a film, including:

  • Equipment and location rentals
  • Costumes and props
  • Shooting permits and production insurance
  • Catering and snacks for our cast and crew for our 10-day shoot 

Movies are very expensive! By raising this amount of money, we will be able to cover all of the costs mentioned above, and if through your generosity we happen to exceed our goal, any remaining funds will go towards post-production costs: picture and sound editing, color correction, titles, and festival fees.

Your Contribution

We need you. Every film is a collaborative effort, shared among the creative team, the cast and crew, and the supporters. Please help Friday Afternoon by pledging your support. Donate now above (and pick out one of our exciting perks!) and share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter.  You can help us access the resources we need in order to make Friday Afternoon a reality.

This film is just one woman's story - one day in one woman's life, like any abortion is just one day in one woman's life. But stories are powerful, and through sharing this experience, we hope to support other women who want to share their own.

Risks & Challenges

Making a film always means taking a risk. But there are definitely a few risks we have had to consider that are particular to Friday Afternoon.

What about the content? It's no secret that abortion is a sensitive subject. We know that there will be people who will be upset by this movie, and maybe even by this campaign. But in a time when reproductive rights are under attack, it's more important than ever to tell stories like this one.   

What if we don't raise all the money? Then we are going to work with what we have! We've set a flexible goal, meaning that this isn't an all-or-nothing deal - we keep what we raise, whether we raise the full amount or not. We're lucky to have a network of supportive friends and collaborators who will work with us on the more flexible costs, but with such a small budget, every dollar counts! That is why we really appreciate our supporters sharing the campaign on social media - even if a few people who wouldn't normally have seen it are able to donate, it really helps us.

Can't Donate? You can still help!

If you are unable to donate, you can help us tremendously by sharing this campaign on social media, as well as directly with people who might be interested in contributing. 

You can share by simply copying and pasting the link to this page into a post or email, or you can click the Facebook, Twitter, or Google+ icons next to the campaign video.

Want to share your abortion story with us? Send us an email at fridayafternoonthemovie@gmail.com, or visit our website.

Check out all of these interviews in full here. 

The infographic from our video was designed by Jessica Harrington, Kate Giambrone, and Julianna Johnson for ANSIRH at UCSF, and can be found in full here.

story:
#GetSomeGiveSome

This is the mantra we love and live by.  

What if you could do something good every time you shop?  Like buying Toms shoes, but instead of just shoes, you're doing good whatever you buy.  And the retailers you buy from and the firm you work for can get involved too. 

Simply add your credit and debit cards in our app, choose your good causes, and set your round-up amount, then we sync with your cashless transactions and take a round-up every time you shop. So you can support global or local causes, track your impact and feel good about the difference you're making, with total privacy, transparency and control, just by living your life.

We believe that by caring about what we do each day and understanding that we can make a positive impact, we can create a sustainable world and feel good.  So we created a real-time social responsibility platform that makes it easy for us all.  

You can set it and forget it or track your impact closely every day.   With Sustainably, know that you're doing good automatically, every time you buy on your cards or connected devices. Pause it or change it all at any time, and never receive any unwanted phone calls, direct mail or texts.  

With Sustainably, it’s not how much you give, but how often, and your spare change can make all the difference.  And with an easy way for the retailers you shop from and the firm you work for to get involved in supporting the great causes you care about too as a new socially responsible loyalty scheme!

So it’s simple: every time you get something, you can give something back.  

The money we raise on Indiegogo will be matched by one of our generous supporters so anything you give today will help us to reach our goal and scale the platform twice as fast! In addition, 10% of all funds raised on IndieGogo will go straight to our beta charities and the rest will go towards the platform launch.  We're launching in the UK first but we're going global where we see demand for our product so please support us wherever you are in the world because we'll be coming soon!

 

 

Set up is simple in your mobile phone... You choose your good causes; add a roundup amount and your credit and debit cards in our app.  Then every time you buy on your cards or connected devices, you automatically donate.  You can set a cap to manage your limits so you don't over commit.  So it's totally hassle free - just use your credit and debit cards as normal.  And you can check-in with the app to see your impact and pause it or change it whenever you like!

By giving micro-donations as small round-ups on your everyday purchases, you can have an impact every day. You probably won't notice the spare change, but the causes you give it to definitely will.  Sustainably puts the power of living and giving into your mobile, so you can support the causes you care about every time you shop and see the difference you're making every day.

Have you ever not known what happens after you've given a donation in the past?  With Sustainably, we're changing all that so you can see your impact instantly and track the difference you making from your mobile phone.  Every time you give, get an alert showing what’s happening that day because of your money.  This means that your good causes won’t have to spend their valuable funds sending you expensive mailings or wait for an email you probably won't read.  You also get an impact point every time you give. These impact points can be used to get rewards from the shops you love, and you can track the impact you're having over time.

Discover what’s happening local to you, be inspired and get involved in supporting initiatives in your local communities that you didn't even know existed!  With Sustainably’s JUST THE GOOD NEWS feed you can share your ideas and all the good you’re doing and hear about all the good things happening in your community and around the world.  

 

Why Sustainably?

Round-ups make it easy for you to support global or local causes close to your heart by rounding up your everyday purchases. Simply connect your debit or credit card in your Sustainably app, and then every time you buy on your cards or connected devices, we round up your transaction and give your spare change to the causes of your choice.  It's that simple!

Instant happiness is an easy for you to give a lump sum if you see something that inspires you, without giving out your personal details.  Simply donate it straight from your Sustainably app in a couple of seconds!

 

Sustainably is all about doing good through positivity and fun.  'Fun raising' allows you to raise money easily for causes you care about.  If you’re hosting an event or doing a challenge, get your friends or community to give you round-ups for a week! Or they can give you some instant happiness to support your good causes.  Simply set up a 'fun-raising' for your favourite cause and share it with your friends.

This enables employers and retailers to match donate with their employees and customers.  It’s a great way for businesses to get involved in their communities and make a positive impact.  

Whichever way you donate, with Sustainably, you always have complete privacy, transparency and control.  And you can pause it or change it all at any time from your app!

To make this happen we need your pledge!

£10,000 will cover the start-up costs and the first month of operation.  We have a number of charities signed up waiting to use the platform, but you can email us at causes@sustainably.co if you want to get yours signed up too.  Please support our launch donate and share this campaign with your special network - every £1 we get in support of Sustainably is AMAZING. 

We’ve already got a supporter who has agreed to match donate this entire campaign, so anything you raise will be doubled so we can scale the platform and have a bigger impact more quickly!  

The Founders

Loral Quinn - award-winning ex-head of digital marketing and strategy for a FTSE100 global investment company and wanted to take her skills for digital and scaling business and combine it with her passion for changing the world.

Eishel Quinn - has a background in organic retail and is the eco-warrior and driving force behind the Sustainably brand and ecosystem.

 

Testimonials 

 

 

 

 

Follow us on social

Please give us a shout out on  @GiveSustainably on Twitter and @SustainablyCo on Facebook.  Any support you can give to our project is greatly appreciated - even if it's just a share (you can use the share icons by the video at the top and use the #Sustainably & #GetSomeGiveSome to spread the word) - every little helps. Our gratitude will be yours forever.  We can’t wait to begin this journey with you!

With Love,

Team Sustainably

 

Rewards

  • £1 - Feel good factor of giving
  • £2 - Feel good factor of giving
  • £5 - Feel good factor of giving
  • £10 - shout out on social media channels
  • £20 - featured on the Sustainably website 
  • £50 first access to the app when it is ready
  • £100 - Exclusive invite to a Sustainably  'round table' - focusing on issues such as the future of giving and issues in the charity sector
  • £200 - Invite to Sustainably launch party
  • £250 - Invite to Sustainably launch party and a pre-launch drinks reception

As the campaign continues, we will be adding stretch goals!

 

We are Sustainably, a platform to inspire sustainable living and giving.

We want to shape the world we want to live in by creating a platform for inspiring change. Through building a community of change-makers, together we will uncover, share, and scale up the pace of change for a future we want to live in and make lives better for today and for a better world tomorrow.

Sustainably is a lifestyle choice - a new way of living and giving. And we want to celebrate all of you who are doing amazing things, (no matter how small or big) to help society and the environment thrive.

We want to help you share your story and listen to others, and make our voices heard, to help spread awareness faster and give people access to the information they have been deprived of.

We can use the power of our voices, and our daily choices, to create the kind of future we want to live in.  Together we can create a better world.

By connecting your credit and debit cards in our app, you allow us to track your transactions. By signing up to round-ups, you give us permission to round-up your spare change and give it to the causes of your choice every time you make a transaction using your cards or connected devices.  

To set up round-ups, select a good cause you want to support, and add the credit or debit card you wish to connect to your account. Then every time you shop on that credit or debit card or a connected device linked to it, you allow us to donate a round-up to your good causes.  

Sustainably takes a 5% fee from gift aid to manage the platform. So if you are a UK taxpayer for every £1 you donate, you actually give £1.25 and Sustainably retains 6p, so a total of £1.19 will go to your charity.  The 6p is used to cover all the costs involved with running the platform from the awesome developers to the inspiring designers and content creators.  As a founders pledge, 10% of any profits made will go to the Sustainably Foundation which will support our '100x' and 'staff picks' causes. 

No, retailers don’t need to participate for you to be using round-ups. It’s completely retailer agnostic, which means that wherever you shop using a card connected to Sustainably, your round-ups will work. However, if a retailer is signed up to do-good matching on Sustainably you will get the benefit of match donations, which means that every time you shop at that retailer, they will give a donation to your chosen good causes. You will be able to see the amount matched by your retailer in your transaction history.

We think that life should have a bit of fun in it so that’s why we are working on getting the best rewards on our platform. With Sustainably, every time you do good, you get an impact point. Impact points can be used to cash in for rewards. Rewards are either products and services from retailers you love. These will appear in the rewards section of your profile, and you will be able to cash them in either online or in-store at our retail partners.

Every time you donate on Sustainably you get an impact point. You also get impact points every time a retailer or business match donates with you. And you can cash them in for rewards.  By accumulating impact points, you can track your impact over time and have fun spending them on things you love.  

Fun Raising is a way for you to get your community or friends to donate to your good causes through their round ups or by giving instant happiness.  Just set up a fun-raiser by choosing your good cause and sharing it with your friends.

No. You can only donate to a charity or non-profit that is available on our platform. We’re adding new good causes every day. If there is a cause you want to be added, email us at causes@sustainably.co with their website address and contact details and we’ll do our best to get them on board.  Our aim to get all registered charities on the platform.

If you're worried you'll be spending too much without realising you can simply put a cap on your monthly donations to avoid this. You can also pause your account in the app instantly.

Businesses are important members of any community, so we want to get them involved. With Sustainably, employers and retailers can sign up to match donate with their customers and employees and offer rewards. This is a great way for you to benefit from increased donations to your good causes as well as receive fun and interesting rewards for doing good from Sustainably's partner organisations. In exchange for matching donations, we show businesses anonymised aggregated data on the causes their customers and employees care about to help them with their corporate social responsibility programmes.  We will never share personal information.

Yes, employers and retailers need to be signed up to the platform in order for you to get match donations. You can search for businesses on Sustainably to see which ones are participating. Match donating will show on their profile page.

If you are match donating with your employer and retailers they will not be able to access your personal information. Employers and retailers will get access to aggregated anonymous data on the causes their employees and customers care about and will be invoiced monthly or quarterly to match their donations. 

If your employer is signed up to Sustainably's match donating you can request a unique code from your employer in your app. Your employer will validate you and you will be sent a code in your app. Once you add the code, you're set up to receive employer match donations anonymously. 

Retailers can match donate with their customers. This will happen automatically if you buy from a retailer who is signed up to Sustainably.

Employers and retailers can set a cap on how much they match donate on behalf of each customer or employee and set parameters on certain types of causes they may not wish to support (religion or political, for example). You will see the amount retailers and employers have donated on your behalf in your transaction feed.  If your employer is also a retailer, the higher amount of match donating will apply, as some businesses may set different limits on how much they want to match donate with customers vs employees.

Instant happiness allows you to give instantly without giving out your personal details if you see something that inspires you.  Just choose your cause and the amount - and you're done! 

Sustainably's 100x range is a range of good causes that make a bigger impact for every £1  of $1 donated. Sustainably works with independent partners to select its 100x range.

Sustainably is PCI compliant, and complies with ICO standards.

Yes, all donations to charities are tax-deductible.  In the UK, we will reclaim gift aid and distribute it to your chosen charities.  Simply tick the gift aid box if you are a UK taxpayer and qualify for gift aid when you're setting up your Sustainably account. You will be able to export your transactions to claim tax deductions from the app.

Sustainably will accept all major credit and debit cards.

Yes, you need to have a round-ups account with Sustainably in order to donate. Choose your good causes, add a credit or debit card in our app and provide payment details in order to set up your account. Once you have a round-ups account you can also give instant happiness and set up a fun-raiser.

Sustainably takes a 5% fee from gift aid to manage the platform. So for every £1 you donate, you give £1.25 and Sustainably retains 6p to cover all the costs involved with running the platform from the awesome developers to the inspiring designers and content creators.  If you don't qualify for gift aid Sustainably will take 5p from every £1 to manage the platform.

Charities benefit by getting access to a new audience of supporters who want to have an impact every day. Sustainably connects charities with their supporters in real time - every time a charity receives a donation, the Sustainably platform enables them to send supporters a real-time update telling them what's happening that day with their donation. This helps charities be more transparent and build relationships with their supporters.  They do not get access to repeat contact you after you donate and we do not pass on your personal details to them.

We aggregate supporter money and send one payment to every charity each month.

No, Sustainably itself isn't a charity. It is set up as a Limited Company. But donations can only go to registered charities and not for profits, which is why we vet all our charity and not for profits before adding them to the platform.

You have to be 18 use Sustainably at present.  

Sustainably is not a replacement for other forms of giving. Sustainably provides an alternative as a new way of living and giving. By giving micro-donations as part of your everyday life, every time you make a purchase you can have an impact. This means you're joining a community of change-makers, turning small change into BIG change every day.

You probably won't notice the spare change, but the good causes you support definitely will. And with Sustainably, you have total privacy, transparency and complete control. No more unwanted direct mail, phone calls and text. And you can pause it or change it all at any time in your app. 

Every time you donate or receive a match donation, you get an impact point which you can use to cash in for rewards from our partner organisations. You also get an instant update from your good cause telling you what's happening with your money that day and you can track the impact you're having over time.

Get in touch

Please ensure you've read our FAQ before contacting us!

Backers: indiegogo@sustainbly.co

Business Enquiries: business@sustainably.co

Press Enquiries: press@sustainably.co

Charities and not-for-profits: causes@sustainably.co

Thanks for taking the time to check out Sustainably! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.

#GetSomeGiveSome

@GiveSustainably on Twitter

@SustainablyCo on Facebook

Please visit our website and sign up at www.sustainably.co

Loral & Eishel

Our partners & supporters:

£50 first access to the app when it is ready
£100 - Exclusive invite to a Sustainably  'round table' - focusing on issues such as the future of giving and issues in the charity sector
£200 - Invite to Sustainably launch party
£250 - Invite to Sustainably launch party and a pre-launch drinks reception
As the campaign continues, we will be adding stretch goals! We are Sustainably, a platform to inspire sustainable living and giving.We want to shape the world we want to live in by creating a platform for inspiring change. Through building a community of change-makers, together we will uncover, share, and scale up the pace of change for a future we want to live in and make lives better for today and for a better world tomorrow.Sustainably is a lifestyle choice - a new way of living and giving. And we want to celebrate all of you who are doing amazing things, (no matter how small or big) to help society and the environment thrive.We want to help you share your story and listen to others, and make our voices heard, to help spread awareness faster and give people access to the information they have been deprived of.We can use the power of our voices, and our daily choices, to create the kind of future we want to live in.  Together we can create a better world.By connecting your credit and debit cards in our app, you allow us to track your transactions. By signing up to round-ups, you give us permission to round-up your spare change and give it to the causes of your choice every time you make a transaction using your cards or connected devices.  To set up round-ups, select a good cause you want to support, and add the credit or debit card you wish to connect to your account. Then every time you shop on that credit or debit card or a connected device linked to it, you allow us to donate a round-up to your good causes.  Sustainably takes a 5% fee from gift aid to manage the platform. So if you are a UK taxpayer for every £1 you donate, you actually give £1.25 and Sustainably retains 6p, so a total of £1.19 will go to your charity.  The 6p is used to cover all the costs involved with running the platform from the awesome developers to the inspiring designers and content creators.  As a founders pledge, 10% of any profits made will go to the Sustainably Foundation which will support our '100x' and 'staff picks' causes. No, retailers don’t need to participate for you to be using round-ups. It’s completely retailer agnostic, which means that wherever you shop using a card connected to Sustainably, your round-ups will work. However, if a retailer is signed up to do-good matching on Sustainably you will get the benefit of match donations, which means that every time you shop at that retailer, they will give a donation to your chosen good causes. You will be able to see the amount matched by your retailer in your transaction history.We think that life should have a bit of fun in it so that’s why we are working on getting the best rewards on our platform. With Sustainably, every time you do good, you get an impact point. Impact points can be used to cash in for rewards. Rewards are either products and services from retailers you love. These will appear in the rewards section of your profile, and you will be able to cash them in either online or in-store at our retail partners.Every time you donate on Sustainably you get an impact point. You also get impact points every time a retailer or business match donates with you. And you can cash them in for rewards.  By accumulating impact points, you can track your impact over time and have fun spending them on things you love.  Fun Raising is a way for you to get your community or friends to donate to your good causes through their round ups or by giving instant happiness.  Just set up a fun-raiser by choosing your good cause and sharing it with your friends.No. You can only donate to a charity or non-profit that is available on our platform. We’re adding new good causes every day. If there is a cause you want to be added, email us at causes@sustainably.co with their website address and contact details and we’ll do our best to get them on board.  Our aim to get all registered charities on the platform.If you're worried you'll be spending too much without realising you can simply put a cap on your monthly donations to avoid this. You can also pause your account in the app instantly.Businesses are important members of any community, so we want to get them involved. With Sustainably, employers and retailers can sign up to match donate with their customers and employees and offer rewards. This is a great way for you to benefit from increased donations to your good causes as well as receive fun and interesting rewards for doing good from Sustainably's partner organisations. In exchange for matching donations, we show businesses anonymised aggregated data on the causes their customers and employees care about to help them with their corporate social responsibility programmes.  We will never share personal information.Yes, employers and retailers need to be signed up to the platform in order for you to get match donations. You can search for businesses on Sustainably to see which ones are participating. Match donating will show on their profile page.If you are match donating with your employer and retailers they will not be able to access your personal information. Employers and retailers will get access to aggregated anonymous data on the causes their employees and customers care about and will be invoiced monthly or quarterly to match their donations. If your employer is signed up to Sustainably's match donating you can request a unique code from your employer in your app. Your employer will validate you and you will be sent a code in your app. Once you add the code, you're set up to receive employer match donations anonymously. Retailers can match donate with their customers. This will happen automatically if you buy from a retailer who is signed up to Sustainably.Employers and retailers can set a cap on how much they match donate on behalf of each customer or employee and set parameters on certain types of causes they may not wish to support (religion or political, for example). You will see the amount retailers and employers have donated on your behalf in your transaction feed.  If your employer is also a retailer, the higher amount of match donating will apply, as some businesses may set different limits on how much they want to match donate with customers vs employees.Instant happiness allows you to give instantly without giving out your personal details if you see something that inspires you.  Just choose your cause and the amount - and you're done! Sustainably's 100x range is a range of good causes that make a bigger impact for every £1  of $1 donated. Sustainably works with independent partners to select its 100x range.Sustainably is PCI compliant, and complies with ICO standards.Yes, all donations to charities are tax-deductible.  In the UK, we will reclaim gift aid and distribute it to your chosen charities.  Simply tick the gift aid box if you are a UK taxpayer and qualify for gift aid when you're setting up your Sustainably account. You will be able to export your transactions to claim tax deductions from the app.Sustainably will accept all major credit and debit cards.Yes, you need to have a round-ups account with Sustainably in order to donate. Choose your good causes, add a credit or debit card in our app and provide payment details in order to set up your account. Once you have a round-ups account you can also give instant happiness and set up a fun-raiser.Sustainably takes a 5% fee from gift aid to manage the platform. So for every £1 you donate, you give £1.25 and Sustainably retains 6p to cover all the costs involved with running the platform from the awesome developers to the inspiring designers and content creators.  If you don't qualify for gift aid Sustainably will take 5p from every £1 to manage the platform.Charities benefit by getting access to a new audience of supporters who want to have an impact every day. Sustainably connects charities with their supporters in real time - every time a charity receives a donation, the Sustainably platform enables them to send supporters a real-time update telling them what's happening that day with their donation. This helps charities be more transparent and build relationships with their supporters.  They do not get access to repeat contact you after you donate and we do not pass on your personal details to them.We aggregate supporter money and send one payment to every charity each month.No, Sustainably itself isn't a charity. It is set up as a Limited Company. But donations can only go to registered charities and not for profits, which is why we vet all our charity and not for profits before adding them to the platform.You have to be 18 use Sustainably at present.  Sustainably is not a replacement for other forms of giving. Sustainably provides an alternative as a new way of living and giving. By giving micro-donations as part of your everyday life, every time you make a purchase you can have an impact. This means you're joining a community of change-makers, turning small change into BIG change every day.You probably won't notice the spare change, but the good causes you support definitely will. And with Sustainably, you have total privacy, transparency and complete control. No more unwanted direct mail, phone calls and text. And you can pause it or change it all at any time in your app. Every time you donate or receive a match donation, you get an impact point which you can use to cash in for rewards from our partner organisations. You also get an instant update from your good cause telling you what's happening with your money that day and you can track the impact you're having over time.Get in touchPlease ensure you've read our FAQ before contacting us!Backers: indiegogo@sustainbly.coBusiness Enquiries: business@sustainably.coPress Enquiries: press@sustainably.coCharities and not-for-profits: causes@sustainably.coThanks for taking the time to check out Sustainably! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.#GetSomeGiveSome@GiveSustainably on Twitter@SustainablyCo on FacebookPlease visit our website and sign up at www.sustainably.coLoral & EishelOur partners & supporters:

story:
We are a group of filmmakers from across the country who have joined together to bring this amazingly awesome film to life! 

Our kickass Director of Photography, Joel Hodge, is a master behind the lens. He shot the indie sensation Bellflower  which was accepted into SXSW and the Sundance Film Festival and went on to win multiple awards at various film festivals across the country. He was also the Director of Photography for the upcoming action-fiesta Chuck Hank and the San Diego Twins from Coatwolf Productions.

Last year, our Writer and Director, L.J. Dougherty, released his debut feature The Cylinder (now streaming on Amazon) - a darkly comedic tale about a group of modern-day duelists. L.J.'s previous screenplays have ranked high in competitions including the esteemed Austin Film Festival.

Hugo Velazquez, owner of Hugo V Photography has also come on board as a Technical Adviser. Hugo's stunning photography work has been featured in Inked Magazine, Inked Girls, Tattoo'd Lifestyle, and many more from around the world.

Along with the rest of the talented crew, we are determined to breathe life into Buzzard Gulch, the suspenseful tale of things gone wrong- or should we say, terribly wrong. We plan to showcase the gorgeous and highly underutilized scenery of Colorado, from it's purple mountains to it's dusty plains.

BUT without your help we CANNOT achieve this goal.

   

 

Buzzard Gulch is a sun bleached, suspense thriller that's gonna send your brain through a labyrinth full of twists, turns and ultra steep drops.

It's a Rural Noir tale about  a fashion photographer working on a portfolio called Murder-Site Modeling. He’s traveling the mid-west and tracing the trail of an infamous serial killer from the 80’s and reenacting the murders at the crime scenes with a tattooed, alternative Model in place of the victim.

When they reach the town of Buzzard Gulch, the site of the third murder, the townsfolk take offense to the Photographer’s lurid project and attempt to run him and his crew out of town. But things go horribly wrong when someone gets killed, forcing the Photographer and his team to fight for their lives to escape Buzzard Gulch alive!

Here's the deal:

Sure, pretty much anyone can shoot a movie with no money and an iphone these days- and our team consists of experts at low-budget film making who've done projects just like that- but we don't want to sacrifice the quality of this film.

To accomplish our epic action sequences, steep drops, and high octane thrills we need some more cash so we can make them look as legit and badass as they deserve to be! 

And that's where you all come in!

With the $30k we raise from this campaign, we will be able to make this movie totally epic! We promise you that every dollar you donate will end up on-screen, and the more we surpass our $30k goal, the better the overall film will be.  

 

To thank you for helping us make this crazy film for you to enjoy, we're going to give you some really cool perks in return, such as:

  • Digital download of the film
  • An autographed Blu-ray or DVD of the film
  • Exclusive shirts and zip-up hoodies
  • Special "Thank You" in the end credits
  • Set visits
  • A coffee table book of all the incredible Storyboards (illustrated by our own Joel Hodge)
  • Tickets to the premiere!
  • An Executive Producer credit in the film's title sequence! 
  • And Much More

What's cooler than that?! 

Don't have the ability to donate any money to our campaign? We get it. BUT there are other ways you can help support us!

Just spread the word about this amazing film with your friends and family. Posting a link to our campaign on your social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) goes a really long way in reaching people who otherwise might not hear about us and what we're trying to do. Just Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update.

  • Share the link to this page with everyone you know!
  • Follow us on Twitter at: https://twitter.com/strandedfoxprod and use the hashtag #BuzzardGulch to spread the word about our kickass film.
  • Follow/Share/Like us on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/strandedfoxproductions
  • Follow/Like us on Instagram at: https//www.instagram.com/strandedfox

Be loud! Tell your co-workers! Tell your followers! Tell the rando that you meet at the table next to you while your having dinner! Tell everyone you see that you've heard about the coolest film being shot in 2017!

story:
Introduction

Hello! We are Morgan Alise James and Marco Thoma. Two friends who created Talk to the Sun Entertainment. We began this film production company so that we can write, cast, build, and shoot films we love. We truly hope that you will love them too. We are artists. musicians, and filmmakers working together to create inspiring work and just have fun... because life is short.

"Prick" is a short film about a vigilante martial arts expert named Porcupine who attempts to foil the plans of an ultra vein mass murderer named Hedge Hog who is dead set on blinding the city. This clever script includes martial arts action, superhero themes, strong female leads, and classic comic book campiness.

"Prick" is very important to us as we hope to gain some recognition for our work through festivals, etc., and be able to fund our next project, which will fund the next, and so on. We love making movies. We will continue creating films and we hope you will join us in our journey.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have broken down our current needs to these areas: Props, Costumes and Set Production $1600, Cast & Crew + Meals $1100, Festival Submissions & Marketing $600, Gifts including Posters, Collector's Plaques, "Prick" DVDs $700

We can't wait to create these incredible Collector's Plaques which contain a one of a kind weapon/prop and a photo from the film! Also a beautiful movie poster which features our incredible cast and will be autographed by each. And of course, the actual DVD of our film so you can enjoy the adventure that will be... "Prick"

 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post on your social media and also with your friends and family.

story:
SUMMARY OF SHOPPING SPREE

Shopping Spree is a dark comedy about a killer on the loose in the supermarket ‘Ez Mart’. The 7 survivors are rushed into the manager’s office where they realize the killer is amongst them. The story follows a ‘whodunit’ type of play, where each character is equally a suspect, taking turns to blame one another for the killings.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

As struggling students, money is very scarce, a notable sum has already been funded from our own pockets. Sadly, the amount does not cover all of the expenses, making it hard for us to realize our film. The challenges we are faced with are, feeding a large crew & cast department of over 30 people and counting, as well as accommodation costs for our actors. With your help and support, we can allocate the funds to these struggling areas as well as the art department which is trying its utmost to help bring the realism to its uppermost. Filming for long hours in the night into the early hours of the next day is tiring and good catering helps boost everyone’s spirits!

The Impact

As young filmmakers, this project is our opportunity to create a film where we show and test our accumulated experience and knowledge, as well as help, break the stereotypes of student films. Our top priority, however, is to create something that both the audience and we as filmmakers can enjoy together.

Meet the incredible team working on Shopping Spree.

Actors Working on Shopping Spree

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word about our film, tell your friends, family, and loved ones, share it on social sites. Use the share tools above to help us out, or by spreading the following our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/ShoppingSpreeFilm

Every share helps and is much appreciated, thank you for supporting Shopping-Spree :)

story:
WHO (us!), WHAT (the movie!), WHERE (the world!), WHY (we need you!), HOW (give/get!)

MANSFIELD 66/67 is our fourth feature documentary -- following HIT SO HARD, ROOM 237 and DEAR MOM LOVE CHER -- and it is the biggest labor of love The Ebersole Hughes Company (i.e. US! www.ebersolehughes.com) has ever made. 

The logline, so you know what we've done: MANSFIELD 66/67 (i.e. THE MOVIE! www.mansfield6667.com ) is about the last two years of movie goddess Jayne Mansfield’s life, and the rumours swirling around her untimely death being caused by a curse, after her alleged romantic dalliance with Anton LaVey, head of the Church of Satan. It's "a true story based on rumour and hearsay," celebrating Jayne's life on the 50th anniversary of her death.

We've been obsessed with telling this story for 20 years and now...we have used all of our blood, sweat, tears and time to craft a documentary we are really proud of...

But don't take our word for it! Watch the trailers: http://www.mansfield6667.com/trailer.html

Our World Premiere was at The Rotterdam International Film Festival, a truly top-tier event. (https://iffr.com/en/2017/films/mansfield-66-67) We were picked up by a world class international sales agent who are actively selling it to buyers. (i.e. THE WORLD!) All very exciting but...

Now the challenge is two-fold: to tie up final loose ends so the film is literally sellable, and also to help the film stand out in a crowded field of amazing indie films so the world can even find it. This summer we continue our festival run, with screenings in Buenos Aires, Toronto, Provincetown, San Francisco, London, and more...

That's where you come in! (i.e. WE NEED YOU!)

But we hate to ask for something without giving back (i.e. GIVE/GET!), so we created a limited edition hot pink colored-vinyl LP of our amazing soundtrack as a perk for donating to the project.

And wait that's not all! The amazing artist Shag donated art work for our poster and is letting us offer items here too.

And we are parting with a few of our beloved Jayne and Anton items that we have collected over the years. Some pictured here, and of course there are more items not pictured...

What We Need & What You Get

What we are up against, after putting literally everything we've got into making the movie, are the final unavoidable costs that bring the film to market where companies around the world can hopefully see it, love it, and pick it up for distribution. 

We've set our goal at $15,000 and honestly that barely covers all the myriad of things (OMG international shipping is murderous!) that keep adding up to just get the film OUT THERE! In brief, your donations will help us cover:

• our LEGAL costs ("fair use" docs like ours need lawyers to approve every single shot, every single photo)

• our MUSIC (mostly original but a couple songs need to be paid for to be able to have them stay in the film)

• last remaining LICENSING costs (with nearly 1000 images in the movie not everything falls under Fair Use)

• E&O INSURANCE (gotta have it to even sell the film)

• final PRINTS (a thousand a pop and you need two in Europe and two in the US at minimum)

• our FESTIVAL PR (including a publicist, trailers, posters, postcards, and on and on)

• DELIVERY costs, which means the money we have to lay out of pocket to "deliver" the film when each new company is buying it and requiring that we meet their specs

At this point, supporting the project equals immediate gratification because it literally means helping us to bring it to audiences, sooner, bigger, better, and more-wide spread. Unlike a lot of crowdfunding campaigns, we don't need to get this film in the can...we need to get it out of the computer!!

So, give a little (everything is appreciated), give a lot, or, you know, just give us some love...we need all of that we can get!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:Get the word out! Make some noise about our campaign! Any link to your world of contacts is appreciated more than you can possibly know.
  • Don't have a record player? No wall space? Don't like collectibles, t-shirts or Playboy Magazines? Give a gift to a friend! Or if you don't want any stuff, you can just hit the BACK IT button at the top of this page and do just that...

Meet The Filmmakers!

Finally...Meet The Cast!

THAT'S IT! NOW, LET'S DANCE!

And we are parting with a few of our beloved Jayne and Anton items that we have collected over the years. Some pictured here, and of course there are more items not pictured...



What We Need & What You Get
What we are up against, after putting literally everything we've got into making the movie, are the final unavoidable costs that bring the film to market where companies around the world can hopefully see it, love it, and pick it up for distribution. 
We've set our goal at $15,000 and honestly that barely covers all the myriad of things (OMG international shipping is murderous!) that keep adding up to just get the film OUT THERE! In brief, your donations will help us cover:
• our LEGAL costs ("fair use" docs like ours need lawyers to approve every single shot, every single photo)
• our MUSIC (mostly original but a couple songs need to be paid for to be able to have them stay in the film)
• last remaining LICENSING costs (with nearly 1000 images in the movie not everything falls under Fair Use)
• E&O INSURANCE (gotta have it to even sell the film)
• final PRINTS (a thousand a pop and you need two in Europe and two in the US at minimum)
• our FESTIVAL PR (including a publicist, trailers, posters, postcards, and on and on)
• DELIVERY costs, which means the money we have to lay out of pocket to "deliver" the film when each new company is buying it and requiring that we meet their specs
At this point, supporting the project equals immediate gratification because it literally means helping us to bring it to audiences, sooner, bigger, better, and more-wide spread. Unlike a lot of crowdfunding campaigns, we don't need to get this film in the can...we need to get it out of the computer!!
So, give a little (everything is appreciated), give a lot, or, you know, just give us some love...we need all of that we can get!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:Get the word out! Make some noise about our campaign! Any link to your world of contacts is appreciated more than you can possibly know.
Don't have a record player? No wall space? Don't like collectibles, t-shirts or Playboy Magazines? Give a gift to a friend! Or if you don't want any stuff, you can just hit the BACK IT button at the top of this page and do just that...


Meet The Filmmakers!



Finally...Meet The Cast!





THAT'S IT! NOW, LET'S DANCE!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Zephyr Khambatta and I make music for a living.

I have spent the last three years working with countless amateur, semi-professional, and professional musicians, learning about what it takes to produce original music commercially. Before that, I did a 4 year long music degree.

I want to make as much music as I can in my lifetime that talks about life and helps people with their own lives, be it for a moment of dancing happiness, a week of mourning a lost one, or joy/sympathy forever on their travel playlists in their collections.

Donating to my music video(s) will help to crystallise the message I send with each song, and more importantly, reach the under-privileged, or not very well educated people in both developing and under developed countries as a YouTube link can be quite easily pulled up by anyone. Services and apps like Spotify, iTunes etc? Not so much. Even my own maid is a YouTube pro!!! :)  My aim is to reach everyone, regardless of their social standing or income or knowledge of electronics, and after a large amount of research I think YouTube would be the way (for now at least, till the next big video platform comes along).

What We Need & What You Get

I have saved up (and am still saving) almost every dollar I earn except for meals and travel, and still don't have enough to make a great video by a great team I have picked in LA, USA.

Every dollar helps, but if you donate upwards of 250, I'll put your name or your company name at the start of the video (we can discuss that)!

If the dollar amount is not reached, I will continue to add to it with my own savings of course, as I get more jobs in acting, advertisements, and of course MUSIC! I will not be compromising the quality of the video so the video will get made, only once the amount is reached.

The Impact

I truly believe that music can and will make the world a better place and has already been doing so. Not to mention dance, and all the other performing and visual arts. Congratulations and thank you to everyone who uses arts to impact the world in a positive way!

My portfolio is available upon request, to let you know of my pursuits in the music world.

In the pipeline is a vision for an inspirational entity, which will help people in various ways across the globe. What will accelerate that, is my music getting known. And for that, we arrive back at the same place. Videos.

Risks & Challenges

The income in this industry is not guaranteed. You might be shocked to hear what some musicians make in a month.

My plan to turn this around, at least in Singapore, involves setting up a brilliantly run record label, in due course, Reunion X Records.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really cannot afford a single dollar at this point, that's fine, I understand and I would ask you to help by just sharing the campaign! That would help a lot. Alternatively, you could just share my music. Add it to your Spotify, Tidal and other streaming services' playlists and paste the YouTube links around, after you watch videos.

If 2000 people donate just one dollar each, we'll be there in no time. A dollar isn't a lot. Really.

And that's all there is to it :) 

Thanks for reading!

story:
Clouded Sight Pictures

Clouded Sight Pictures Ltd was set up two years ago by David Christopher-Turner and Alex De Luca in order to make the films that excite them, and a documentary called "Independent Dreams" has been made about their journey so far, which gets its release early in 2017. Since founding the company Clouded Sight Pictures it has gone from strength to strength, and are now in a position to rock and roll. So, with all due haste they have assembled a crack film crew of industry professionals, with a single goal, make a ‘Science Fiction’ film that will go toe to toe with the big boys.

‘Following the TruFors’ is a film that follows several people, as they each grapple with the result of their alien encounters. To which they form the group known as "The TruFors". They are the same as anyone else, but there is a difference in them that no one can quite put their finger on. Now, exactly one year later, they are being drawn back to the exact same place they had their first encounter.

We are looking for funding in order to pay our crew, and actors (at the very least we want to cover their expenses), not to mention locations, and the myriad of other costs that rear their head during any production. With that in mind, we have got some absolutely brilliant perks available. It will be used to bring the truth to the public, the truth that has been kept from us all!! Why do aliens have hairbrushes? What the hell is that green goo? And of course to fund the directors Winnebago, and the 1st AD's unhealthy obsession with ‘Jammie Dodgers’ (standard).

The Trufors

The real UFO receivers society,  a group of people who share an experience.

Lucius - played by Mark Hindman-Smith

Michael - played by David Crellin

Saphron & Gray -  Megan Relph and Yas Rehman

Podcast - The TruFors -Lucius

CBTV

Conspiracy Britain TV is the brain child of James Moore, always looking to discredit any claims that Aliens actually exist.   Will James be convinced this time?

 

Some of the lovely Perks available

A limited edition, yes there are only 10 of them.  Old school hand crafted versions of our poster, signed by none other than David Crellin himself

Or perhaps a limited edition print of some set art again designed by our very own David Crellin

Hand crafted Alien ornaments, Saphron makes these, her hand guided by a strange intelligence

On a serious note....

All contributors over £5 will receive a personal invite from the producers to attend the exclusive premiere of the film upon its a release.

story:
Synopsis

Jess, in her early 20s brings home her new boyfriend, Rob. He’s a bit reclusive but he tries. Jess lives with her father, Chris, a 40-year-old friendly man who just wants Rob to feel comfortable.

Their home is kept as clean as possible, it’s your standard home, pictures of family around, decorative pieces along shelves, books, paintings. Not a speck of dust anywhere.

As Jess and Rob walk past the living room a news report can be heard in passing of a young woman’s disappearance, another in a long line around the area. 

Chris asks Rob if he wants to have steak with them that night, however Rob no longer eats meat. During the conversation, Chris and Rob share a look that lingers a fraction too long. Rob glances away shyly.

After the meal, in which Chris had merely prepared some vegetables for Rob, Rob is washing up the plates and is fixated on the blood from the steaks swirling into the water in the sink.

We now find ourselves in a dark, damp basement. Knives and all sorts of horrific tools are lying about. A young woman is chained upside down naked from the ceiling. She struggles as a dark figure approaches. He slits her throat, the blood gushing over her face.

This figure turns out to be Chris who then proceeds to butcher and mutilate the corpse. Eventually biting into the flesh he has torn from her body.

This is intercut with a scene of Jess and Rob having intercourse wherein Jess is the dominant side even when Rob attempts to gain control she hits him. As she climaxes she bites into his shoulder, taking a large chunk and drawing a lot of blood. Rob screams. Chris can hear the scream and rushes upstairs to see what’s going on.

Chris enters Jess’ room and asks what has happened. Rob explains. However, Rob notices the blood on Chris’ clothing and around his mouth. Jess too still has blood around her mouth.

Chris grabs Rob and sedates him with a syringe he had been hiding.

They drag Rob downstairs to the basement, chain him up and Chris allows Jess to do the honours saying “Now, just how daddy taught you”.

She slices Rob’s throat and relishes in what she has just done.

 

Meet the team!

Jack Roper - Writer/Director

A fairly normal person even though this whole crazy film is his idea! Has written and directed other similar films. Is currently studying Directing & Producing at Arts University Bournemouth. Has worked as Producer, 1st AD, Script Supervisor on a magnitude of other films. As well as acting in plenty of others and is always trying to push the boundaries even though they sometimes push back!

Julia Alcamo - Producer

Julia is currently studying her Masters in Film Production at the Arts University Bournemouth. Producing fiction is a passion that she pursues alongside her primary work in documentary filmmaking. Julia has worked on film content for the digital humanities project Things We Keep at King’s College London. Whilst studying her BA in Film Studies, she was chosen to take part in the Live Art and Filmmaking workshop at Tate London, exploring the relationship between dance and film editing. With an eclectic background in the arts, she works to integrate her experiences from the dance, art and photography worlds into her role as film producer.

Hollie Mapp - Director of Photography

An eye for the sublime. Our incredibly talented DP will gift this film with a touch of something special. Making it stand out visually and allowing it's visual style to draw you, the lovely viewer, into a world of manipulation, sex and violence. Excited yet? Currently studying and specialising in Cinematography at AUB. We'd be blind without her, literally!

Aaron Rolfe - Production Designer

Currently studying Film Production at AUB and specialising in Production Design. Having worked closely with the director on the aestethics, the look of the film is in great hands. As well as being handy at building our props he'll be making sure the knives are all lined up and ready for Chris!

 

Alec Baldwin - Sound Recordist

Experienced with sound recording, having worked on several films previously, all having clear quality. He is currently studying Film Production at AUB (Arts University Bournemouth) specialising in Editing and Sound. Alec really enjoys capturing sound and has found that recording is a creative way of bringing action and emotions into the films soundscape. His favourite genre is dark comedies. No relation to the actor.

Liam Gilheany - Sound Designer

You could say he has an ear for sound design! (I'm so sorry). Currently specialising in Sound at AUB. He has a natural gift when it comes to sound. He knows how to make a film pop! He'll bring this film to life with foley, atmospheric sounds so much so you won't even notice if he's done his job at all. An essential assest to the team!

 

Of course there are many more people involved with the making of this film, too many to list right now but you'll catch everyone's names in the credits. Each member of the crew on board is as important as the next without them this film couldn't happen. The same can be said about you! So...

 

Why do we need $$$$

Simply put making films isn't cheap. We need your help to make this film happen. The money raised will go to paying our extrodinarily talented actors for their time and to our stunt coordinator for making sure our actor's are safe whilst they're strung upside down! Part of the funds will also go on our locations and gear.

There'll be rewards for your donations! A digital copy of the film upon it's completion (so you don't have to wait whilst it's doing it's rounds at festivals before you get to watch it!), posters and if you donate enough we'll even bring you onto set and string you upside down to film your own death scene! (If you're into that sort of thing)

As with any film there are hurdles to over come during the production process. Right now we have our crew but we're lacking in the locations! Health and safety wise we want our actors to be safe on set, especially when upside down. So, we need a stunt coordinator. All these things cost money.

That's where you come in.

You can make this film happen with just a small donation or if you can't afford to donate (I know that feel) simply share this around with your friends, family and other film fanatics!

Let's make a film to remember x

story:
Summary

With more than 22 years of combined experience in the entertainment industry, the directors and producers of this project bring a unique eye and vision to an old favorite.  We are passionate about film and aim to produce nothing less than Hollywood, theater quality level projects.  Our passion are horror, suspense, and psychological thrillers.  Because we love the genres so much, we won’t stop until we can produce projects that are mistaken for high-budget, Hollywood films.

We can achieve our objective with your help, through your contributions.  It all starts with our cast (talent).  The range in the talent of our cast is what will make this project a success.  The crew is a close-close second.  Without an experienced director of photography, director, and editor, we don’t have a project of which you are proud to say you supported.

You get what you pay for, right?  Help us achieve our objective by helping us pay for the level of talent you deserve to see in this short.  Help us honor the genre and produce a Hollywood quality short that will make the hairs on your arms stand on end.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for only enough funding to pay our cast and to feed the cast and crew for our 3-day shoot.  We are investing in quality incentives to match the value of your contribution level.  We want to be certain you know how grateful we are for your support.  Check out our perks for your gift options.

In the unlikely event we do not meet our goal, 100% of the funds will go to pay our cast, no matter how small the paycheck.  We want them to know how much we appreciate them and their talent, and we want you to know how much we appreciate your support.  None of the crew will take any pay on this project, UNLESS we exceed our goal.  None of the “above line” crew will take pay UNTIL the entire cast & crew are paid!

Challenges

Our greatest challenge in getting this short produced is bringing on highly talented cast members.  We are fortunate to know some very talented actors who want to come on board.  They might be willing to do this one short for us for no pay but we want to keep them on board for future projects.  The only way we can guarantee they will continue to work with us is to pay them for their service.

Everyone, in any industry, expects to be paid for a service they provide.  Actors and crew in the film industry are no exception to that expectation.  The adage “you get what you pay for” is nearly always true.  Some are willing to work for free or deferred pay for a project about which they are passionate and to help friends start a new company.  Asking anyone to work for free or deferred more than once is taking advantage and that is NOT how we want to be known.

While we have asked the talent and crew for this project to donate their time, we very much want to surprise them with a paycheck to thank them for their time and willingness to help us.  YOU can help us do that with your contribution.

More Ways You Can Help

We are low/no budget filmmakers…for the time being…so we certainly empathize with lack of funds.  You can still help!  Help us make some noise and direct traffic to our campaign.  Click or tap a share tool above and ask your followers to contribute and/or share, too.  The more people we can reach the better our odds of getting funded!

story:
Short Summary

 

The film revolves around siblings, Maddie and Sam, who return to their childhood home, and discover malevolent entities have manifested themselves within the home, and soon latch themselves onto the pair.

  • My name is Liam Shanahan. I'm currently studying filmmaking and television production at JMC Academy,
  • Our campaign here is to earn enough funding to film a quality horror film. As I'm a fan of the genre, making this project has been a passion for some time.
  • I believe any donations and contributions will be one step closer to helping our crew achieve this goal, as we aspire to bring audiences a professionally-made product.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Our goal here is to earn approximately $3000 in total for our film budget. This will go towards paying our actors, our crew members, such as production designers who wish to create an unnerving atmosphere for the audience, as well as location managers, who have sought out several potential locations for the film to be made, at a price, as well as catering to the cast and crew. 
  • We are willing to offer our contributors a visit to the set, a copy of the complete film, props from the set, such as a copy of the demonic painting, a thank-you credit, as well as placing a personal photograph in a scene.
  • All raised funds will ultimately go towards production design, location scouts, the actors, as well as catering.

The Impact

  • Our goal here is to create the scariest film we can deliver, and I believe that horror fans will want to see this project come to fruition, as we hope to deliver something they will love.

Risks & Challenges

* As aspiring filmmakers, this will be a great learning experience for us. We have a competent cast and crew who are qualified and eager for the experience to work on this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Feel free to spread the word about our film through Twitter, Facebook, etc. Any help is valuable and greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 
The film revolves around siblings, Maddie and Sam, who return to their childhood home, and discover malevolent entities have manifested themselves within the home, and soon latch themselves onto the pair.

My name is Liam Shanahan. I'm currently studying filmmaking and television production at JMC Academy,
Our campaign here is to earn enough funding to film a quality horror film. As I'm a fan of the genre, making this project has been a passion for some time.
I believe any donations and contributions will be one step closer to helping our crew achieve this goal, as we aspire to bring audiences a professionally-made product.


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

Our goal here is to earn approximately $3000 in total for our film budget. This will go towards paying our actors, our crew members, such as production designers who wish to create an unnerving atmosphere for the audience, as well as location managers, who have sought out several potential locations for the film to be made, at a price, as well as catering to the cast and crew. 
We are willing to offer our contributors a visit to the set, a copy of the complete film, props from the set, such as a copy of the demonic painting, a thank-you credit, as well as placing a personal photograph in a scene.
All raised funds will ultimately go towards production design, location scouts, the actors, as well as catering.


The Impact
Our goal here is to create the scariest film we can deliver, and I believe that horror fans will want to see this project come to fruition, as we hope to deliver something they will love.

Risks & Challenges* As aspiring filmmakers, this will be a great learning experience for us. We have a competent cast and crew who are qualified and eager for the experience to work on this project.
Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to spread the word about our film through Twitter, Facebook, etc. Any help is valuable and greatly appreciated.

story:
THE LEGEND OF VULPES

The legend of Wreathwood is reborn. Nobody has seen VULPES since 1996, the mysterious limping man who opposes animal abuse, the man who has punished and tortured 9 men that committed any crime against animals in the past. After the law revisioning animal protection has passed, he suddenly disappeared and believed to be dead for 20 years.

In 2017 a new video has spread through the internet. A Major who has been missing for days is being interrogated. The man has been accused of animal cruelty, and now he is publicly punished by a limping figure leaning on a walkingstick with a foxhead shaped hilt. He has returned after many years to raise awareness once again, Animal abuse is not something that you can get away with a fine or jail sentence.

 

WHO AM I?

I am Benjamin Helmeczi from Hungary. I love movies still my birth. This will be my second short film, the first one was an exam in school two years ago. It was an adaptation of O.Henry’s novel called The last leaf. With this short I won the first award of short film cathegory on a filmfestival in Hungary.

The last leaf IMDb page:

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt6163232/?ref_=fn_al_tt_2​

 

MY INSPIRATION

Animal abuse is always and still an actual problem in our world and there is no explicit legal punishment to fight against these people to drive them back. I think people like you and just like me often think that animal tortures would deserve the same thing what they do with the animals. And I was thinking about this: What if somebody comes and does what these people deserves.

X
by Counterflix
 
 
 
 
 

That’s how VULPES born. He’s not just a limping man with a walking-stick, he could be a symbol, the symbol of the fight against animal tortures. That’s my dream. I don’t need any prize or awards, I just want to show something new for the people, for the animal-lovers and for the film fans too, I want to put another milestone int he horror genre with VULPES.

MY PLANS AFTER THE MOVIE

With my small indie crew we always make an effort to create Hollywood quality products from low-budget just like in VULPES. After we finished the film I want to present it on festivals around the world and here in Hungary we will certainly have four audience meetings. And I know after te short film the audience wants to see the sequel, they want to see more of VULPES. Next comes the VULPES feature film. I want to expand this universe. First I want to win those trust who support me and join us.

ABOUT THE STYLE OF THE MOVIE

I think, in addition this movie's story has a serious message, it's no coincidence that I chose this genre. People are punished and killed in public. This can be described in a subtle manner, but it would lose its mood, its message, and the seriousness of the story. This film will be brutal in the sense that I will show all tortures and murders so realistic that the audience will really believe that I have killed this man. They will feel the pain, but they will not mourn the victim. In the first few minutes, the audience will hate the victim, they will accept VULPES's motivation and accept the destiny of the victim because they would do the same. I think everyone has VULPES personality. The embodiment of course human thoughts is VULPES. If you think this man deserves the same thing what he does with an animal, VULPES has spoken in you. In short, this movie will be a brutal psycho horror with a serious message and I guess VULPES can become a symbol. And I know this movie is an innovation in this genre. And I would like to more and more people could join this project and be part of this universe.

My IMDb page:

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8501870/?ref_=nv_sr_1

THEY'RE ALSO WITH US

Natasha Chisdes

Natasha Chisdes is a producer known for The Tale of the Three Thieves (2016), and Scout: A Star Wars Story (2017).

Emma Ve

Emma Ve is an actress, known for One Minute (2015), Pocket Sprite (2015) and Joint Body (2011).

Damia Torhagen

Damia Torhagen is an actress and producer, known for Ticklers (2013), Scattered (2016) and Zordon of Eltar (2015).

Chris Gierowski

Chris Gierowski is a producer and editor, known for The Bridge (2014), Grindsploitation (2016) and 60 Seconds to Die (2016).

Alex Mathieson

Alex Mathieson is a director and writer, known for The Tour (2014), Jitterman (2016) and Fused (2009).

Oscar Pavlo

Oscar Pavlo is an actor and a producer known for the Gotham TV Series (2017), and the Tissue (2014).

John J Jackson

John J Jackson is a producer known for the Cellar Secret (2016), The Basement (2017), and The Carnage Collection (2015).

story:
Short Summary

The film is about an escaped convict named Mason Parks who stumbles upon a small town, nestled in the wilderness of Idaho called Pinewood. Everyone in the town seems to be in a gleeful trance until Mason encounters Katie whose father was just brutally murdered by mysterious hillbillies in a beat up truck. The two of them team up to escape the killer mountain town, but encounter paranormal hurdles along the way.

Pinewood is a collaboration of Idaho filmmakers, created by Clear as Mudd Films in association with Northwest Motion Pictures and Tetro Productions. The film is shot entirely in the state of Idaho in support of local businesses and communities.

 

The Origins of Pinewood

Words from the Writer & Director, Matt Mudd

All of my screenplays come from my experiences. "Pinewood." Is  derived from a particularly important experience in my life. In 1994, my family went through a major tragedy...we lost my little sister. We were in McCall doing some volunteer work for the Girl Scout Camp. I was there when the accident happened. I was just 6 years old and the trauma has followed me into my adult life. I have developed PTSD from the event, which primarily manifests itself in very vivid nightmares. One such nightmare was the inspiration for this story. I was in McCall (though it was called something else in the dream)...and I was looking for my sister and younger brother. But, my efforts were futile. Upon trying to leave I realized that I couldn't get out. I was trapped, and isolated...which became the story's main themes. I thought a lot about it afterwards and realized that in that nightmare I felt like I was in my own version of hell and couldn't leave. Without giving too much away, much of what the main character, Mason experiences happened to me in that dream. And the major underlying story to "Pinewood," being trapped in a personal hell, surrounded by the demons of your past with no way out. Samantha has always been an inspiration in my writing but, this film has situations, characters and feelings associated with what I have dealt with since the tragedy. Writing this has been an extremely positive way to deal with the aftermath of this tragedy, which is why getting this film made right and sharing it with the world is so important to me. -Matt Mudd

 

What We Need:

  • pay for cast and crew
  • camera equipment package
  • wardrobe
  • special effects make up
  • location rental
  • craft services
  • cast and crew lodging
  • equipment & data storage
  • post-production services

 

What You Get:

  • $5 = A special thank you from the Pinewood team and a "crisp high-five" from the director, Matt Mudd.
  • $10 = Get a postcard from Pinewood, the fictional mountain town from the film, with thanks and an update from the set while shooting the movie.
  • $25 = Get your very own digital copy of the movie when it's released, along with a postcard from the cast & crew in Pinewood on set.
  • $40 = PINEWOOD Hat! Get your very own Limited Edition Pinewood hat, along with a digital copy of the film after the release and a postcard from the cast and crew while on the set of Pinewood.
  • $100 = PINEWOOD Premiere Pack! Get two tickets to the premiere of Pinewood, along with a Pinewood movie poster signed by the cast and crew and a digital copy of the film.
  • $150 = Screenplay signed by Matt Mudd! Get the Pinewood screenplay signed by the writer and director, Matt Mudd. You also get a digital copy of the film and your very own limited edition Pinewood hat.
  • $300 = Special Thanks from Set! Get a personalized thank you video from the cast and crew while on set of the film Pinewood. You'll also receive a special thanks credit in the film, two tickets to the Pinewood premiere, a limited edition Pinewood hat, and a digital download of the movie after the release.

- OR -

  • $300 = Local Business Product Spot! **Available to businesses in Idaho** We are offering product placement opportunities for local Idahoan businesses. That's right -- we'll put your business in the movie, Pinewood! We'll also send you two tickets to the premiere of Pinewood and a digital copy of the film after it's release.
  • $500 = Associate Producer Pack! Receive credit in the film as an Associate Producer. You'll also receive a personalized thank you video from the cast and crew on the set of Pinewood, two tickets to the movie premiere, digital download of the film, and a limited edition Pinewood hat.
  • $1,000 = Last Meal with the Cast & Crew! Get to know the folks behind the making of the film and join the cast and crew for their last meal on the set of Pinewood. You will also receive credit on the film as Associate Producer, two tickets to the movie premiere, a Pinewood movie poster signed by the cast and crew, and a digital download of the film after the release.
  • $2,500 = Executive Producer Pack! Get the Executive Producer Package for the full movie set experience! Come on set to observe the shooting process and receive executive producer credit in the film. You also have an invitation to join the cast and crew for the last dinner on set, two tickets to the premiere of the film, and much more!

 

Meet the Cast:

 

Todd M. Rich as Mason Parks

 

 
Jennifer Levy as Karen Ardell
 
 
 
Rob Namer as George Ardell
 
 

Chance Fuerstinger as Jimmy

 

Easton Dufur as Jethro

 

The Pinewood Crew:

 

Matt Mudd: Writer/Director/Producer (Clear as Mudd Films):

Matt started Clear as Mudd Films in 2009 with his brother, when they decided to take a home video camera and a group of friends out to the lake and shoot a short slasher film. Matt has consistently been working on narrative film projects ever since. Matt writes, directs and produces all of the projects the company works on and acts in some of them. "This project was inspired by a tragedy in my past. It is important to me. It will get made and it will get made right."

 

Jennifer Levy: Producer/ Exec. Producer/Locations Manager (Clear as Mudd Films):

Jennifer Levy is the Vice President at Clear as Mudd Films and has been a major part of every production since 2015 as cast, crew and producer. Jennifer brings a positive attitude and strong work ethic to any project she works on. Her colleagues often say the project wouldn't be the same without her. This is especially true of Pinewood. She is a major player in the success of this film, as she takes the lead on the production side of the film. 

 

Aaron Galaviz: Producer/ Production Designer (Clear as Mudd Films):

Aaron officially joined Clear as Mudd Films as its Creative Director in 2017. Aaron has, up to this point been an actor and loves the craft and working with Clear as Mudd Films. Because of that passion, he has decided to take a bigger role in the company and is also looking to expanding his experience in filmmaking to the "behind the camera," and creative aspects of making films. 

 

Michael Tetro: Director of Photography (Tetro Productions):

Michael has a powerful resume and a lot of experience in filmmaking. He has worked on many successful film projects. He works out of Boise Idaho, with, Tetro Productions and Synimatica. Michael brings a colorful passion and incredible work ethic to the team. 

 

Jessica Winfree: U.P.M./ 1st A.D. (Northwest Motion Pictures):

 

Brandon Freeman: Composer (Flying Fedora Film):

Brandon is a Boise powerhouse. Well- known and respected by the community, with a wide array of talents. One such talent is his ability to score a film and amp up the feeling it gives the audience. Much of the feeling and mood that surrounds Pinewood will be due to the music he creates for the film,
