story:
Short Summary

‘Anew’ is an indie dramatic short film, produced by Nightingale Films, a production company, founded by Shrey Bhargava, an actor and filmmaker from Singapore and a student at the University of Southern California's School of Dramatic Arts . The team behind ‘Anew’ is largely comprised of students attending USC’s School of Cinematic Arts.

The story behind ‘Anew’ is close to our hearts and was inspired by our own experiences of love. This film brought together people of different races and backgrounds who have experienced these same conflicts as the characters we too often see on screen. This film brought together a racially and culturally diverse team from distinct backgrounds, including the US, Singapore and Indonesia. Through this story, we hope to reveal how the human experience of love is universal, and transcends racial and cultural boundaries.

'Anew' follows a young man in his search for love while he struggles to let go of his previous relationship. His battle with coming to terms with his personal journey compels him to realize some difficult lessons about love.

With your support, we’ll be able to complete post production on this film - including music composition and sound design - and you’ll directly help us send it to festivals because most of them require significant entry fees.

The more help we get from you, the further this film will go.

 

 

If we reach our goal for ‘Anew’, we will be able to bring our ultimate vision for this film to life. To complement the pensive and contemplative story, we want to use live musicians to record the film’s score. The portion of our budget dedicated to music composition would go towards paying a composer,  instrumentalists, and an audio engineer. We also hope to hire an experienced sound designer who would be able to make the film sound as flawless as possible.

Among the film festivals we plan to submit this film to, are, most notably, The Asian American International Film Festival, The San Francisco International Asian American Film Festival and The Los Angeles Shorts International Film Festival.

Be assured, that even if we do not reach our goal, we will use whatever funding we do receive to complete the film and send it to as many film festivals as possible.

The Impact

Nightingale Films’ most recent work, a silent short film, ‘One Day’, featuring Bernard Dinata’s single ‘If I Don’t Remember’ can be found on https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=48FWZAZc8S8. It was made on a similar budget and Nightingale Films hopes to do an even better job with ‘Anew’.

Recently, our producer, Shrey, was placed in the spotlight in Singapore for drawing attention to the practices of casual racism and the stereotypical representation of minorities in Singaporean media. In response to his post, while many did support him and his message, many others were quick to denounce him, resorting to personal attacks and racial hate. Such a response has revealed a side of humanity that we may have thought was gone, but continues to exist just beneath the surface.

‘Anew’ is Shrey’s first attempt after the saga to tell stories that transcend these racial and cultural boundaries. ‘Anew’ explores the theme of love, a concept blind to color and background, a concept that binds us all as humans. With this film, we first hope to tell a real story that resonates with all. And second, we hope to show that this story can be told with actors irrespective of their color or background.

Your contribution will make this film a reality. It has already been filmed, and just needs your help for the final push in post production. After completing this film, any remaining contributions would go far in submitting this film to notable film festivals in the hopes of spreading this work and message out into the world.

You can help us make the statement that the only response to hate ought to be love, that our diversity ought to be represented on film as truly as possible in order to lift our social consciousness to realize that, despite our differences, we are all one, we are all human and we all go through the same human experiences. In the end, while this journey of love might be difficult, we ought to always pursue it with an open heart, even if we have to start anew.

Risks & Challenges

Since this project is in post production, we can guarantee that the film will be made. Your contributions will ensure that the post production process can reach its full potential and that the film can be submitted to festivals worldwide. You determine how far we can go and how far we can push this message.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute to our campaign, fret not!

SHARE this Indiegogo campaign with family and friends if you believe in our message and help us get the word out that this film is coming your way!

Check back on this page to stay updated on our progress and get excited for ‘Anew’! Also, subscribe to Nightingale Films’ youtube channel at youtube.com/nightingalefilm for our upcoming trailer as well as future films!

Thank you so much for your support :)

Check out stills from ‘Anew’ and meet our team below!

Stills:

Here are a few stills from our production of Anew!

Pictured: Megan Goodman

Pictured (left to right): Megan Goodman, Shrey Bhargava

Pictured (left to right): Celeste Tan, Shrey Bhargava

Pictured (left to right): Celeste Tan, Shrey Bhargava

About the Team:

Cast:

Shrey Bhargava/Egan

Celeste Tan/Alora

Megan Goodman/Ariel

Creative:

Shrey Bhargava - Producer/Writer/Actor

Shrey is an actor and filmmaker from Singapore. He is the founder of Nightingale Films, a youtube channel dedicated to making short films and a film production company. He graduated from Raffles Institution in 2013 after completing his A levels and is currently pursuing a BA in Theatre at the University of Southern California.

His theatre, TV and film acting credits include Anew (2017) by Nightingale Films, How to Survive a Millionaire  by USC School of Dramatic Arts (2017) , The Last Days of Judas Iscariot by Michael DiNardo (2017), Equus by The Aeneid Theatre Company (2016), Fine Tune (2016), Colours of Singapore by the Singapore Armed Forces Music & Drama Company (2015), The 5 Search (2015) by Mediacorp, an acting and hosting competition in which he finished 2nd out of 700 hopefuls and The Pillowman by Couch Theatre (2014) among others.

Aside from Anew, Shrey also produced One Day (2017), a silent short film featuring a single by Bernard Dinata, and Spend This Once Smiling (2014) as part of the Yahoo Fast Flicks Competition, where it finished in the Top 20 films. Shrey is hoping to delve into directing films and continue producing films.

Shrey was awarded the Best Actor (2010-2012) and Best Director (2013) awards at Raffles Institution’s annual Dramafest and was part of a team that won 1st in the world in improvisation at the acclaimed Destination Imagination Global Finals (2012).

He was presented with the Kripalani Award in 2013 for his outstanding creative achievements and contributions to Drama at Raffles Institution.

Shrey is looking forward to pursue acting in film and theatre, as well as directing and producing more short films this summer in Singapore and is currently hoping to pursue a double major in Film and TV Production at USC School of Cinematic Arts next semester.

Aditya Vempaty - Director/Writer

Aditya is an aspiring film director who is passionate about creating inventive films. He is currently studying at the USC School of Cinematic Arts. Growing up in the heart of the Silicon Valley, Aditya was constantly exposed to the prosperous STEM fields, but always was intrigued by the arts. In film, he found the ultimate artistic medium. After spending his time at Saratoga High School and his first year at USC exploring this interest, Aditya resolved to follow his heart and commit himself to becoming a filmmaker, despite promising oppurtunities to pursue a STEM education and career.

Before Anew, Aditya directed the short film, One Day (2017), produced by Shrey Bhargava, and co-directed the short film Screwball Sting (2015), which was nominated for Best Editing at the 2015 48 Hour Film Festival in San Francisco. 

Anew was an oppurtunity for Aditya to direct a film about love, which he believes to be central to the human condition and therefore impossible to ignore in the medium of film. 

Nicholas Pudjarminta - Director of Photography

Nicholas Pudjarminta is an independent cinematographer, visual artist, and photographer. He has spent the last 7 years developing his craft for digital media, primarily focusing on the effective presentation of human form and movement.

Nicolas Salinardi - Music Composer

Nicolas Salinardi is a producer, guitar player and arranger from Argentina. In 2007 he earned his diploma as a recording engineer from Tecson: School of Engineering and he recently earned his Bachelor of Music in Film Scoring from Berklee College of Music. His credits include Old Knacks (2015) by Juan Diego Otalvaro Ortega, Murderer (2016) by Nightingale Films, The Falling Star (2016) by Darcy Thompson, Long Road Home (2017) by Nightingale Films and O’Hare (2017) by Meghan Jones. He is now based in Los Angeles, California.

Samantha Sadoff - Writer

Samantha is a student studying Film Production and Gender Studies at the University of Southern California.  Before Anew, she served as the cinematographer for One Day (2017). Samantha hopes to continue her career as a SAG-AFTRA actress to supplement her work as a filmmaker.
story_txt:
Short Summary
‘Anew’ is an indie dramatic short film, produced by Nightingale Films, a production company, founded by Shrey Bhargava, an actor and filmmaker from Singapore and a student at the University of Southern California's School of Dramatic Arts . The team behind ‘Anew’ is largely comprised of students attending USC’s School of Cinematic Arts.
The story behind ‘Anew’ is close to our hearts and was inspired by our own experiences of love. This film brought together people of different races and backgrounds who have experienced these same conflicts as the characters we too often see on screen. This film brought together a racially and culturally diverse team from distinct backgrounds, including the US, Singapore and Indonesia. Through this story, we hope to reveal how the human experience of love is universal, and transcends racial and cultural boundaries.
'Anew' follows a young man in his search for love while he struggles to let go of his previous relationship. His battle with coming to terms with his personal journey compels him to realize some difficult lessons about love.
With your support, we’ll be able to complete post production on this film - including music composition and sound design - and you’ll directly help us send it to festivals because most of them require significant entry fees.
The more help we get from you, the further this film will go.
 


 
If we reach our goal for ‘Anew’, we will be able to bring our ultimate vision for this film to life. To complement the pensive and contemplative story, we want to use live musicians to record the film’s score. The portion of our budget dedicated to music composition would go towards paying a composer,  instrumentalists, and an audio engineer. We also hope to hire an experienced sound designer who would be able to make the film sound as flawless as possible.
Among the film festivals we plan to submit this film to, are, most notably, The Asian American International Film Festival, The San Francisco International Asian American Film Festival and The Los Angeles Shorts International Film Festival.
Be assured, that even if we do not reach our goal, we will use whatever funding we do receive to complete the film and send it to as many film festivals as possible.
The Impact
Nightingale Films’ most recent work, a silent short film, ‘One Day’, featuring Bernard Dinata’s single ‘If I Don’t Remember’ can be found on https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=48FWZAZc8S8. It was made on a similar budget and Nightingale Films hopes to do an even better job with ‘Anew’.
Recently, our producer, Shrey, was placed in the spotlight in Singapore for drawing attention to the practices of casual racism and the stereotypical representation of minorities in Singaporean media. In response to his post, while many did support him and his message, many others were quick to denounce him, resorting to personal attacks and racial hate. Such a response has revealed a side of humanity that we may have thought was gone, but continues to exist just beneath the surface.
‘Anew’ is Shrey’s first attempt after the saga to tell stories that transcend these racial and cultural boundaries. ‘Anew’ explores the theme of love, a concept blind to color and background, a concept that binds us all as humans. With this film, we first hope to tell a real story that resonates with all. And second, we hope to show that this story can be told with actors irrespective of their color or background.
Your contribution will make this film a reality. It has already been filmed, and just needs your help for the final push in post production. After completing this film, any remaining contributions would go far in submitting this film to notable film festivals in the hopes of spreading this work and message out into the world.
You can help us make the statement that the only response to hate ought to be love, that our diversity ought to be represented on film as truly as possible in order to lift our social consciousness to realize that, despite our differences, we are all one, we are all human and we all go through the same human experiences. In the end, while this journey of love might be difficult, we ought to always pursue it with an open heart, even if we have to start anew.

Risks & Challenges
Since this project is in post production, we can guarantee that the film will be made. Your contributions will ensure that the post production process can reach its full potential and that the film can be submitted to festivals worldwide. You determine how far we can go and how far we can push this message.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you’re unable to contribute to our campaign, fret not!
SHARE this Indiegogo campaign with family and friends if you believe in our message and help us get the word out that this film is coming your way!
Check back on this page to stay updated on our progress and get excited for ‘Anew’! Also, subscribe to Nightingale Films’ youtube channel at youtube.com/nightingalefilm for our upcoming trailer as well as future films!
Thank you so much for your support :)
Check out stills from ‘Anew’ and meet our team below!

story:
about the film

Viaticum is based on a short story by Maureen Jennings, the author of the Murdoch Mysteries.  

It follows Liz and Father Warren.  Liz, a former prostitute and alcoholic, is informed that her father is dying.  She must make the journey back to Toronto to see him for the first time in 30 years and she must decide to forgive him for the abuse and the death of her brother.  Father Warren, is giving Frank, Liz's father, his last rites, learns about Liz, and has his own inner struggle with faith.  Liz arriving too late, crosses paths with the Father, both unaware of the other, both not knowing the reason.

 

the team

We are a group of professional film makers getting together on our own to create this amazing film about life, abuse, learning to overcome anything and most importantly to forgive.  

director/writer/actress: lara daans

Lara has had a successful acting career in film and television for 30 years.   Most recently she has ventured into writing, and "viaticum" will be her directorial debut.  She is well known for starring in "A Dark Truth"(2012), "King of Sorrow"(2007), as well as writing and starring in "Ice Girls" (2016) a family channel MOW, 

director of photographer: andreas evdemon

Andreas Evdemon has been a successful Camera Operator/Steadicam Operator in film and television for 18 years.  He has worked on many projects including most recently, "Ransom" TV Series (2017), "Saw: Legacy" (2017) and "Anne"(TV Series) (2017).  He is following in his father's footsteps and has now began his Cinematographer career.  His first film as a Cinematographer was a short film "Big Little Girl", produced by his wife Kelly Gilbert.  This led him to meet Damian Lee and Lara Daans where he became their Cinematographer on "Ice Girls".  Andreas loves shooting beautiful work and brings his brilliant and creative knowledge of film to this project.  

producer: kelly gilbert

Kelly Gilbert has been working in film and television for 17 years, mostly as a Production Accountant.  She has also worked as an Assistant Production Manager, Production Manager and jack of all trades on low/no budget films.  Her early selected projects included: "Death To Smoochy"(2002) , "The Tuxedo"(2002), "Bulletproof Monk"(2003), and most recently, "Breakout"(2013), "Aaliyah:The Princess of R&B"(2014), "Ice Girls"(2016), and "Eyewitness"(TV Series)(2016).  (among many other projects).  Kelly produced her first short film "Burlesque" in 2006 and then her next short "Big Little Girl" in 2013.  Since then she has been on the lookout for great scripts that she can develop and produce.  In 2016, Kelly had the opportunity to Executive Producer "Ice Girls"  where she met Damian Lee and Lara Daans, whom she looks forward to working with on many more future projects.  

the cast

We are thankful to have a wonderful cast volunteer their time.

liz newey - lara daans

frank newey- peter outerbridge

We are lucky to have one of the most amazing Canadian actors of our time, Peter Outerbridge, on board this project.  

Ever since the early 90's, Outerbridge has been a steady presence not only on the silver screen but also on TV. Among many others, he played three different characters on the science fiction show The Outer Limits, had a recurring role in season three of Chris Carter's mystery spin-off Millennium, played the lead in three feature-length episodes of the 2004 version of The Murdoch Mysteries, and scored his biggest lead role to date in the same year, when he was cast as headstrong scientist David Sandström in The Movie Network's ReGenesis. The science-themed show successfully aired for four years and has been broadcast internationally in over 20 countries. ReGenesis has been nominated for several Gemini awards over the years.

As more recent projects go, Outerbridge has portrayed one of Canada's political founding fathers George Brown in the TV period piece John A.: Birth of a Country, which earned him the 2013 Canadian Screen Award in the category 'Best Performance by an Actor in a Featured Supporting Role in a Dramatic Program or Series'. He's had a recurring role in The CW's modern spy reboot Nikita, and starred as special guest star on Global TV's World War II period drama Bomb Girls. If you keep an eye out, you will also be able to catch his occasional guest spots on shows such as Suits and The Listener, and the upcoming Dark Rising: Warrior of Worlds.


 father warren - evert houston

Evert Houston is an artistic creator dedicated to the invention, innovation and architecture of original story. His multidisciplinary work as a collaborative producer brings together actors, writers, singers, dancers, designers, photographers, technicians, video artists, cinematographers, choreographers and musicians. Houston is inspired by the pursuit and discovery of new artistic forms, which inevitably emerge from these collective assemblies. His individual specializations include acting, writing, directing and producing for theatre, film, photography, original creations, performance art and live cinema.

Mr. Houston's very first film which he wrote, produced and starred is the award winning: CHURANO, which was sold to the CBC Main Network, for a 3-year licensing period across all platforms as part of Canadian Reflections.

edith - trudy weiss

Trudy Weiss is Toronto actress, known for Entebbe (2018), Hannibal (2013) and Suits (2011).

jane - kaelen ohm

Kaelen Ohm is a Canadian actress and musician. Born in Fernie, British Columbia she worked at the local Vogue Theatre during high school and after graduation, attended the Vancouver Film School for Film Production. She appeared in AMC's Hell on Wheels in Season 3 and played Katie in Alexander Carson's debut feature film, O' Brazen Age in 2015. She currently resides in Toronto, Canada.

connor - zion forrest lee

Zion Forest Lee is an actor and writer, known for Sacrifice (2011), The Poet (2007) and Hit It (2013).

ronnie - dempsey bryk

Dempsey Bryk is an American/ Canadian actor, born to actors Greg Bryk and Danielle Bryk in New York, NY. He grew up in Toronto, Ontario, and as a child Dempsey was a competitive boxer, placing first at the Ontario Bronze Gloves; soccer player, competing in Europe; debater; and mathematician, but he was also featured on family renovation shows such as A Bryk at a Time (2013) and "Bryk House." Dempsey was school president and attained an IB and an OSSD diploma in high school. After he graduated, he attended the University of Western Ontario on scholarship with an AEO acceptance to the Richard Ivey School of Business for only one year, before leaving for New York to study acting. He studied Meisner acting at the Neighborhood Playhouse Acting Conservatory. Only months after graduating he was cast in Mary Kills People (2017) , Saving Hope (2012) , and as a guest star on Heartland (2007) , and also wrote, co-directing, produced, and starred in his play "Oh loves a girl" Off-Broadway in New York (NYNW theater fest).

young liz - arcadia kendal

Arcadia Kendal is an actress, known for Sacrifice (2011), Ice Girls (2016) and Breakout(2013).

mona - katerina taxia

 

Katerina is a Second City Alumi actor who was the original, ultimate Italian princess in the improvised comedy hit "Tony N Tina's Wedding."

She then served as the Queen of the Nile being cast as "Cleopatra" in the Discovery Channel's "Cleopatra's Palace and the Real Cleopatra," which was showcased globally in over 130 countries. Katerina has had guest starring roles on hit television shows such as "Darcy's Wildlife", George F. Walker's dramatic CBC hit, "This Is Wonderland". She also worked with JJ Abrams on "Fringe" as the go-to "FBI Agent Dawson" on the FOX network and also appeared in SYFY's "Warehouse 13". She has given her time for a touching and important PSA for the Princess Margaret Hospital titled "Tears of Joy" with Oscar-nominated director Hubert Davis and most recently a heartbreaking PSA for Partners Mental Health that deals with teen suicide, titled, "Right by You" with up and coming director, David Quinn.

jimmy - brad milne

Brad Milne was born in Toronto, Canada. As a teenager his parents encouraged his love for sports leading him to national and provincial titles in skiing and spring board diving. The performer spirit in him led to the world of acting. His body of work includes film, television and web series, theatre, voice, commercial, infomercial and industrial projects. Brad's passion and respect for the art of acting paved the way for him to become an acting coach, he has empowered the careers of hundreds of actors through Milne Studio.

bartender - heidi von palleske

Heidi von Palleske was born on October 9, 1960 in Toronto, Canada. She is an actress and casting director, known for RED (2010), Dead Ringers (1988) and Take the Lead (2006)

social worker - isabel kanaan

Isabel Kanaan is an actor, known for Haunted or Hoax(2016), Til' Death Do Us Part (2014) and Doghouse (2014).

What We Need

We are looking to raise $20,000 to pay for equipment, set dressing, locations, food and would love to pay crew honorariums to show our appreciation of their hard work in an extremely busy time of year.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if a monetary contribution is not in the cards, but you can still help if you'd like: 

  • share our campaign with your friends and family 
  • if you are local and would like to volunteer time, we are always looking for new talent.
  • know of anyone who's local that would love to help?  pass them onto us :)

story:
It all starts with God, right?

I think sometimes I forget this simple truth as I live out my walk as a believer in Jesus Christ. It doesn’t start with me, my plans or even my desires. I have found myself many times call out to God as Lord, but my actions were not matching my words.

One way I found myself declaring God as Lord and not following in my actions was surrounding evangelism. I had drawn a line in the “spiritual sand” and told God that this is not an area that I feel comfortable in…so don’t ask me to cross it. I had set the limits of my dedication and service to and for God.

But in God’s graciousness He has revealed to me that by drawing a line in the sand, I was in essence telling Him that I didn’t love His work of salvation. I was telling God that I was not interesting in His desires of reconciling the world to Himself.

Over time I have experienced a heart change related to my desire in sharing the Good News. Somewhere along the way, the line I drew had disappeared. Instead of standing opposed to His plans, I love what He loves. I desire what He desires, and that includes bringing people to salvation.

Now I have to be honest. The heart change did not come with instant success at presenting the Good News and seeing salvations. As a matter of fact I am terrible at this type of Kingdom work, but I know I have the right heart. And God uses people with the right heart. And from this heart change came the vision for uniting Jesus’ global church for the sole purpose of bringing the lost to salvation.

The purpose of raising funds for thesalvationwall.org is bring glory to God through salvation.  Our desire is for the world to know Jesus and accept the free and unmerited gift of salvation.

What We Need

We believe that God has given us a great assignment. One that has eternal consequences. Our need is to fund the website and ask that you contribute to God’s plans and purposes. 100% of your donated money goes toward the website or supporting the website. Our estimated costs are as follows:

Website Development $45,000
Marketing/Web Hosting $15,000
Legal $10,000
Total $70,000

The Impact

We believe that we will be bring glory to God in the following ways:

  • Praying for the lost in a safe and encouraging environment that unifies believers as one global church.
  • Sharing salvation testimonies that increase our faiths as God accomplishes the impossible.
  • Prayer teaching that helps develop an intimate and rich relationship with God.
  • Prayer teaching that focuses our prayers upon God's Word and the movement of the Holy Spirit.
  • Lift high the name of Jesus Christ through praise and adoration, which is interwoven in all that we do.
  • Ultimately people will come to know the joy and freedom that comes from having Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior.

The Challenge is Big (but we have a BIG God)

The challenge to raise $70,000 to build the website is an incredibly big feat, but we believe what it says in Matthew 19:26, "with God everything is possible."

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support.  Obviously not everyone can give financially, but you can definitely contribute in other critical ways:

  • Pray that hearts would be generous to give towards God's desire to reach the unsaved.
  • We believe that God will multiply what little we give, just like in John 6, when the boy gave up his lunch so that Jesus could do a miracle.  Pray that God would multiply all that we give and do.
  • Use social media to share our vision and request with others. 
  • Use our Facebook page to write prayers of encouragement, praise God for how He has worked in your life and share stories about salvation.
  • Purchase shirts, prayer pads and Spiritual Movement Theorem coins at thesalvationwall.com
  • Oh man, you are such a powerful tool for God's Kingdom!  The best way you can help is be full of God's grace, love and compassion.  Let others see Jesus in you!

story:
Film Summary

After hearing news of moving, Delilah and her sister Nancy prepare for the big transition. When meeting a homeless boy, Delilah’s view on the move changes. The family struggles with saying goodbye to the loss of their beloved mother, as well as the tension between blame factors within the family walls.

Meet the Characters

Delilah (FEMALE - 15) LEAD

Being in a new town is hard enough, but what comes before is even harder. Delilah struggles with saying goodbye to her best friend Brenda as well as her deceased mother she visits often. Along with the move, Delilah and her sister battle against the factors of their mothers death. Delilah sees the world much different than other 16 year old girls her age and has a pretty cool way of interpreting it as well. Delilah has a strong opinion and chooses to see the world for what it is, while others turn a shy eye to what it’s not. 

Nancy (FEMALE - 17) LEAD

With a dark past of self harm and other demons, Nancy is mad at the world unlike Delilah her sister. Nancy has an enforced rough front to block out the pain that lies behind her eyes. She is  also a little gothic and trusts no one. Nancy takes her mothers death and pushes blame onto Delilah. This causes their relationship to be iffy and confusing at times. Overall Nancy has a good heart, but a heart that needs a little help.

Brenda (FEMALE - 15) SUPPORTING LEAD

Brenda is used to change since her mother and father have been divorced since she was little. Brenda loves to help people and make them feel good about themselves. She is also an extremely artsy young lady that paints to reduce stress. Brenda, much like Delilah, sees the world through a different lens then most people. This causes Brenda and Delilah to be best friends. Brenda chooses to take the world by storm and not let anything affect deeply affect her.

Stanley (MALE - 14) SUPPORTING LEAD

Dumped and Unwanted is how Stanley sees himself after his parents abandoned him. Stanley has a stutter and twitching issue since his gunshot accident when he was little. After meeting Delilah his world suddenly changes and he comes to terms with himself and the outside world. Stanley is not one to hold back a question and has a very little filter (Even though it is not his fault). The world has been cruel to Stanley, but he chooses to appreciate what he has.

What We Need & What You Get

The process in making our film is separted into different departments so many jobs and tasks can get done at once. Below is exactly how much money will go to each department.

Technical Department: ($1,400)

  • Buying and renting the needed equipment is expensive. Having the correct lense, camera and shotgun mic is an essential to telling our story in the most powerful way possible. Below are some of the equipment we need.

  1.  JVCGY-HM170 4KCAM Compact Professional Camcorder

2.  TASCAM DR-60DmkII DSLR Audio Recorder

3. Audio Technica AT875R Condenser Microphone

Artistic Department: ($700)

  • Our prop list calculate that there are over 30 props used in this film. That is a lot! We like to make all our props from scratch and would rather not cheat by ordering from amazon or ebay. Teenagers in middle school will use the 700 for a class to buy the materials they need to create the film's image. 

Management & Marketing Department: ($300)

  • To make our film possible we need to get the word out to people like you. People who care about letting teens explore the world around them and hopefully make it a better place. We need this money to be able to print posters and put the film on DVDs.

Creative Department: ($100)

  • Simple. We need the one hundred to print 40 scripts for our cast and crew. 

The Impact 

At JPJ Productions we believe film making can change the way people think, feel and listen. Film making is not just an art, but a device to send messages to the world. One person's voice can be hard to hear. With film making you cannot just have one voice, you need multiple. 

Brining people together and creating friendships that last forever is not just a part of what we do, but of who we are. Everyone is talented, and everyone has a dream. At JPJ Productions we give you the tools you need to express your talent and make your dreams come true. 

Risks & Challenges

Let us explain:

  • We are teenagers, but that does not mean we are any less intelligent the professional film maker. We take your money serisouly because it is your money. You are investing in us and we appreciate that immensely. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this link on your Facebook/twitter page
  • Like us on Facebook @JPJProductions
  • Word of mouth to others about this campaign
  • Rate us on Imdb!
  • Check out out website www.jpjproductions.org

story:
We’re fundraising until DECEMBER 18. If what we’re doing is important to you, show your support: Give at least $1 right now! 



The World's Leading Voice for Gay Dads (Is Going Mobile!)

Gays With Kids® is the first and only global resource for gay dads and gay men considering fatherhood. Our mission is to make sure every gay dad feels welcome, represented and connected regardless of his path to fatherhood or where he lives. Please donate now to help us build an app that will connect gay dads.

Co-founders Brian and Ferd (husbands and fathers of three young children) launched Gays With Kids® last year. It’s a full-time effort, and until now we've covered the cost for everything as a labor of love: a website with hundreds of feature articles, gay dad blog posts, videos, and the world’s largest online collection of gay dad family photos; engaged and growing communities on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter; and a robust YouTube channel with total viewership surpassing one million!

We're raising money to transition from a labor of love into a sustainable, long-term business. The first thing we'll do is build our app so gay dads can connect locally and around the world.

Since our launch we’ve reached hundreds of thousands of gay dads from across the globe. We’re overwhelmed by the outpouring of love and support that we receive each week. Many of these messages bring us close to tears.

In your feedback, you've made it clear that there's more we can do: You want help connecting with other gay dads. That's why we're going to build you the world’s first app and website designed exclusively for gay dads. Whether you’re already part of our community, or this is your first interaction with us and you like what you see, please show your appreciation and support by contributing now — even if it's just one dollar.

Can $1 Really Help?

YES! As we embark on this new adventure, we need to know that you’re out there, and your gift of even just one dollar means you’ll stand out and be counted. Beyond helping us show the strength of our community, if every Gays With Kids® follower donated even a dollar, we can start building this next phase of Gays With Kids® tomorrow.

Our Big (Gay Dad!) Vision

We've dreamed up an incredibly awesome website and an accompanying mobile app with more of what you love plus guest blogging, private networking, and other social features. Once built, our app will enable you to:

         • Connect with gay dads in your local community
         • Arrange play dates with other gay dad families
         • Find single gay dads to date
         • Seek advice from mentors for help in your own journey to fatherhood
         • Get support from an empathic gay dad who’s already ‘been there, done that’

Watch this video for more details.

Here's How Your Contributions Will Be Applied

In the Fall of this year, we met with several software development teams to talk about our plans for the future. We hired the smartest and most innovative of these firms for a two-week project that would enable them to provide us with the blueprints for a prototype of Gays With Kids® 2.0. This prototype includes all the features members of our community have asked for. The bid we were quoted to build it is $200,000.

If we raise less than $100,000: Each month we incur many expenses to maintain our website and social media, including the cost to create and edit written and video content, as well as pay for web hosting, freelancers and business consultants. If we raise up to $50,000 from this campaign, we will use the money to fund the continuation of the site while we pursue other funding opportunities to build the app and new website. The more backers we can show as interested, the easier it will be to find other funding.

If we raise $100,000 or more: We will commence work on the mobile app and re-designed website. The first step we’ll take will be to hire an experienced and talented project manager. He or she will then source a software development firm while we pursue other funding opportunities to raise the remaining budget.

If we raise the full $200,000: The funding will be allocated for the payment for a contract project manager, the actual cost of construction for Gays With Kids® 2.0, beginning immediately. Here's the timeline after $200,000 is raised:


What's In It For You

Check out the perks at right! When you make a contribution, you could receive Gays With Kids® stickers, a photo album for your own family memories, an early invite to our mobile app and social network or inclusion in our advisory board as we develop Gays With Kids® 2.0, and a special badge on your future social profile, so everyone you meet on the future Gays With Kids® social network will know it exists because of YOUR help. An example:


Who We Are

Brian Rosenberg and Ferd van Gameren are husbands, dads (with three young kids) and business partners. (Yep, we spend way too much time together!) The idea for Gays With Kids® was born shortly after the birth of our oldest child, and our launch a few years later coincided with the disposal of one of our twin daughter's last diaper! While this started out as a passion project, as part of our plans for Gays With Kids® 2.0 we hope to transition from a labor of love to an ongoing sustainable business that will continue to provide tremendous value to gay dads around the world.

Brian, CEO, credits an innate entrepreneurial drive for his successful 20+ year career in business-to-business and humanitarian services sales and fundraising, marketing and business development. He has an unbridled passion for the subject of gay fatherhood and loves connecting with gay dads and dads-to-be from across the globe. 

Ferd, Executive Editor, is a native of the Netherlands. After teaching classical and modern languages in the Netherlands and the United States for many years, he now bears ultimate responsibility for all of Gays With Kids’ written content. 


Frequently Asked Questions

What are the risks and challenges involved? Brian is an experienced entrepreneur and successful sales and marketing executive. More importantly, we (Brian and Ferd) are both gay and we are proud and loving husbands and dads. We created our family of five through adoption and surrogacy. We launched Gays With Kids® in June of 2014 because we are passionate about showing our families in a positive and accurate light and about building a safe and welcoming community in which gay dads can connect. All of this has been completely self-funded until now, and to great success. The funding we receive from this campaign will enable us to do more and better serve our fast-growing global community.

How can I get more involved helping to promote your campaign? We VERY much welcome your support! Please contact brian@gayswithkids.com to talk about how you can help us out further.

Would you like my feedback or ideas I have of things I’d like to see implemented in Gays With Kids® 2.0? Absolutely! Please get in touch!  brian@gayswithkids.com.

Is Gays With Kids® up and running now? Yes, it sure is! We launched our website June of 2014. Visit gayswithkids.com and check out more than 600 feature articles, gay dad blog posts, gay dad family profiles, videos and photo diaries.

Is it free? Yes! You can read all our content for free.

How do I get to be featured on the website? There are many, many different ways to be featured on our website too numerous to elaborate here so please contact brian@gayswithkids.com to discuss.

Are you looking for writers? Absolutely! We have the world’s largest community of gay dads blogging about their experiences creating and raising families and we welcome more! We also have freelance writing opportunities for talented writers interested in profiling gay dad families or writing on topics of interest to gay dad families. Please contact ferd@gayswithkids.com.

Do you have other opportunities for me to get involved? We’re very interested in working with volunteers and freelancers and we offer flexible hours that should be especially interesting to stay-at-home dads. We especially want to hear from you if you have experience as a community manager or just love to spend time on Facebook, Instagram and/or Twitter. Please contact brian@gayswithkids.com

Are you a non-profit? To date, Gays With Kids® has been a complete labor of love and we have funded everything out of our own pockets. We recently incorporated as a for-profit business entity as we plan to incorporate revenue streams when we launch Gays With Kids® 2.0. Our hope is that we will become self-sustaining in order to provide ongoing value to gay dads and dads-to-be for many, many years.

What is the Gays With Kids® reader profile? Visitors to our website, our Facebook page, YouTube channel, Instagram page and Twitter channel come from all over the world and represent gay dads, gay men who have already started their journeys to fatherhood, others from the LGBT community, and family members, friends, neighbors and colleagues who support us.  

How are you going to develop the social network platform and apps? Agile methodology is a software development project management style that provides opportunities to assess the direction of a project throughout the development lifecycle. We like it because when a team stops and re-evaluates the direction of a project every two weeks, there’s always time to steer it in another direction. 
We want to hire a software development firm that uses this methodology to build Gays With Kids® 2.0 because the results of this “inspect-and-adapt” approach to development greatly reduce both development costs and time to market. Because teams can develop software at the same time they’re gathering requirements, the phenomenon known as “analysis paralysis” is less likely to impede a team from making progress. And because a team’s work cycle is limited to two weeks, it gives stakeholders recurring opportunities to calibrate releases for success in the real world. 

facebook.com/gayswithkids
instagram.com/gays_with_kids
twitter.com/GaysWithKids
youtube.com/GaysWithKids

Would you like my feedback or ideas I have of things I’d like to see implemented in Gays With Kids® 2.0? Absolutely! Please get in touch!  brian@gayswithkids.com.
Is Gays With Kids® up and running now? Yes, it sure is! We launched our website June of 2014. Visit gayswithkids.com and check out more than 600 feature articles, gay dad blog posts, gay dad family profiles, videos and photo diaries.
Is it free? Yes! You can read all our content for free.
How do I get to be featured on the website? There are many, many different ways to be featured on our website too numerous to elaborate here so please contact brian@gayswithkids.com to discuss. 
Are you looking for writers? Absolutely! We have the world’s largest community of gay dads blogging about their experiences creating and raising families and we welcome more! We also have freelance writing opportunities for talented writers interested in profiling gay dad families or writing on topics of interest to gay dad families. Please contact ferd@gayswithkids.com. 
Do you have other opportunities for me to get involved? We’re very interested in working with volunteers and freelancers and we offer flexible hours that should be especially interesting to stay-at-home dads. We especially want to hear from you if you have experience as a community manager or just love to spend time on Facebook, Instagram and/or Twitter. Please contact brian@gayswithkids.com
Are you a non-profit? To date, Gays With Kids® has been a complete labor of love and we have funded everything out of our own pockets. We recently incorporated as a for-profit business entity as we plan to incorporate revenue streams when we launch Gays With Kids® 2.0. Our hope is that we will become self-sustaining in order to provide ongoing value to gay dads and dads-to-be for many, many years.
What is the Gays With Kids® reader profile? Visitors to our website, our Facebook page, YouTube channel, Instagram page and Twitter channel come from all over the world and represent gay dads, gay men who have already started their journeys to fatherhood, others from the LGBT community, and family members, friends, neighbors and colleagues who support us.  
How are you going to develop the social network platform and apps? Agile methodology is a software development project management style that provides opportunities to assess the direction of a project throughout the development lifecycle. We like it because when a team stops and re-evaluates the direction of a project every two weeks, there’s always time to steer it in another direction. 
We want to hire a software development firm that uses this methodology to build Gays With Kids® 2.0 because the results of this “inspect-and-adapt” approach to development greatly reduce both development costs and time to market. Because teams can develop software at the same time they’re gathering requirements, the phenomenon known as “analysis paralysis” is less likely to impede a team from making progress. And because a team’s work cycle is limited to two weeks, it gives stakeholders recurring opportunities to calibrate releases for success in the real world. 
facebook.com/gayswithkidsinstagram.com/gays_with_kidstwitter.com/GaysWithKidsyoutube.com/GaysWithKids

story:
I am other

"I Am Other" is a multi-media research and documentation project with the goal of recording the lives and stories of LGBTQ Ugandans across the country.

  • The proposed project will collect and document through photography, audio, and video interviews the stories of LGBTQ Ugandans to preserve an often invisible community for purposes of austerity and visibility.
  • Because many political, cultural, and religious leaders believe that LGBTQ Ugandans are "un-African" and do not exist — it is important to document the vast gender and sexual orientation diversity in the country.
  • Supporting this research and documentation project will generate the first online visual archive of the daily lives of LGBTQ Ugandans — and serve as a much needed tool for local activists to fight for their human rights as LGBTQ persons.
  • The project is apart of Queer Collective — a new arts initiative with the goal of creating a space for queer artists working in east Africa to come together and share their work locally, nationally, and internationally. Queer collective aims to empower and validate LGBTQ artists by providing education and mentorship programs that will improve their craft and enable them to become economically self sustaining vessels of social change.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are currently documenting and collecting stories of LGBTQ Ugandans within the capitol of Kampala. However, we need your help to expand this documentation project to rest of the country.
  • We plan to reach all districts in Uganda. This is no simple task and we would like you to join our growing community of supporters to help us collect and tell these stories.
  • To cover these costs we have a funding goal of $3,500.
  • You can support us by donating whatever you can to this campaign. Every little bit counts — even sharing the campaign with your friends, family, and social networks.

Funding from this campaign will go towards:

  • Video and recording equipment
  • Transportation across the country
  • Accommodation costs when good friends and great couches are not available 
  • Creating and cataloging the database of stories by LGBTQ Ugandans.

The Impact

This project will highlight the sexual and gender diversity within Uganda with the hope of educating and creating empathy within the greater Ugandan society and the world about LGBTQ people.

  • Through the project we hope to change the narrative and start a positive conversation about LGBTQ Ugandans — to empower and validate an invisible community that is often faced with ridicule and rejection by calling to attention the successes, triumphs, and hardships they face, bare testimony and honor victims and survivors of homophobia and transphobia.
  • You can view some of the stories of LGBTQ Ugandans we have already documented on our Facebook page and website and in the photo gallery on this page.

Risks & Challenges

Because of the political and social climate, it will be challenging to get LGBTQ Ugandans to share their stories openly. However, we will ensure complete confidentiality for participants who wish to hide their identities. In addition, to ensure our own security as LGBTQ individuals working in Uganda, we have partnered with local activists.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram!

The Team

Keith King, Ugandan LGBT activist based in Kampala — mpungakeithking@gmail.com

Austin Bryan, American ethnographic researcher based in Kampala — adbryan3@ncsu.edu

Mac Ilakut, Ugandan Trans* activist based in Kampala —           macilakut@gmail.com

Matthew Alemi, Ugandan Queer 'artivist' based in Kampala — tayosmatt@yahoo.co.uk

story:
Meet Team Friendish 

Hi. We're Chandra and Michelle, the founders of Friendish. We believe there's a better way to make connections with people online that doesn't involve swiping on people's faces. 

Friendish is so so so important to us for obvious reasons. As women founders we recognize the importance of creating a safe, fun and cool environment for people of all ages, backgrounds and sexes to connect based on things that really matter, like knowing all the words to Twin Shadow's latest single or what Frank Underwood has up his sleeve in the next House of Cards episode or why The Force Awakens will be the best Star Wars movie yet. While dating apps work for some, Friendish is the first friending app that helps you find genuine people around you who share common interests.  

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution, no matter how small, will help us build a product that we can be proud of and that you'll love using and sharing:

  • We're raising 20k because technology is not cheap. 
  • Mainly we need super servers so you can talk, meet and hang with all the awesome friends you meet through our app!
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, 100% of the funds we raise here will go towards the app and building a better product for you.

The Impact

  • It's been said that friends are the family you choose for yourself. But between work, school and other obligations, time is at a minimum for everyone and it is increasingly harder and harder to meet people!
  • Friendish is valuable because community is essential to the human experience.
  • If you're in tech, you know that DIVERSITY is something that has been at the forefront of the conversation. Similar to director, Ava DuVernay, we prefer the word inclusion over diversity and are taking our shot at being included in a male dominated world with the help of your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially (we're ballin' on budgets too!) you can help us spread the word by shouting us out on social!

  • Like us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram please and thank you!
  • Don't forget about Indiegogo's awesome share tools!

story:
Türkçe için buraya tıklayın!

Short Summary

I am a student from Bahçeşehir University in Istanbul. One of the most renowned film schools in Turkey. I'm graduating this year and I've created a project I'm very passionate about. Which is at the shooting stage with a lot of the pre-production phase complete.

The concept of the film revolves around a world where all celestial objects in the space have a control room/cockpit. Within this control room is the heart, an electronic orb that powers the planet. Finally, a technician to maintain everything.

In the story, the heart of the sun malfunctions due to a little mistake by our main character, the technician. The sun starts heating up. He then tries to prevent the planets in our solar system, including Earth from getting scorched. Even though he manages to save one little planet by the name of Pluto, his failure causes him to doubt his own purpose in life.

This film is about humanity's endless appetite towards getting nature under control and shaping it as we want.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contribution to make this film happen. A lot of the pre-production stage has been finished. Script, storyboard, concept design, color palette, the location, equipment...

We have sponsorships for the location and equipment from the awesome people who work in the film industry and were willing to help out.

Here's where the money will be going for our two-day shoot:

- Props: $200
- Make-up: $100
- Food: $50
- Gas: $50
- Post-Production: $100

We have a very limited deadline. That's why this campaign is only 7 days long. We are shooting between 23rd and 24th of January.

The Team

I have a set of very trust-worthy people working with me. I've worked with them on past projects throughout many years. Now we're coming together for what I believe will be the best project we will have done so far.


Left-to-right: Soner Bülbül (my producer), Özgün Kabakçıoğlu (me, the director) and Abdurrahman Baştuğ (my associate producer)

The Impact

Your contribution will make it possible for the production to happen. This is the absolute minimum budget we could come up with for the film to happen. We want you to be involved as much as possible so we will be posting updates here for you to see what happens in the filming stages and the post production.

Risks & Challenges

We have worked with digital effects and sets before in our previous projects. Even though this is the biggest digital set we will be constructing.


We've shot that previous project, Misclick, in a very basic green screen we constructed ourselves with a near-zero-budget production:

We only had three working lights, we couldn't light the greenscreen very well etc. But this time, we will be shooting on a professional green screen studio (image is from one of their clients' shoots):

This way we will get rid of the keying problems we previously had and work in an environment where we can more effectively find solutions to problems with the opportunities available to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially, contribute by sharing! Tell your friends and family about us.

Türkçe

Özet

Bahçeşehir Üniversitesi'nden bir sinema öğrencisiyim. Bu sene mezun oluyorum ve son derece heyecanlı olduğum bir proje yarattık. Bu proje şuanda çekim aşamasında, ön prodüksiyon aşamasının çoğu tamamlandı.

Filmin konsepti, evrendeki bütün gökcisimlerinin içerisinde birer kontrol odası/kokpit olan bir dünya etrafında dönüyor. Bu kontrol odasının içerisinde kalp, gezegeni gücünü sağlayan elektronik bir küre bulunmaktadır. Ayrıca herşeyi çekip çeviren bir de teknisyen bu kontrol odasında yaşamaktadır.

Öyküde, Güneş'in kalbi ana karakterimiz olan bir teknisyenin yaptığı küçük bir hatadan dolayı bozuluyor. Güneş ısınmaya başlıyor. Daha sonra karakterimiz Dünya dahil güneş sistemindeki bütün gezegenleri yanarak yok olmaktan kurtarmaya çalışıyor. Plüto'yu kurtarabilse de başarısızlığı hayattaki amacını sorgulamasına yol açıyor.

Bu film, insanlığın doğayı kontrol altında tutma ve şekillendirme için sahip olduğu sınırsız açlık üzerine bir film.

İhtiyaçlar

Bu filmi gerçekleştirebilmek için sizin yardımlarınıza ihtiyacımız var. Ön-yapım aşamasındaki çoğu şeyi tamamladık. Senaryo, storyboard, konsept tasarımı, renk paleti, mekan, ekipman...

Film endüstrisinde çalışan muhteşem insanlardan mekan ve ekipman desteğimiz var.

İki günlük çekim takvimimizde parayı bu şekilde harcayacağız:

- Aksesuarlar (Props): $200
- Makyaj: $100
- Yemek: $50
- Benzin: $50
- Post-Prodüksiyon: $100

Çekime başlama takvimimiz çok yakın. Kampanya bu yüzden yalnızca 7 gün uzunluğunda. Ancak kampanya bittikten sonra da katkı sağlamaya devam edebilirsiniz, böylece bütçenin tamamınını toplayamazsak bize yardım etmeye devam edebilirsiniz. Film 23 ve 24 Ocak tarihlerinde çekilecek.

Ekip

Son derece güvendiğim insanlarla beraber çalışıyorum. Onlarla yıllardır çeşitli projelerde çalıştık. Şimdiyse bugüne kadar yaptığımız en iyi projeyi yapmak için tekrar bir aradayız.


Soldan sağa: Soner Bülbül (yapımcım), Özgün Kabakçıoğlu (ben, yönetmen), Abdurrahman Baştuğ (yardımcı yapımcım)

Etki

Katkılarınız prodüksiyonun gerçekleşmesini sağlayacak. Size sunduğumuz bütçe, bu filmi gerçekleştirebilmek için ihtiyacımız olan minimum bütçe.

Mümkün olduğunca projenin içinde olmanızı istiyoruz. Bu yüzden bu sayfada çeşitli güncellemeleri ve çekim sırasındaki yaşadıklarımızı vesaire paylaşacağız.

Zorluklar ve Çözümler

Dijital efektlerle ve dijital setlerle daha önceki projelerimizde çalıştık, bu konuda deneyimimiz var. Aşağıda bu projelerden birini görebilirsiniz:


Yukarıdaki filmi kendi yaptığımız çok basit bir yeşil perdede çektik:

Yalnızca 3 adet çalışan ışığımız vardı bu yüzden yeşil perdeyi çok iyi aydınlatamadık. Bu, daha sonra post prodüksiyon sırasında problemlere yol açtı. Aşağıda, destek aldığımız film stüdyosundan bir kare görebilirsiniz (resimdekiler stüdyonun müşterilerinden birine ait):

Bu mekanda çalışarak önceki projede problem olan key problemlerinden kurtulacağız ve karşımızda çıkan problemlerle baş etmek için daha fazla imkana sahip olabileceğiz.

Other Ways You Can Help

Eğer ekonomik anlamda katkıda bulunamıyorsanız, paylaşım yapın! Arkadaşlarınıza ve ailenize bizden bahsedin.

story:
MMA Stories... a new in-depth, uncensored look into the world of professional MMA fighters making their way to the Ultimate Fighting Championship.  Everyone knows the big names... Rousey... Liddell... McGregor...  We will bring you content on the fighters who are aren't the millionaires or in the spotlight...yet.  They're not getting the big headlines.  They're family men, business owners, hard workers, all dreaming of that one shot to make it.  These are their stories in and out of the octagon... This is MMA Stories
There are many projects to support …Why us?
  1. Our Purpose for doing this documentary is to show you that you are not so far from reaching your fullest potential… it may be closer than you think.  MMA Fighters Aung La Nsang and Jon Delbrugge continue their journey in Mixed Martial Arts.  Jon prepares for his call to the UFC, and Aung La continues down his road of success in the One FC
  2. All funds will go towards ensuring we deliver an exciting documentary
  3. We want to share this message with the masses


Baltimore native, Jon Delbrugge is many things.  A professional fighter, a business entrepreneur, a mentor, a husband, and recently he achieved his greatest accomplishment... he became A Father... Jon has spent most of his life training, competing, for that one call.  The call that he and many believe is coming soon... his call to the UFC.

We want to bring you content the only way we know how.  Our way.  In-depth,  uncensored, and intense.  After we bring you a year of content, we culminate with the releasing of our short film titled, Devastator: An MMA Story.

Our sequel, The Burmese Python: An MMA story follows Aung La Nsang before, during, and after his epic fight in his homeland of Myanmar, Burma this March.  For the first time ever, he will compete in stadium he grew up near in front of his friends, family, and countrymen and woman.  The biggest athlete in Burma's history comes home for the fight of his life.
From Burma to Michigan to Baltimore, Aung La's journey spans worldwide.  This is his MMA Story.

MMA Stories will release 15-30 second teasers on social media weekly, giving a quick inside look on each chapter that will be shown.  The chapters themselves will be between 2-5 minutes each.  Such examples are..

PUTTIN IN WORK - The training of an MMA fighter is some of the most intense in all sports.  We take the cameras into the training centers, gyms and see what it really takes... This is Puttin in Work...

FAMILY - Support systems can come from many places.  For Jon and Aung, his family has been there every step of the way.  We look at his career through their eyes...  This is Family...

GIVING BACK - Jon will return to his high school roots in Glenelg, passing along his guidance and wisdom to the current athletes...Stepping back on the same field he once dominated on...  For Aung, he lives and breathes martial arts.  As an instructor at Crazy 88 in Maryland, he passes his experiences on to a new generation of martial artists... This is Giving Back...


Your contribution goes towards the full cost of production. 

  • Production Crews (Director/Director of Photography/Sound/PA's)
  • Equipment (Lighting, Camera Upgrades, ect.)
  • Music Licensing
  • Travel Expenses
  • Editing (Other Post Production Costs/Crew)
  • Marketting & Promotion
  • Distribution

This allows us to move forward with this project and gets us one step closer to successful completion.  We will provide updates along the way.  This is a massive multimedia platform, a series of featurettes, teasers, behind the scenes looks, and finally a Short Film all documenting Jon's 2016 fight season.  We will get in depth content about his Family Life, Giving Back to the Community, Training, and  Competitions.  

The Impact

Jon and Aung's story shows how anyone can reach their full potential.  Jon's dream is about to come true... Aung currently fights in the One FC, one of the biggest fight organizations in the world.  Perhaps their story can help others fine their potential and reach their dreams...

We Need Your Help to Make This Film & Series

A documentary is a powerful source of media for providing impactful content. 

Making a documentary takes a lot of love and a little bit of insanity. And, people make them because they are passionate about the story they are telling.  Your partnership gives us that push to move forward and lets us know that there is an interested audience.  In return, we promise to deliver an engaging film.

You can contribute any amount and not limited to what's listed in the perks. If you can’t contribute monetarily right now but want contribue in other creative ways, send an email to: stage20media@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help!

And we would be deeply grateful if you SHARE this link with your friends on Instagram, Facebook and/or TWEET it.  If you have friends who don't FB or Tweet, email works too.  #mma_stories @mma_stories

story:
Hello there Film Lovers,

First of all thanks for checking out our project. 

We are a bunch of independent filmmakers who would like to take part in a 99 hours film competition from 99FIRE-FILMS-AWARD 2016. 

We have worked on various projects so far including short films, feature films, music videos and documentaries. Our films have been played in different film festivals and have also won awards. 

So what will our short film be about? 
Umm... well...that is indeed a very good question. But we don't know yet. We will find out on the day the film challenge starts. It could be anything. Which is really exciting but also a bit terrifying. However, the excitement wins.

Let me explain the 99 hours film competition to you:

  • What is it all about?

You conceptualize, shoot and edit a film in exactly 99 hours. Your enemy is definitely Time.

  • What do you need to take part?

Spontaneity, 99 hours time, a camera and I personally think that a good cast and crew will make all the difference. 

  • What’s essential?

Speed, creativity and flashes of genius – and most of all the joy of shooting films. And a little bit insanity.

On January 28th, 2016 we will receive an e-mail with our topic. And then we have time from 10:00am on 28th January 2016, till 1:00pm on 01st February 2016 to make a 99 seconds long film. 

99 seconds you say? Yup. I know it sounds like such little time to make a proper film but it's really not. If you check out the previous films from the years before at 99FIRE-FILMS 2016 under review, you can see they created amazing stories within this amount of time.

So why would we like to take part in this competition and what would we get out of it?

Alright. Honestly, it is fun. More importantly this will give us exposure and will hopefully get us more projects in the feature.  

Furthermore there is a money price to win which we would like to use to film a feature film that we already have in the works.

We can assure you that every single penny we will make from this campaign will end up on screen. Everyone of us offers up their time for free as we all believe we can create something nice here.

What will we need £1000 for?

We want to make a great little film and for that we will need some things.

Equipment hire is quite expensive. However, we would like to give our Director of Photography the possibility to get the equipment he wants to use. To get him the equipment though we will need to insure it. Also we want to insure our whole cast and crew to make sure that everyone is covered.

So let's break it down:

  • £300 will be used for equipment hire which includes lenses, lights and Gimbal.
  • £200 will be used for equipment insurance
  • £50 will be used to feed our cast and crew
  • £50 will be used for the Indiegogo fees
  • £200 will be used for locations
  • $200 will be used for set design, costumes, make up and hair and props

Should we not make our goal, any money will still go into this production as every penny will make it better. 

We can make the film we want to make if we could even meet half of our goal.



We also have the incredible possibility to work together with Jon Wayre from http://www.cinephonics.co.uk/ props. We can use some really cool vintage props like cameras, microphones, etc. which we would like to explore in this short film. Also Jon is amazing with set build and as a sound recordist.

Who exactly are we?

We are ArtManic Films, a small production company, which was founded by Marco Prates and Nicole Behrens back in February 2015. Ever since then we have been working on different projects like films, documentaries, music videos and promo videos.

We work together with different freelancers to create the best filming crews possible.

Our website: ArtManic-Films.com

Cast & Crew


Sophie Barker & Stevee Davies

Sophie has just completed a feature film 'Backtrack' where she starred opposite the critically acclaimed Julian Glover (Indiana Jones, Star Wars, Game of Thrones). This dark psychological thriller was directed by up-and- comer Tom Sands and is due for international release later this year. Sophie graduated from East 15 Acting School in 2012. In the same year she was nominated for the BBC Carleton Hobbs Radio Award and performed at the Shakespeare's Globe Theatre as part of the Sam Wanamaker Festival. She just recently filmed a short film about the unreliability of romantic memories called ‘Hindsight'. She also starred in our previous film "Anita's Birthday Wish".


Stevee is originally from London and has had wide experience as an actor in Television, Theatre, Film, Commercials & more, working on various projects & productions over the years. Selected credits include:

'Les Miserables' (Working Title), Peep Show (Channel 4), Ladies of Letters (ITV), A Touch of Frost (ITV), Hit the Road Jack (Channel 4). He has recently finished 'The Girl Who Cried Wolf', and has also signed up to highly anticipated short film, 'Murder Capital' and brand new comedy sitcom 'Aunties' (to be broadcast in 2014),

As well as performing, Stevee is also a producer, having worked on various theatrical events, collaborating with PauldenHall Productions.

Stevee also starred in our previous film "Anita's Birthday Wish".

Director

Talisa Oberoi
After completing her bachelors in performance design and practice at Central Saint Martin's, she shifted her focus from theatre to film. She is wrote and directed "Anita's Birthday Wish".

She currently works at the production company Capture in London. 

Producer

Nicole Behrens

Nicole has worked on different projects as Producer, Production Manager and Production Assistant. She recently worked on The Jungle Book as a VFX Production Assistant. In 2015 she co-founded ArtManic Films which is producing Films, Documentaries as well as Music Video and Promo Videos. "Anita's Birthday Wish was produced by her.

Director of Photography

Marco Prates

After discovering his passion for lighting, Marco decided to work as a Director of Photography. He has worked on Films, Documentaries, Music Videos as well as Films. In 2015 he co-founded ArtManic Films a London based video production company. 

Some of our stuff

You can check out our Cinematographer's showreel here:


And our Producer's showreel here:


One of our previous short films "Anita's Birthday Wish" can be viewed here: 


It has done quite well in the film festival circuit and has won the best film of 2014, best producer of 2014, best director of 2014 and best filmmaker of 2014 award at Central Film School London. 

Our Cinematographer Marco Prates has won Best audience award with St Wallace-on-sea:


Chinese Treachery, another short film of his, has already won awards at different film festivals.

If everything goes as planned, we will win this competition and we will get some money towards our next project which is a feature film already in the works. If it doesn't go as planned, we will have a film that will hopefully entertain you as an audience.

What could possibly go wrong?

* The Theme we get...
It could be the weirdest theme ever and we can't come up with a story.

* Our equipment breaks...
It can happen. However, we have back up plans and hopefully an equipment insurance.

*Our story doesn't work...
We have a brilliant writer on board so this shouldn't be a problem. Furthermore we have a brilliant Editor on board who can always save it in the edit (if he reads this, he will most likely punch me ;) ).

*Someone gets sick...
We are all just human beings. We are all trained in various positions and can always jump in. Some of our crew even have acting experience. So don't you worry. ;)

Have we convinced you?
Yes? - Awesome!
No? - More questions? Please don't hesitate to ask. 

What can you do?
If you can't spare any money, we absolutely understand. But if you would like to help us please share this page with family and friends. 

If you can spare some change that would be incredible. And you will have our gratitude forever and ever and ever... and to the moon and back and to mars and so on.  

We will definitely keep you updated.

Thank you for your support. We really appreciate it.

.

story:
Short Pitch

"Mourning the death of his wife, Mr.Wang's life is turned upside down when he finds her vibrator"

Synopsis

Vibration is a short comedy and touching drama about a 72 year old Chinese man who struggles with emptiness and loneliness after the death of his wife. While organizing her possessions, he happens to discover a vibrator under her bed. The problem is that he lacks an understanding about the modern sexual technology that he discovered … or maybe about her. Our intention with Vibration is to explore a human relationship and loneliness often caused by a lack of communication and selfishness: that we are living in an increasingly lonely world; that we live in a modern society that is often proud for the development of communication technology while at the same time losing real intimacy. Comedy is the ideal genre to explore these themes by turning our tears into irony, into laughter, and then into pathos. 


Director/Writer - Bareun Jo

Filmography
 2009 “No one believes we will die”, Director, Writer
2012 “Bowwow!”Director, Writer, Editor 
2012 “The Hole”, Director, Writer, Producer 
2013 “One Hundred Grams”, Director, Writer 
2014 “SURA: The Emperor’s Banquet”, Director, Writer, Producer 

Awards & Screenings 

"SURA: The Emperor’s Banquet” 2015
The Official Selection, La Guarimba Film Festival, Italy 2015
The Official Selection, River Bend Film Festival, USA 2015
The Official Selection, Naver Short Film Corner, South Korea 
The Official Selection, Las Vevas Film Awards, USA 2015

"One Hundred Grams” 2013
The Winner, Best Student Narrative, Monarch Film Festival, USA 2013
The Official Selection, Roho Short Film Festival, UK 

"The Hole” 2014
The Winner, Best Film, Roho International Short Film Festival, UK 
"Bowwow!” 2012
The Nominee, Best Youth Film, London Panasonic Short Film Natiuon, UK 
"No one believes we will die” 2009
Best Student Artist, Richard Challoner Art Competition, UK


Vibration has been shortlisted for BFI short fund!

Enable Shorts Film Fund is part of Film London’s city-wide short film fund, London Calling. Funded by the BFI, Creative Skillset and The Wandsworth Film Office, London Calling is part of the BFI NET.WORK. It provides an annual fund to assist in the production or completion of short film projects, with the maximum award available being £3,500. Our application we submitted at the end of October has successfully been shortlisted in the final 5, with 2 films getting funded by the end of January. This money from the fund will cover the rest of the budget after our fundraising. Overall, the budget of the film will be around £7500


CREW for Vibration!


Mood Board


STORYBOARD


Mr. Batjargal Balgan! 


Batjargal Balgan is a professional actor, dancer and choreographer. He used to work in the film industry in Poland, and had moved to the UK! Check out videos below to watch his performance! 


What will the money be spent on?

>£300 - Actors pay

>£300 - Crew Pay

>£1000 - Location Rental

>£2000 - Kit Rental

>£800 - Production Design

>£500 - Music 

>£250 - Publicity Costs


GIFT for donator! 

£10.00 - We will put your name on our thanks to list on rolling credit! 

£25.00 - We will invite you to our screening party! Don't miss your chance to watch the movie at awesome movie theater! 

£40.00 - DVD + screening invitation and Thanks credit! 

£100.00 - Poster + DVD + Screening Invitation + Thanks to

£150.00 - Everything above + You're very own vibrator! 

£200.00 - Associate Producer Credit

 >£300 - Actors pay
>£300 - Crew Pay
>£1000 - Location Rental
>£2000 - Kit Rental
>£800 - Production Design
>£500 - Music 
>£250 - Publicity Costs

GIFT for donator! 
£10.00 - We will put your name on our thanks to list on rolling credit! 
£25.00 - We will invite you to our screening party! Don't miss your chance to watch the movie at awesome movie theater! 
£40.00 - DVD + screening invitation and Thanks credit! 
£100.00 - Poster + DVD + Screening Invitation + Thanks to
£150.00 - Everything above + You're very own vibrator! 
£200.00 - Associate Producer Credit

story: Stephen Holman, City Council member of Ward 7 in Norman OK, has been wrongly charged with a felony.  He not only serves on the city council but is the general manager at a glass pipe and furniture store called The Friendly Market.  The Norman Police raided the store on the 9th of December 2015, seized all the stock in the store.  And are now charging Stephen with a felony.  This campaign is to support him and contribute a small amount to aid in the legal process.  We intend to push back against the city of Norman and the intimidation tactics they use to close down stores such as the Friendly Market in Norman, Oklahoma.  Thank you for your love and support!!
