story:
Yo soy Agustín, y hago parte de un equipo de personas que hace rato vienen trabajando para hacer películas. Hicimos una, Carta a los Marcianos, que se estrenó en 2015. Ahora queremos hacer otra. 

El proyecto se llama El Estudiante de Cine, y ya fue seleccionado para participar en laboratorios de guión y mercados. Aún así, es difícil que la gente confíe en un proyecto que no ha conseguido dinero y que aún no tiene imágenes. Entonces nos propusimos a hacer esto: conseguir el primer dinero a través de crowdfunding, así el riesgo de invertir se hace mínimo. Con esta plata, vamos a filmar un corto, que habita el mismo universo de la película, y que nos servirá para mostrar cómo se ve el film que tenemos en mente, además de facilitarnos conseguir el dinero necesario para el largometraje (que no es poco). 

I'm Agustin, and I'm part of a group of people that have been working for some time towards making films. This group is called Capataz Cine, and in 2015, we released our first film, A letter to Martians. Now we want to make another one.

The project is called The Film Student, and it has already been selected to participate in scriptwriter's workshops and film markets. Still, it's hard for people to trust a project that hasn't raised any money yet and has no images. As in any other project, raising the first money is the hardest part, because it seems risky. This is why we started this campaign: through crowdfunding, we minimize the risk for the first investors, and we can raise enough to get ourselves some images! So with this money we'll make a short film, which inhabits the same universe as the feature and looks a lot like the real thing, so we will be able to show how it looks in our heads, which will in turn  help us get the money necessary for the feature.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 3.400 USD, para poder filmar un corto con la calidad y la precisión de una película de verdad. Implica pagarle a un equipo, asumir costos de movilidad y comidas, poder alquilar equipos y contar con actores buenos. 

A cambio, ofrecemos humildes pero variadas recompensas, la más importante de ellas: poder ver el corto, con tu nombre al final, y ver que de una contribución acaso pequeña, salió un objeto concreto. 

We need around 3.400 USD to shoot the short film with the presicion and quality of a feature film. This money will enable us to pay our crew, movility, catering, rentals and access really good actors.

In return, we offer humble yet interesting rewards, the most important of which is this: you'll see the finished film. You'll see how from a contribuiton, no matter what size, a concrete object was made.

Riesgos y desafíos

Hacer una película no es fácil. Hacer un corto tampoco. Pero esta campaña nos da la linda posibilidad de acercarnos a nuestro público. Que vean, y ojalá disfruten, del proceso. Estoy convencido que cuando uno entiende el proceso, ve los errores, y entiende las dificultades, disfruta mucho más del resultado final. Me alegra la posibilidad de que el público participe de todo este rollo, y que cuando vea finalmente el producto final, se sienta parte, y comparta el logro como propio.

Making a feature film isn't easy. Neither is making a short one, but this campaign gives us a greatly appreciated opportunity to reach our audience. It will invite them to see, and hopefully enjoy, our process. I am convinced, that when you participate in the process, and you see the mistakes and the obstacles, your enjoyment of the finished product is far greater. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to let the audience be a part of this process, and that when they see the films, they will share the achievement as their own.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Difundir se volvió la palabra clave de nuestros tiempos. Así que para citar a un personaje de la película: -Tuitialo mi amor. 

Sharing has become a rather key word in our times. Seems needless to say, but to quote one of our  characters: - Also, tweet it ma luv.

story:
Short Summary

WHO KNEW will be the debut feature film for Nuh! Productions. 

The team, Angela Pezzano and Dulce Aguilar have sat on this incredibly moving script for seven years; fine tuning their craft of film making to reach the level of awesomeness required to make it into a brilliant piece of cinema …. And at last, we are ready!

                       

Who Knew is a portrait of adolescence about ambition, the love of drugs, the art of not eating, family pressures and the ugly truth of social responsibilities. Set against the backdrop of a blue collar, multicultural Greater West Sydney suburb, the story follows an unlikely friendship between the provocative wild child and the brainiac literally killing herself to be number one.

Domeninca and Lexie, our two leading ladies; were brought to life by Angela Pezzano, a writer/actor/director who has a slate of video and stage work under her belt. Her short film Whispers (directed and co-produced by Angela; co-produced by Dulce) was screened and awarded at several festivals in Australia, notably as a finalist of the Women Say Something 2014 festival.  Her partner in film making crime, Dulce Aguilar hails from a variety of specialised backgrounds from Camera to Producing and Coordinating to Assistant Directing and Location Management. She likes to title herself, simply, Filmmaker. 

A philosophy that holds a lot of importance to Nuh! is:

Thank you George Eliot! We feel that by making this film; by telling stories that inspire change and encouraging people to think and talk about confronting issues,  we are doing this. We invite you to join us in doing so.


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

In an ideal world, a target budget of $106,000 would ensure completion of the film and life would be easier.  But easy would be boring!

So for this campaign, our initial goal is $31,500.  The money raised in this campaign will assist with:

  • Equipment Hire; so that we can actually record something to show you

and

  • Art Department; an essential part of Angela’s vision are the particular individual styles of each character which is crucial to the film’s uniqueness
  • plus Covering fees associated with our Indiegogo campaign

Some of our awesome perks for the campaign include:

* Visiting the set

* Being an extra on the film

* Naming a minor character

* Exclusive T-shirts with quotes from the film!


THE IMPACT:

Who Knew is an awareness project in the form of a film.

We aim to make an emotional impact on our audiences to bring awareness and open up discussions about eating disorders, drug abuse, sexuality and family relationships. These issues are very important to us because unfortunately, they are still rife and prevalent in today’s society.  People tend to ignore these issues by brushing it off as “just a phase” or hoping that the signs they see are not really there, so that they don’t have to take responsibility.  We want to show audiences that it’s okay to ask for help, that it’s okay to ask your peers how they are doing, that its ok if life is tough - that they don’t have to do it alone.

Support goes a long way, but we want to push this further by creating open forums at our film screening nights through Q & A’s and talks with issue-related organisations. We are working towards partnering with a charity that aligns with the film’s themes and having them at screenings as well as having a perk that donates a portion of the funds to them. Our hope is that this film can make a difference to someone’s life. Even just one.

As our good friend Gandhi once said...

How great, that as a contributor you can be part of such a positive and empowering change.


RISKS & CHALLENGES:

There are always challenges when it comes to film making. Bad weather, not enough money, schedule clashes, Divas…but the risk? The risk of keeping silent about these issues….

The risk of staying silent could mean your child is not telling you something they don’t know how to.

The risk of staying silent could mean your best friend is slowly harming themselves in front of your very own eyes.

The risk of staying silent could mean you don’t know how to get out of your uncontrollable spiral.

No matter what, this film needs to be made and shown.  It is far too important to us to let it stay on paper any longer.

In order to ensure filming occurs and the film is completed, we plan to run a tight-production ship with a bare minimum crew and calling in solid i-owe-you’s to keep costs down. We will utilise connections to source amazing location gems in the Greater West Sydney area and collaborate with some amazing emerging talents. 

We have worked on so many independent projects with little to no funding, including our award winning short Whispers, we have the experience and problem solving attitude to be able to make Who Knew on a small scale. It’s our million dollar project on a $106,000 budget.              

                             


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you’re struggling financially, we hear ya, we’ve been through it! You can help by sharing our campaign with everyone you know across all your social media platforms and together we can make Who Knew the great film that we know it will be. And who knows, maybe we’ll see YOU at a screening nearby!

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN: https://igg.me/at/WhoKnewMovie

LIKE US on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/WhoKnewMovie

                                             www.facebook.com/nuhprod

FOLLOW US on Twitter @WhoKnewMovie @NuhProductions

SEE US on Instagram NuhProductions

CHECK OUT our company website www.nuh.com.au

SUBSCRIBE to us on YOUTUBE: NUHFILMS

JOIN our subscription list: http://goo.gl/forms/onV7SR5De8

story:
STAYING VIGILANT: A 12-STEP PROGRAM FOR SUPERHEROES

Vigilantism is running rampant in the streets. Super powered beings are dishing out their own brand of justice. But in our world, that's assault. When you dress up in tights and beat up the "badguys," you don't need a costume. You need therapy. The Staying Vigilant Program seeks to rehabilitate vigilantes into normal, functioning, productive members of society.

THE GOOD

The creative minds from Mega Ultra Studios and Byrdman Group that brought you "Happy Birthday to Me" and "My New Best Friend" (winner of three awards at the 48 Hour Film Project/ Albuquerque Sci-Fi) have a new project. This trailer placed in the top 5 at the Shoot Santa Fe Pilot Project during the The Santa Fe Film Festival, and has been gaining more and more support ever since. M-Day Films has joined forces to cast a mighty team of talented actors and actresses to lend their performances to the show.

THE BAD

With all this traction and support, you'd think the big-time studios and distributors would be lining up at the door to hand over all that cold, hard cash to make this series happen. For some reason, they seem to be more interested in Deadpool or Batman v. Superman, things that already have an established following. Crazy, I know.
So, there are all these things that need funding: costumes, props, special effects, cameras, lenses, microphones, lights, food (Actors need to eat? Oh, yeah,) promotions, marketing. Wow, who knew this web-series stuff would be so needy?

THE UGLY PRETTY. OH, SO PRETTY.

Let's break it down. Here's what we got. Great idea? Superheroes in therapy. Check. Amazing and talented cast and crew with a proven track record? Check and double-check. The funding needed to bring it to reality? Uhh.. wait! No, check! That's right. We have YOU! 

See, if you invest in Staying Vigilant, not only are you bringing a fun and unique idea to life, you're also getting some really cool stuff. With perks like early releases, signed posters, DVDs, walk-on roles, and producer credits, it's a win-win-win. You win, the show wins, everybody wins. Winning feels good, doesn't it? 

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

CUE THE SARAH MCLACHLAN

With your help today, you can save the lives of our cherished superheroes. They don't understand that their actions have consequences, or that destroying a city block to stop a thief isn't necessarily the right thing to do. Help them learn that teaching teenage sidekicks to hurt people isn't good for the child, that brooding on rooftops and keeping dual identities is no way to behave. With your investment in Staying Vigilant, you'll help make the world brighter... for everyone. Join us today, won't you?

story:
Hello everybody,

supporters 70-80 will have the chance to win an original print of THE UNSEEN SEEN! Find THE UNSEEN SEEN on my website


Good luck and hopefully welcome You on board of the crowd!
 
Breaking News: The Lifesaving Machines are published in BJP, april 2016, on the Cover plus 16 pages!


THE LIFESAVING MACHINES

A PHOTOBOOK PROJECT by REINER RIEDLER

The book:

After more then 4 years of intense work I would like to publish a book. The plan is to make a book with the size 23x28 cm, 160 pages, around 80 images, Hardcover. Editing and design are not done yet, but designers already did some drafts, which really look great! So let Yourself surprise!

There are still a few trips to do, but mainly the work is done. The amount I need refers to book design, text + translation and printing/binding costs. For me as an individual it´s a huge amount, which I cannot finance myself.

I hope that the book will become real with the help of this Campaign! Thank You so much for Your participation and support!


The Story:

In 2011 I visited the neonathology of an Austrian children´s hospital. When I entered the large, dark room for the first time in the middle of the night. Everywhere there were blinking lights and the hum of individual beeping sounds. A small group of newborn children was sleeping here.

This moment, which I will never forget, was the starting point for my photoproject. I sought to make accessible a taboo topic without depicting any suffering and without compromising people in difficult circumstances. I had to tell the story in a different manner.

Slowly, I began to collect images of historical and contemporary devices, photographed before a dark background - isolated from the environment in which they were used - to direct the attention entirely to their function and their peculiar aesthetics.





These are my offers:


1. Project Contributor - THE LIFESAVING MACHINES

This is an offer for the small purse, but a great help for the book production and You can become part of it!

Next time, when we meet, You will get a big hug!

Plus Your name will be listed amongst the contributors inside the book.



2. Junior Partner - THE LIFESAVING MACHINES

Button + Postcard: As a Junior Partner You will receive a signed Postcard plus a  Campaign - button (38mm) of THE LIFESAVING MACHINES by mail. Plus Your name will be listed amongst the contributors inside the book.





3. Book ALBANIA

Get one of the rare copies of my first book "Albania - Life at the the periphery" from 2001. Signed and wrapped.
(Shipping for Europe included. Please add 16,-$ for international shipping).

Find my project about ALBANIA on my website


4. PHOTO BOOK - THE LIFESAVING MACHINES

Congratulation! Your are one of the first to get the book!
You will receive a signed copy of the book by mail.
Plus Your name will be listed amongst the contributors inside the book.
(Shipping for Europe included. Please add 16,-$ for international shipping).

(Shop price will be 52;-€/57,-$, preorder price on IndieGoGo 48,-€/53,-$ plus mailing fee 14,50€/16,-$ makes 63,-€/69,-$ within Europe)

The book needs to be shipped (also to Austria), but to compensate Your mailing costs, everybody, who takes the presale perk will get an original signed print in postcard size!!!

story_txt:
Hello everybody,supporters 70-80 will have the chance to win an original print of THE UNSEEN SEEN! Find THE UNSEEN SEEN on my websiteGood luck and hopefully welcome You on board of the crowd! Breaking News: The Lifesaving Machines are published in BJP, april 2016, on the Cover plus 16 pages!
 THE LIFESAVING MACHINES


A PHOTOBOOK PROJECT by REINER RIEDLER
The book:

After more then 4 years of intense work I would like to publish a book. The plan is to make a book with the size 23x28 cm, 160 pages, around 80 images, Hardcover. Editing and design are not done yet, but designers already did some drafts, which really look great! So let Yourself surprise!
 There are still a few trips to do, but mainly the work is done. The amount I need refers to book design, text + translation and printing/binding costs. For me as an individual it´s a huge amount, which I cannot finance myself. 
I hope that the book will become real with the help of this Campaign! Thank You so much for Your participation and support!
The Story:
In 2011 I visited the neonathology of an Austrian children´s hospital. When I entered the large, dark room for the first time in the middle of the night. Everywhere there were blinking lights and the hum of individual beeping sounds. A small group of newborn children was sleeping here.
This moment, which I will never forget, was the starting point for my photoproject. I sought to make accessible a taboo topic without depicting any suffering and without compromising people in difficult circumstances. I had to tell the story in a different manner. 
Slowly, I began to collect images of historical and contemporary devices, photographed before a dark background - isolated from the environment in which they were used - to direct the attention entirely to their function and their peculiar aesthetics.


These are my offers:

Next time, when we meet, You will get a big hug!

Plus Your name will be listed amongst the contributors inside the book.

story:
Short Summary

The Last Architect is a short film exploring the relationship between two generations. It pays homage to an industry and its workers that are now forgotten, paying tribute to these men that risked their lives daily to create prosperities for small towns. Giving light to the struggles these men faced, we feel we need to tell this part of history before it's forgotten.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So far the crew have managed to raise £2000 but we need to raise a further £3500 to make this ambitious project do justice to the people the film is inspired by.

So far we have managed to raise £2000 by begging our friends and families to support our project as much as they can but we need your help to help raise the further £3500. This money will allow us to hire better equipment to make a nicer looking and sounding film, hire the right actor to portray the beautifully written characters and to make sure that all the crew that are working for free are well fed and sustained to keep them constantly creative.  

We have some amazing perks to offer people who help make this project come to life. Perks such as early access to a digital version of the film, a physical DVD (or Blu-ray) copy of the film upon release, an a4 copy of the official poster, a custom mug, associate and executive producer credits, and also a chance to come to the films first screening. 

Those that contribute, share and like our Facebook page will be kept updated during the entire film and also the success after the film has been made.

The Impact

We have a large team hard at work in different departments to try and make the best film we can, but we need your help to make everyones dream come to life and create the film we all envision. 

The team have been making short films together for the past 4 years and have had numerous successes in the film festival circuits with some members winning awards. All members of the crew were commissioned by the UK arts council to make a film for consideration to be part of Channel 4's random acts stream. With a wealth of experience and professionalism you will be investing in a crew you can trust.

The Team

Writer/Director - ​Nathan Glendinning

A multi-award winning filmmaker and 2015 graduate from the University for the Creative Arts, Nathan Glendinning has successfully managed to direct a number of short films as well as collaborating with award-winning filmmakers. Originally from South Shields, a small quiet seaside town, Nathan has a strong emotional connection to ‘The Last Architect’ with a lot of the film being inspired by many aspects of his own childhood.

Showreel - https://vimeo.com/166730762

 

Producer - Richard Pugh

A Young and creative producer with over 6 year’s experience making short films. Richard Pugh has worked on a number of short films as producer and has worked on several commissioned projects, one of which by the UK arts council. Richard's key focus is story, characters and making sure they are communicated to the audience correctly, following this formulae he ensures that the film is as good as it can be. 

 

Cinematographer - George Pearton

George a young cinematography specialist with a keen eye and attention for detail. In 2014 he was awarded the Billy Williams Scholarship for his achievement in Cinematography. George was also submitted by the university to Camerimage, he was also put forward for a Guild of Television Cameramen award. George’s knowledge of short film form and vast experience in cinematography practices and influences make him an asset to each film he has worked on.

Showreel - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KBRCLXK95aI

Production Designer - Rob King

Rob has designed several short films both in his time at university as well as a number of independent shorts. On a smaller budget, Rob has worked as production designer for a short films funded by the Random Acts and Ishorts schemes. More recently, Rob has worked on seasons 4-6 of BBC's 'Call the Midwife' - first as an intern, then as a full-time art department assistant. In this time, Rob has developed his skills in graphic design, set dressing, prop making and assisting the production as a whole.

Risks & Challenges

As always, with films there is a risk. This is why our team have been working so tirelessly trying to make sure that their job is as rehearsed as it can be to maximise efficiency, creativity and reduce the risk of any complications. 

The film itself is a huge challenge to undertake, however it is one we feel (and we hope you do now too) is something we can accomplish to the highest standard. We would be extremely grateful if you could be a part of this and help us achieve our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel like you don't want to sponsor this film, we ask that if you simply share this video. If you do this we can reach a wider audience not only for the funding but for the final film as well, guaranteeing that this passionate and memorable story connects with as many people possible.

We greatly appreciate any help that you can give us, please make us aware of your kindness so we  can thank you on our social media.

story:
"Life is the right of any Human. Not a privilege for the fortunate, the planned, or the 'perfect'."

 

 

Who I am: My Story-

My story is a complicated one...complicated because, I shouldn't be making this film; I shouldn't even be here in the first place. My name is Kayla Keen, the director and writer of the upcoming short film "The Home". Allow me to tell you my story. When I was still in my mother’s womb, all the tests that my mother was given defined me as incomplete. The results determined that my brain was not developed and that, on the slim chance I happened to survive after birth, I would live with severe complications and not be able to do, or be, much of anything. 

My mother was constantly told to terminate the pregnancy; terminate me. This was for her benefit and her quality of life she was assured. But my mother is a smart woman and I wish I had her faith because, whether I'd be with her for 50 years, 5 days, or just 5 minutes, she still chose me.  Twenty one years later, now that I have the means, tools, and people to bring it justice, I have a story to tell. It's about the Sanctity Of Life; a topic that is so readily ignored in society today.

 

Our story begins.....

               Amidst the penniless, jobless, and pure down on their luck, a boarding house, affectionately called "The Home” opens its doors once again despite the hard times. But not everything is as it seems.  Here, works Mara, a charming woman who offers our main character, Jefferson, the job of groundskeeper for the estate. All seems to be well, that is until Jefferson’s curiosity brings him to question the work of The Home. When his inquiries are met with nothing but disregard and redirection, he sets out to find the answers for himself. But what he discovers behind the door at the end of the hall is a truth so sinister he wishes he could forget. With The Home’s secrets revealed, Jefferson must make the choice between losing the job his young family so desperately needs, or to close the doors, sealing Mara’s secrets indefinitely and thus, going against everything he believes in.

 

This story represents the battle pro-life faces against an opponent that has been exposed but is still protected and thriving in plain sight.  We ask for your support in the making of this film. A film that gives a voice to those that don’t have one.

 

To make it happen....

This story I am up against feels like a giant. The fact of the matter is, this project is going to get made. But to make it the best it can be, we need YOU! The budget for this film is set at only $4,000; a very reasonable goal for a short film of this magnitude. The good news? We have already raised 1/2 of our budget. We are asking for your help to match our current funds and play a major role in helping us finally fulfill our projected budget! Every penny you donate will go towards:

  • Locations: The main concern here is The Home. Because it is the main focus of the entire film, we have been looking for months at plantations and estates trying to find the perfect setting that will be the focal point of our story.
  • Food for Cast and Crew: My motto for set: Fed well, works well. Help me provide meals for those giving their time and talents.
  • Transportation: Because we will be using large and/or fragile pieces of professional equipment, part of the budget will go towards renting a truck to safely and easily transport our equipment to and from location.
  • Set design/Wardrobe: For the past several months, we have been collecting antiques and clothing pieces that would fit into our 1930's/1940's styled era. But we are still far from having everything we need. Your donations will help us create a look that will transport our audience back in time.

 

 

If you cannot donate at this time...

Not to worry! You can still help out by sharing this campaign with others and getting the word out. Just think, by simply clicking share, you can disperse this campaign for hundreds of others to see! What a contribution! 

 

Thank you for taking the time to visit our campaign.

Let's make a movie!

Let's make a movie!

story:
"The Lonely Road" Project 

"THE LONELY ROAD" is the first part of a two film project that writer/director DARREN K HAWKINS has been gaining momentum to bring to the screens for some time now.

Darren has been in the film industry for some sixteen years now. Starting as a actor, he has progressed to script writing and directing. Since transitioning to working behind the camera, Darren has co-directed the feature film "The 7th Hunt" (which saw release and distribution), directed "Next Door to the Velinskys" (starring Matt Doran from "The Matrix" which has screened world wide) and recently co-wrote the supernatural thriller "Ravenswood" (which has already been picked up for US distribution).

 

This campaign will not only serve to help make "The Lonely Road", but Darren and the team want the word to spread about the second project, the feature film "Vinegar Hill".

Getting it done and getting it done RIGHT is what the team want to achieve. Helping this happen, words will only fall short to properly express the gratitude that Darren and the team can express in thanks and gratitude to help get this done.  No matter the contribution, be it big or small, without the crowdfunding support and contribution, this won't have the same impact as it could have. Everyone's input is valued and important.

Meet Our Key Cast

"Phoebe Jones", our intrepid paranormal investigator will be played by Gianna Aspencade.

Gianna is a multi-talented actress, who was rated in a 2013 IMDB pole at 2nd as the most beautiful actress in Australia and New Zealand. A 1st degree black belt in Tae Kwon-Do, Gianna is a true force to be reckoned with.  Gianna has starred in the films "The Devils 6th Commandant" , "Mirror Mirror" and "SubCulture" and has acted in a number of US television pilots.

 

"Leanne Summerville" , Phoebe's best friend, "earth mother" and reluctant fellow investigator will be played by Melanie Thorpe.



Melanie first came to Darren's attention when they worked together on the television series "Dark Minds", then later "Lucid". Melanie is someone who not only has all the pedigree acting skills of a lead performer, but she is one of the most genuine, easy going people to work with. When Melanie and Gianna "clicked" in an early pre-production meeting, Darren KNEW he had found the right chemistry for his two leading ladies
 

 

What are the team asking for? What will be offer in return?

 

Let's be direct.  Film making is no "hollywood fairy tale". We'd all love to believe that it's as simple as having a good story. Without the financial backing it's HARDER to make and complete a good film.

This is where YOU, the crowd in crowdfunding comes in.

Purchasing costumes, location hire, film equipment hire, on set catering ..... and that's just to MAKE the film!  Post production of editing, visual effects, sound scaping, music score and then marketing ..... you can see that bringing a script to life isn't as simple as the glamourised  images of film making sometimes make it out to be!

And we haven't even got to the part of trying to PAY the cast and crew for their time and talents!

 

SO, WHAT ARE WE GOING TO OFFER YOU, THE "CROWD" IN THE "CROWDFUNDING"?

You'll see we have TWO TIERS of perks.  One that is aimed at the individual who is local to us that we can offer something specific (such as on set visits and perks aimed at local film makers such as script editing packages, film making packages as well as local actors such as showreel packages).  The other being a digital perk focus for overseas backers that will also include some script packages for overseas film makers.

Regardless of what level of funding we reach, "The Lonely Road" WILL be made.  The only difference will be as to what level we make it at, such as what locations we utilise, the gear we can rent, etc.   

 

What if I can't contribute financially? 

The BEST way for you to help us out if you're unable to contribute financially is to share this campaign with your friends and family.   Get the word out!  Hashtag us, share the indiegogo campaign. All help will be loved and appreciated!
story_txt:
"The Lonely Road" Project 
"THE LONELY ROAD" is the first part of a two film project that writer/director DARREN K HAWKINS has been gaining momentum to bring to the screens for some time now.Darren has been in the film industry for some sixteen years now. Starting as a actor, he has progressed to script writing and directing. Since transitioning to working behind the camera, Darren has co-directed the feature film "The 7th Hunt" (which saw release and distribution), directed "Next Door to the Velinskys" (starring Matt Doran from "The Matrix" which has screened world wide) and recently co-wrote the supernatural thriller "Ravenswood" (which has already been picked up for US distribution).
 
This campaign will not only serve to help make "The Lonely Road", but Darren and the team want the word to spread about the second project, the feature film "Vinegar Hill".Getting it done and getting it done RIGHT is what the team want to achieve. Helping this happen, words will only fall short to properly express the gratitude that Darren and the team can express in thanks and gratitude to help get this done.  No matter the contribution, be it big or small, without the crowdfunding support and contribution, this won't have the same impact as it could have. Everyone's input is valued and important.Meet Our Key Cast
"Phoebe Jones", our intrepid paranormal investigator will be played by Gianna Aspencade.

Gianna is a multi-talented actress, who was rated in a 2013 IMDB pole at 2nd as the most beautiful actress in Australia and New Zealand. The BEST way for you to help us out if you're unable to contribute financially is to share this campaign with your friends and family.   Get the word out!  Hashtag us, share the indiegogo campaign. All help will be loved and appreciated!

story:
It seems like our world is spinning into an alternate universe of utter craziness during this election season, and the media only magnifies it. Now, more than ever, it is crucial to have spiritual voices in the mass media, especially in the forms of entertainment that most people consume. "American Yogi" is a story about love and enlightenment, a voice that is joining with others to give insight into the wisdom traditions from the East that can bring sanity - and joy - to our troubled times.

"There is now the possibility for movies to embody that arising state of consciousness." -- Eckhart Tolle


American Yogi is a film about Maharaj-ji (Neem Karoli Baba), the guru Ram Dass wrote about in “Be Here Now," as told through the personal story of one young man who traveled to India to find his path. It is also about the joys and difficulties of walking the spiritual path in America.

It is difficult to express all the love and appreciation we feel for those who have already contributed. As a result of our first fundraising campaign, we were able to complete the original version of "American Yogi,” which premiered at the International Film Festival of India. Response to the first version of the movie has been overwhelmingly positive. Here is some viewer feedback:

"I am so excited to be a part of this brilliant journey of the heart!  It will transform the lives of so many."'

"Watching "American Yogi"  turned out to be a huge blessing for me. I LOVE it! And your story so resonated with me on levels deeper than you can imagine."

“It just seems quite important that it be available, as I think there are so many of us out here that want to know we're not alone.”

"Thank you so much for this film. I have just watched it and I can't stop smiling."

"By the end of the film I was left with a feeling of greater love of Maharaj-ji and for all of existence." 

"A deeply inspired film! About what the Western mind calls fiction--and the East calls reality." -- Shankar Mohan, Director of the International Film Festival of India

First Stage Complete

Thanks to your enthusiasm and generosity during our first campaign, we were able to secure a major sales agent to promote our movie for release into theaters and digital media platforms. This is crucial, because it is very difficult for an unknown moviemaker to get anyone to pay attention to a movie, especially a spiritual one. Working with our sales agent at Social Construct Films, we have improved various elements of the film to ensure that it can go beyond its niche and reach a wider audience.

Now for the Final Stage

The movie is now in its final phase of production and promotion. We have made many changes to the film already, but we still need to raise money to complete the revised version. In addition, we have to meet specific technical and legal standards in order for a distributor to promote the movie. We need to pay for insurance, legal fees, and costs associated with converting the film into required formats for various venues. This is why we are creating a second campaign to finally bring this movie to the world, on screens big and small.

Featuring an awesome movie soundtrack by Jai Uttal, Krishna Das, MC Yogi and Wah!

  

 

Depending on your level of support, we thank you with gifts, including:

  • A copy of "Be Here Now," autographed for you by Ram Dass
  • Photographs suitable for framing. Your choice of photos of Maharaj-ji
  • A silk altar cloth/scarf from Varanasi, India blessed by a saint
  • Medallion of Maharaj-ji to wear
  • Rudraksha or sandalwood mala dipped in the Ganges River blessed by a saint
  • The trip of a lifetime to India

... and more cool stuff! Take a look at the perks.

 

  

(framed photo of Maharaj-ji for the "Devotee" perk is the one pictured here, above)

Contributions are 100% tax deductible. 25% of the profits from this film will go to feeding hungry people in India and supporting Maharaj-ji's temple in New Mexico.

(People waiting in line for food at a Maharaj-Ji temple in India)​

 

"American Yogi is an inspiration."
--Ram Dass

“Brilliant! An incredible story told very well with a great sense of humor."
-- Carole Dean, President of From the Heart Productions

"American Yogi is emotionally powerful, beautifully put together, inspiring and fun!"
-- Zak Kilberg, President, Social Construct Films

"The most wonderful part was the feeling of deep inner peace and sense of reverence I was left with..."
--Uma Reed, Kirtan leader

"American Yogi will open your heart and just might change your life."
--James Baraz, author of "Awakening Joy"

 

Steven Newmark, Director

Dr. Newmark is a filmmaker and psychotherapist who specializes in relationships and spirituality. His best-selling relationship videos have been featured in the New York Times, San Francisco Examiner, Houston Chronicle, and on the Late Night with David Letterman Show.

Zoe Durga Harber, Writer/Producer

Zoe is a writer who lives in Asheville, NC. She has received awards for her poetry and essays and is published in an anthology called Remember Me As a Time of Day  (Burning Bush Press, 2012). Her work a psychotherapist and meditator inform the content and themes of her writing.

Jaime Byrd, Editor/Producer

Jaime is a three-time Emmy award nominated director and editor and founder of Blind Lyle Films. She has directed and edited several short films, documentaries, and music videos, as well as a  web series called "Luck and the Virgin."

Adam J. Cohen, Producer

After becoming a veterinarian, Adam followed his love of film and became a producer, line producer and production manager on many projects. He founded the Unofficial Google+ Film Festival.

Jai Uttal, Musician

Jai is a grammy award nominee and a pioneer in the world music community with his eclectic East-meets-West sound.

Krishna Das, Musician

Known as yoga's "rock star," Krishna Das has taken the call and response chanting out of yoga centers and into concert halls, becoming a worldwide icon and the best-selling western chant artist of all time.

 

Help us make it happen! Namaste ॐ

story:
Summary 

Hello on our Pigalle team,
We have Spencer Charles as Writer and Director, Taylor Brown as Director and Director Of Photography, Marina Skye as Assistant Director and Set Designer, Jasmine Clay as Producer, Chris Patterson as Producer and Omari Ingram as Camera Operator.
 Our campaign will help us complete Season 1 of our webseries. We are passionate about this project and we want people to love it as much as we do.
Contributors will help us achieve the funding for production costs for season 1.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget for Season 1 is $7000. We are looking to film in different locations in Savannah, GA for a week. These locations will help us create the theme of the Red Light District. Here's the breakdown for our budget:

$2000 - Housing/Location ($350-400 a day for 5 days)

$2000 - Camera/Lighting/Audio Equipment ( includes the rental costs of 2 Canon C300 cameras with a lens kit, a full lighting kit equipped with 2 Kino Flo Divas and light panels, and an audio person)

$2000 - Food & Travel for Cast & Crew

$500 - Wardrobe & Production design

$500 - Posters & T-Shirts


The Impact

Pigalle is a series about a man's sensual obsession with a dancer and how it ultimately leads to his demise. This first installment is an introduction to all of the players and their stage. Pigalle was inspired by a trip to the Red Light District in Paris, France. 

The first episode takes place in a modern day brothel and consist of sultry imagery paired with a classical soundtrack to create the perfect illusion.The pilot introduces our main characters Cleo and Keshi and will continue to tell both of their stories as well as other main characters as the series unfolds. 

Our characters, soundtrack and cinematic details will draw our audience in, giving them the sensual Red Light District theme that flows throughout.

Risks & Challenges

Some challenges we could face will be scheduling and housing conflicts arising from our traveling plans to Savannah, Georgia.  With our production team keeping everyone from cast and crew schedules aligned. As well as confirming availability weeks in advance we will cut down on any scheduling conflicts we may come across.
Weather conditions can also play a role in shoot delays and cancellations. Our production team will have alternate indoor sets/locations in play due to any weather interruptions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute a lot, you can still help by simply sharing this page with a friend or family member letting them know about our crowd funding efforts. Thank You!

story:
Who are we?

We are filmmakers passionate about bringing unconventional stories to the screen. Robert W. Robbins (Director) and Lance Eliot Adams (Writer / Producer) started making short films eight years ago. iPhotographer is our most ambitious film project to date. 

 

Why are we running a Pre-sales campaign? 

1) We want as many people as possible to see this film. We put a lot of hard work, time, and money into this film and we want to share it with our friends, our family, their friends and their family and so on and so on. 

A donation $5 will give you a digital copy of the festival cut. 

2) Our next expense for this film is submitting to the festival circuit. Funds raised from this campaign will go towards festival submissions of which some can be upwards of $100. 

3) We want to pay our actors and crew. Everyone who worked on this film accepted deferred payment. They invested their time in making the film and we brought them on in the hopes that we would be able to pay them based on sales of the film.

Funds will be allocated to: 

 

Current Status of iPhotographer

Production on the film is complete. With a devoted cast and crew, we were able to film iPhotographer in six working days over a period of four months. 

Editing is complete and we currently have a working festival cut with a run time of 15 minutes and a Director’s cut with a run time of 22 minutes.

Post-Production is nearly complete. We have completed color correction and we have handed the film off to Post-Sound for audio sweetening. 

Depending on festival rules, we expect to release the finished film Spring 2017.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Please share with your networks. As independent filmmakers we rely heavily on word-of-mouth.

story:
Short Summary

Each summer in the city of Yulin, China, a special festival is held- the Yulin Dog Festival. You might think they celebrate dogs, but no, they slaughter thousands of dogs for human consumption. Often they are stolen pets (including military and police dogs) who are shipped in dirty, cramped, inhumane conditions thousands of miles to the dog meat market without food or water. Many die in transit, and those who survive meet a gruesome and brutal demise. 

My name is Sarah Spicer. I am a documentary producer and director and avid animal lover, though I feel especially close to dogs. As I write this, I have a puppy and two golden retrievers sleeping at my feet. They bring immense happiness to my life.

While researching for a documentary on the benefits of raw dog food, I came across the matter of the dog meat trade in China, a heavy subject that plagues both the people and the dogs of China, as well as dog lovers worldwide. I had first seen this issue on a Facebook post in the summer however, due to the graphic nature, I acknowledged it and moved on. I could not look. Months later the subject resurfaced and this time I could not turn my back. 

Dog meat is considered in China to be especially nourishing, and it is believed that the beating and torture of dogs makes the meat more tender. Those who consume dog meat are extremely passionate about their right to eat dog. Dog meat restaurants thrive in parts of China. Citizens and families are divided over this issue. Those who are opposed to the practice of eating dog meat have gone to great lengths to stop it, including helping dog meat traders find other sources of sustainable income, which I personally find incredibly inspiring. 

Most of China views and honors dogs as pets, family members and friends. It is estimated that up to 70% of pet owners in China have suffered the loss of a stolen pet assumed to have become a victim of the dog meat trade. 

Dog meat consumption is not exclusive to China and is more widespread than one would think. It is also consumed in Vietnam, parts of Europe, and in the U.S. backed countries of South Korea and the Philippines. And these are the ones we know about. 

What We Need 

We are seeking $100,000 to expose the reality of the dog meat trade in the this documentary. Our stretch goal is $150,000. 

This will cover the following initial costs: 

-Roundtrip airfare to China two times (once in the winter and once for the festival in the summer) for crew, security personnel, and gear. 

-Hotel, transportation, food and to hire a translator for while in China. 

-Visas/Passports and equipment

-Airfare and travel costs around the United States to interview activists, experts, scholars and policy makers

-Production and post productions cost including music score, editing, sound design, and master of the film. 

-P.R./Marketing and Social Media to push this film worldwide (the more people who know about it, the greater chance we have of making a difference)

-Rental costs to screen the film in theatres in Los Angeles and New York City

-Film festival submission and travel costs 

If we do not meet these goals we will continue our fundraising efforts privately. The funds we do receive will go towards as much of the production as we can afford.


The Impact

When this film is shown around the world, more people, cultures and nations will be motivated to be involved in helping create change. The more people who know, the more can be done to change or stop the dog meat trade altogether. Your contribution is the first step toward eradicating the suffering of the dogs who fall victim, and the families whose pets are subjected to the inhumane conditions of the dog meat trade. 


Risks & Challenges

Our greatest risk in doing this film is being prevented from filming in Yulin, China at the annual summer dog meat eating festival. Tensions are already high in that city due to the negative publicity the annual festival receives worldwide, and they do not like people coming to film the events there. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially at this point, that is completely ok. Thank you for taking the time to read this and educate yourself about the dog meat trade. Push this campaign to your friends, family, fellow animal lovers and social networks. Now you know, and your knowledge is powerful. Talk about this. Talk about the dog meat trade. Share this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Weibo and Renren. The more people who know, the more we can do.

Those who are opposed to the practice of eating dog meat have gone to great lengths to stop it, including helping dog meat traders find other sources of sustainable income, which I personally find incredibly inspiring. 
Most of China views and honors dogs as pets, family members and friends. It is estimated that up to 70% of pet owners in China have suffered the loss of a stolen pet assumed to have become a victim of the dog meat trade. 
Dog meat consumption is not exclusive to China and is more widespread than one would think. It is also consumed in Vietnam, parts of Europe, and in the U.S. backed countries of South Korea and the Philippines. And these are the ones we know about.    What We Need  We are seeking $100,000 to expose the reality of the dog meat trade in the this documentary. Our stretch goal is $150,000. 
This will cover the following initial costs: 
-Roundtrip airfare to China two times (once in the winter and once for the festival in the summer) for crew, security personnel, and gear. 
-Hotel, transportation, food and to hire a translator for while in China. 
-Visas/Passports and equipment
-Airfare and travel costs around the United States to interview activists, experts, scholars and policy makers
-Production and post productions cost including music score, editing, sound design, and master of the film. 
-P.R./Marketing and Social Media to push this film worldwide (the more people who know about it, the greater chance we have of making a difference)
-Rental costs to screen the film in theatres in Los Angeles and New York City
-Film festival submission and travel costs 
If we do not meet these goals we will continue our fundraising efforts privately. The funds we do receive will go towards as much of the production as we can afford.

   The Impact When this film is shown around the world, more people, cultures and nations will be motivated to be involved in helping create change. The more people who know, the more can be done to change or stop the dog meat trade altogether. Your contribution is the first step toward eradicating the suffering of the dogs who fall victim, and the families whose pets are subjected to the inhumane conditions of the dog meat trade.    
Risks & Challenges Our greatest risk in doing this film is being prevented from filming in Yulin, China at the annual summer dog meat eating festival. Tensions are already high in that city due to the negative publicity the annual festival receives worldwide, and they do not like people coming to film the events there. 

Other Ways You Can Help
 If you cannot contribute financially at this point, that is completely ok. Thank you for taking the time to read this and educate yourself about the dog meat trade. Push this campaign to your friends, family, fellow animal lovers and social networks. Now you know, and your knowledge is powerful. Talk about this. Talk about the dog meat trade. Share this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Weibo and Renren. The more people who know, the more we can do.

story:
Zora Dames, a young African-American writer, is determined to complete her first novel.  In hopes of bringing this dream to fruition, she hunkers down at the home of Janie Biddle, a white socialite grieving the loss of her husband. Despite their obvious differences, the two women form a meaningful emotional bond.

As Zora approaches the final chapters of her novel, her physical and mental health begins to suffer.  However, intestinal fortitude sees her through the task at hand. With  her completed manuscript in hand,  Zora plans a quick exit back to her family and friends.  Janie on the other hand, begins to struggle with this new pending separation.   In the end,  Zora bids Janie a fond farewell and moves on to a rewarding new chapter in her life.   Or does she?

Our supernatural/fantasy takes a few twists and turns, as the emotionally traumatized Zora and Janie find healing through their friendship.  And it's through this healing that they are able to move forward to face the realities of life --- for better or worse.


     Jennifer Rolle has been a lover of movies ever since she was a      kid growing up in the Bronx. She was formerly a member of            the account management team at the multi-cultural                        advertising  agency UniWorld Group, Inc.   A graduate of New        York University, Jennifer's prior work includes short films, "A          Conversation With Greg" and "Two Paychecks Away", which          she wrote, produced and directed, in association with Women Make Movies, Inc. 


  Karmia Berry's  (Zora Dames) acting career was launched on       the iconic PBS children's program, Sesame Street.  She has           performed in the Off-Broadway productions of "The Wiz"and         "Raisin".  Karmia  was also featured in the 2009 feature film,         "Notorious'.




   Liz Chuday (Janie Biddle) is a former journalist and published        author.  She has performed in  a number of stage productions       and television  shows, most notably the award winning  HBO            "Veep".  Liz divides  her time between New Jersey,                             Pennslyvania and Baltimore.



Our ideal target is $3,000 for a two day shoot. Your contribution will cover the costs for talent, crew, location, craft services, permits, music, fees, marketing and other incidentals.   In the event that we fall short of our desired amount, creative measures will be taken to roll out  a quality production. 


In appreciation for your gracious support, we will reward you with the following selections of perks: 

$5.00 Charlotte's Web - You will receive a sincere thank you at our website.

$10.00 Invisible Man - We will send you shout-outs on Twitter and/or Face book plus the previous perks.

$25.00 David Copperfield - Look forward to receiving our special thanks at the end of the film credit roll, plus a digital package (a downloadable copy of the film, script and official poster).

$35.00 Beloved - You will receive a copy of the film on DVD plus all other perks.

$50.00 The Joy Luck Club  -  You will receive a DVD, an invitation to our private screening of the film and all previously mentioned perks.

$75 Their Eyes Were Watching God -  You will be listed in the opening of film credits as "Associate Producer",  be included to the Internet Movie Data Base (IMDb), receive an invitation to the private screening and all perks.

$100 Wuthering Heights - You will be listed in the opening credits as "Associate Producer", you will receive an original poster (your name printed within credits) signed by cast and crew, plus all perks previously mentioned.

$250 The Great Gatsby - You will be listed in the opening credits as "Executive Producer" and of the wonderful perks that were previously mentioned. 


Please note the following:

  • Our production is scheduled for a mid-October shoot. 

  • You will receive weekly status reports (and videos when available).

  • We will submit our completed film  to a number festivals which include: Sundance, Tribeca, Montclair, Slamdance and Toronto, to name a few.  

  • Post production will begin immediately after wrapping in order to meet the December deadlines for the Spring 2016 programs. 


Rally around "Zora".  Please share our page through your social media or word of mouth. There is strength in numbers!


We appreciate the time that you took to review our page. Thanks for any possible consideration.

story:
I'm currently in Uganda. I have received beautiful messages of support throughout this campaign. WOW! And THANK YOU! Please follow this incredible adventure on facebook and Twitter. if you'll like to drop a few bucks after the campaign ends, please message me on fb or you can paypal direct to LC@LorraineChittock.com. You will STILL receive the rewards listed. 10% of your donation goes directly into animal situations I come across needing immediate help. The $1000 motorcycle will be donated to an animal organization after the five month trip through Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Mozambique and Zimbabwe.
 
"Lorraine's latest project is a film in Africa that brings two great passions together - a love of riding on two wheels (the motorcycle type) and a love for wildlife. Lorraine is in Africa at the moment making fantastic connections with wildlife protection groups, local riders, international people who do fantastic work in Africa, and anyone who merges riding and wildlife protection." — Michelle Clark

RIDE WITH ME!

THE MISSION
I will open up a whole new world for motorcyclists to experience in my film, Rallying for A Wild Life, while also supporting the wild we love. I'll show how you can easily come to Africa too. If you're a dedicated arm-chair traveler, I'll bring the wild to your living room.

BONUS —THE WILDLIFE PURSE
10% of all your contributions will go into my WILDLIFE PURSE. I'll pull out cash from this purse to be used to directly benefit wildlife situations as I encounter them. Down & dirty random acts of kindness with no admin costs. You will see photos on Facebook, Twitter and here.

Rallying for A WildLife, follows photojournalist Lorraine Chittock's African motorcycle adventure documenting two seemingly different groups, motorcyclists and animal lovers. She rides through Mozambique, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Zimbabwe and the Congo to interview bikers who work in Africa to protect the wild.



Rallying for A WildLife is a film showing how motorcyclists and wildlife conservationists are joining forces to protect wildlife and wild spaces in Africa. As I ride through Africa, here are just a few of the bikers biting back I will film:
   •   Bikers who go into the bush in their free time to pick up snares that kill wildlife.
   •   Bikers giving educational wildlife tours.
   •   Bikers devoting their lives to anti-poaching.
   •   Bikers re-wilding landscapes that have been destroyed.
   •   Bike riding rangers. Heroes who love wild life and wild spaces so much they risk becoming a meal on wheels.

Rallying for A WildLife is a call to arms to the worldwide motorcycle community to take back our wild — both inside and outside ourselves.


THE MESSAGE
Rallying applauds those risking it all for wildlife. For those wanting to help, the film gives solutions.
In Rallying for A WildLife we will support the wild, by visiting the wild — and prove wildlife has more value alive, than dead.
Remember Born Free, Daktari, Wild Kingdom? News headlines have spooked us from our African dreams.
Without tourism, governments don’t always appreciate wildlife and wild places. When tourist dollars flow in, governments and citizens begin to value wildlife over poaching.
I’ll show step by step how to make an incredible journey to Africa happen—including overcoming fears. Because all it really takes is to walk out the front door. This is the scariest and most difficult part of the journey.

WHO WILL WATCH?
Rallying for A WildLife is for:
   •   lovers of wild spaces
   •   animal lovers
   •   motorcyclists
   •   conservationists
   •   people with a hunger to be more connected with their WILD.

Few outside the animal loving community have the time or patience to watch an entire nature documentary. Introduce motorcycles and you add a whole new gang of potential wildlife supporters.
Motorcyclists LOVE wild.



From top left clockwise: Carla King, Tiffany Coates, Sam Manicom, Lois Pryce, Simon & Lisa Thomas, Ted Simon, Austin Vince in center.

WHERE ARE WE GOING?
During the end of 2014, I lived in Gorongosa National Park, Mozambique as their Artist in Residence. Then I traveled through South Africa, Kenya and Uganda. During those five months I laid the groundwork for Rallying for A WildLife.

I will fly into Uganda in January 2015 to buy a boda-boda, THE local motorcycle of Africa. These bikes can easily be fixed by a road side mechanic. Senke and Boxer brands are possibilities. Boda-bodas are foreign to westerners but very common all over Africa.

After Uganda, I'll head east to Kenya, then south to Tanzania, Mozambique and into Zimbabwe. After March I will ride to a wildlife project in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Motorcycles are the only transport possible during the rains. Not even 4x4's can traverse the roads!

I'm concentrating on these countries because they're getting very few tourists and travelers — and their wildlife is at great risk.

I am no stranger to tough rides. One of the rewards is my book, Shadows in the Sand—Following the Forty Days Road. The book chronicles my journey from Sudan to Egypt with 200 camels, eight Sudanese herders and one other woman. Six weeks in the desert, twenty miles a day, sun up to sun down, no tents, blazing hot days, freezing cold nights, the same food day in day out.  
Yes. I can do this.


Lorraine Chittock presenting a copy of Shadows in the Sand to Jane Goodall.

YOUR HELP PLEASE—THIS IS HUGE
It's the holiday season and many of you will be getting new cameras. Please consider donating your USED film cameras to my campaign. I'll be in the dust. My cameras took a beating this last trip. I'll be happy to receive a Lumix or Canon, and one Hero 4, and a USED Lily drone, allowing me to spend money on unforeseen travel expenses. When I was a photo student, I was lucky enough to have teachers who drilled into me the belief that 'it's not the camera, it's your eye.' I still believe this today.

I already funded a five month reconnaissance from my cabin in Chile to Mozambique, South Africa, Kenya and Uganda earlier this year. I'm tapped out. I need your help to complete Phase II and III of this project to film more moto-animal-centric projects in the Congo, Kenya, Tanzania and Zimbabwe.

As the Queen of shoestring travel, people will see that traveling to Africa is affordable and safe. Food and lodging costs will be minimal. Funds collected will pay for flights from my cabin in Chile, visas, the replacement of dust-ridden camera equipment and the boda-boda motorcycle.

Any funds I collect above my goal will go towards completing the final edit, and post-production costs such as the audio track, graphics, titles, music licensing and color correction.

I am committed and passionate about this project.  You can see from the rewards I'm offering, which include five of my six published books, that I complete projects!
Please consider supporting Rallying for A WildLife and share this message with your networks by email, on Facebook, Twitter, and wherever else you hang out on the web. Thank you!

BREAKDOWN OF FUNDS
To get the film produced and out to the world, this is how your donations will be spent.

   •   Film Equipment/Repair — $1000
   •   Air Travel — $2000
   •   Visas — $1000
   •   Motorcycle/licensing/etc — $1500
   •   Food/Lodging/Petrol — $5000
   •   Parks — $1000
   •   Miscellaneous — $500

Join me!
• SHARE the link to my Kickstarter campaign with the world — by Tweet, text, Facebook and e-mail.
• JOIN the adventure on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/lorraine.chittock
and on Twitter: LBChittock
I also have sponsorship opportunities for businesses and organizations. No offers of motorcycle clothing needed at this time, thank you. Please contact lorrainechittock@gmail.com
Thank you & asante sana (Swahili for thanks!).

PERKS
I'm offering my books for some of the campaign perks. You can read about them at: www.LorraineChittock.com along with my biography.
The guest room of my cabin in Chile, another perk is listed at: https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/4170563.

Here's a few of the other offerings!

My Kenyan friend Elizabeth makes these great toy animals. The photo shoot was interrupted by one of the neighbors. Though lovely, he is not one of the rewards.

Here's Nicole, Carla and Sharon modeling Ugandan hats made from tree bark!

I'll be purchasing toy motorcycles from different African countries.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Paul Jew I am the President of a Photography and Film Company in Albuquerque, NM called Moji.  My grandparents were Chinese immigrants who settled in Albuquerque, NM in 1929. They raised nine children in a predominantly Hispanic neighborhood during the heart of the depression.

In the 1940's, my grandparents paid for the burial of a Chinese stranger named Louie.   This act of kindness was instrumental in my Auntie Tane getting her first store in San Francisco Chinatown many years later, called The Wok Shop, which has now been in business for over 40 years and has been featured on the front page of the San Francisco Chronicle.  http://www.wokshop.com

This story is a great example of the ripple effects that can occur from doing the right thing.  By contributing to this campaign, you can help bring this story to life and help me to further preserve my grandparents' positive legacy for generations to come.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to pay for our Pre-production, Production, Post Production and travel costs.  We want to travel to San Francisco and capture footage of my Aunt's store and San Francisco Chinatown.  We want to do interviews with her and other family members.

Contributors will receive merchandise from the Wok Shop as perks.  We will have some unique specialty items.

If we don't reach our goal, funds will still be used to bring the project to life.  We will eliminate the filming of some scenes depending upon the amount raised.

The Impact

This is an uplifting true story about how doing the right thing may not pay dividends immediately, but it can have positive impact many years later.

Our family members have loved this story and we want to preserve it for generations to come.

I have a very talented young filmmaker who I believe can do this story justice.  Here are some links to some projects that he has completed.

stephan webb: https://vimeo.com/101340058

balloon fiesta: https://vimeo.com/143580239

abiah: https://vimeo.com/127697789

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of not raising enough money for this project is not being able to tell the story as compellingly as we would like.  We want to capture as much original footage as possible.  If we don't raise as much money, we will have to depend on incorporating more still photographs to tell the story.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, please make as much noise about this campaign to your friends and family.  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

In
the 1940's, my grandparents paid for the burial of a Chinese stranger named Louie.   This act of kindness was instrumental in my Auntie Tane getting her first store in San Francisco Chinatown many years later, called The Wok Shop, which has now been in business for over 40 years and has been featured on the front page of the San Francisco Chronicle.  http://www.wokshop.com
This story is a great example of the ripple effects that can occur from doing the right thing.  By contributing to this campaign, you can help bring this story to life and help me to further preserve my grandparents' positive legacy for generations to come.
   What We Need & What You Get We need $10,000 to pay for our Pre-production, Production, Post Production and travel costs.  We want to travel to San Francisco and capture footage of my Aunt's store and San Francisco Chinatown.  We want to do interviews with her and other family members.
Contributors will receive merchandise from the Wok Shop as perks.  We will have some unique specialty items.
If we don't reach our goal, funds will still be used to bring the project to life.  We will eliminate the filming of some scenes depending upon the amount raised.
    The Impact This is an uplifting true story about how doing the right thing may not pay dividends immediately, but it can have positive impact many years later.
Our family members have loved this story and we want to preserve it for generations to come.
I have a very talented young filmmaker who I believe can do this story justice.  Here are some links to some projects that he has completed.

stephan webb: https://vimeo.com/101340058
balloon fiesta: https://vimeo.com/143580239
abiah: https://vimeo.com/127697789
    Risks & Challenges The risks and challenges of not raising enough money for this project is not being able to tell the story as compellingly as we would like.  We want to capture as much original footage as possible.  If we don't raise as much money, we will have to depend on incorporating more still photographs to tell the story.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute at this time, please make as much noise about this campaign to your friends and family.  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Donate here to support the T-Girl Survival Guide. Your donation will go directly towards producing the pilot episode of this documentary series intended to improve the lives of transgender women. As the host, I will offer practical advice relevant to women before, during, and after their transitions.


We will talk about how relevant we think the term “transition” really is. We’ll visit hormone therapy clinics and watch my body change along with my hormone regimen. We’ll talk hair removal options and practice gracefully walking in heels. We’ll reveal our own worst battles with depression and practice the self-defense skills needed to confidently stride in those heels we’ve mastered in any city, anywhere. We’ll feminize our voices or choose not to, and talk about our dating lives as trans women.


Whatever we do, we’ll share. This is a docuseries made by a trans woman for other trans women, especially trans women outside of major metropolitan cities that deserve access to the most intimate virtual community possible.

Trans women are fighting to survive. We’re also fighting to thrive.


Please share what you can spare. Whether it’s $5, $10, $15, or $100, backing the T-Girl Survival Guide will change my life and if I’m successful, the lives of other women like me.

story:
Do You Know the Red Rock Canyons of the Dolores River? Few Do These Days...

Dolores River Boating Advocates works to protect and enhance the environmental and recreational qualities of the Dolores River, which have been compromised by the loss of river flows in this amazing watershed.  We want to raise awareness about the Dolores River so people today and future generations have the opportunity to experience the unique and precious values of the lower Dolores River corridor. We have teamed up with filmmakers Rig to Flip to highlight these amazing attributes and the complexity of the situation.

The Dolores River Needs to Run Again!

Help us reach our goal of $10,000.00 and bring this story to the world. We've received some fantastic support from our current film sponsors- Patagonia, Osprey and American Whitewater.  Now it's time to turn to our greatest resource, YOU, the people!   We need your involvement. Help us raise funds to finish a film that will bring attention to this endangered tributary of the Colorado River. While the film is almost completed, it's a complex and controversial story that is far from finished...

Project Summary

The Dolores River was named the "River of Sorrows" by early Spanish explorers, though they never could have guessed how ironic that name would become.  The water of the Dolores River today is a fully-allocated resource. A transbasin diversion takes the water from the Dolores River basin through the Dolores-San Juan Divide via the Great Cut Dike to serve the agricultural communities of Southwest Colorado in the San Juan Basin. But at what cost? With persistent drought, threatened native fish species, and increased agricultural demand the impacts are significant.  Stakeholders have been working for many years for a collaborative solution but community consensus remains elusive. And while the construction of McPhee Dam was a boon to the agricultural economy of southwest Colorado, the river was highly compromised and the boating recreation economy of the Dolores River dissolved. What kind of future will the next generation inherit with this river?

"River of Sorrow" is a film that reflects the many perspectives community members have around the Dolores River and points a spotlight on the challenges of managing this public resource.  This film will show the complexity and the urgency in helping the river flow and highlight the many livelihoods that the river presently supports and supported once before.  We need your help to take this film across the finish line and to draw awareness to this issue which is not isolated to the Dolores, but rather begs greater questions around water use, living rivers, and the future of Western water. 

Be among the first to view the trailer here!


About Us

Dolores River Boating Advocates (DRBA) is a grassroots organization and preeminent group that is committed to restoring flows to the Dolores River while also preserving the livelihoods that depend on the water and reestablishing enterprises that once relied on the river.  We believe that we can have a healthy and flowing river as well as healthy and diverse economies and communities.  We would like to see flows that support the native fish and riparian habitat implemented annually, and whitewater boating return to this once world-class river. 


What We Need & What You Get

Your support will give the Dolores River a voice, the film will tell her story.  What once was a flowing river can be again with your help. Your contribution will be used to edit the final product and to promote it widely through film festival submissions and film venues. Awareness is the first step in creating solutions for the "River of Sorrows" so that it can become a river of hope for future generations.

Generous support from our sponsors has provided the capital for the production of the film, and Rig to Flip has donated countless hours above and beyond the original contract to offer a film that deeply explores the complexity of the Dolores River. With $10,000 in additional funding for the project, $6,000 would be committed towards the film’s marketing and promotion and $4,000 would be committed to the final editing of the film.  Meeting our goal will enable the organization and the filmmakers to focus on expanding the outreach, and raising the awareness to a regional and national audience.

We will market, promote, and tour the film as far and wide as the budget allows through screenings with partner organizations and communities throughout the West, and through submissions to the following film festivals:

·  Telluride Mountainfilm

·  5 Points Film Festival

·  The Colorado Environmental Film Festival

·  Moab Film Festival

·  Wild and Scenic Film Festival

·  National Paddling Film Festival

·  Sundance

·  And more!

Our goal is to reach as many people as possible with this film to expand awareness not just about the Dolores River, but about many rivers and waterways of the West.  Western water is a commodity, but so are our rivers.  We want to deepen the conversation to a level that brings true solutions, which will require true compromise and even policy changes.  By raising awareness and raising the dialogue to a larger arena, we believe that decision makers will better understand the value of living rivers.  We believe that the ripple effect of this film will make the future, and the river that future generations inherit, a better one.

In return, we have some fabulous and fun perks for participating in this campaign and sponsoring this film.  For instance, river trips and cabin stays on the Upper Dolores River.  Or how about an Osprey Pack?  Of course as a film sponsor you will have options for owning and viewing the film as well.  So please join us today in this exciting endeavor, and help the Dolores River receive the attention it deserves, for the sake of all Western rivers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial donation is not in your cards today, you can help in other ways:

  • Help us get the word out about this campaign with the convenient Indiegogo share tools.
  • Come to a screening of the movie.  We'll be debuting "The River of Sorrow" in Dolores, Colorado on Friday, January 15th at the Dolores Community Center at 7PM.  Other screening events will follow.
  • Stay tuned-in to the issue and our work and sign up for our newsletter at our website and our facebook page.

Citizen Involvement Makes A Difference.

How profound is our need for water? The Dolores Rivers story explores that question and can offer us an honest answer. Please join us in this effort and this project.

THANK YOU!  Your support means more than a monetary gift, it is a gift to future generations and to the river!
