story:
Luna Llena, which means Full Moon in Spanish, is a short film which employs the Argentine Tango to express the story of love and hope.

In a small town right outside Buenos Aires, Jose, a dreary man in the dumps believes no one cares about him anymore. Upset, dejected and distraught, he realizes he doesn't even have enough money to pay for his last drink.

When the bar owner realizes Jose can't pay, he orders him to leave. Defeated, Jose begins to leave however, he notices a stunning woman walking in and is immediately captivated by her beauty, elegance and femininity.  He approaches her, with one last hope.

She first ignores him then outright rejects him, but with nothing to lose, he makes one last attempt. Intrigued by his confidence and determination, she accepts his first dance to test him, to see if he really can - tango.

She joins him in the dance near the tavern's window with moonbeams shining through. At first the gestures are small and conservative, a slight move here and a little tug there.  But their moves are in sync and his will and determination is sound.

The dance gets more intense heating up as the arousal and the intrigue grow.  She is beginning to see who he really is and is slowly starting to warm up to him. The passion, desire and intensity grow as they dance in the moonlit bar.

Just as he believes they are finally connecting, the bar owner rips him away from his new partner and tosses him out into the lonely night and tells him, “a poor man will never be with my daughter.”

Alone and broke, Jose's last flicker of hope has been extinguished.  His only company is now the shimmering Full Moon.  Jose curses the moon; how can it be so bright and beautiful shining happily on this hopeless world?  Distraught, Jose is ready to give up on love, but is love ready to give up on him?

 

There are many ways you can help us to get this short film made.  First, you could provide us with a donation. No donation is too small and every dollar is appreciated and will help towards our production goal. 

Another way you can help is to share this campaign on your social media profiles like Facebook and Twitter.  Sometimes spreading the word is just as good as a donation! 

Thank you so much for all your contributions and support.  We are grateful for your trust in us.
 

With your kind donation, we are able to help fund this short film in a variety of different ways. 

Crew: We have a great camera crew with top of the line gear.

Talent: Without a cast, a film can’t be made and they deserve to get paid for all their work. 

Production Design: Paying for location fees and any props that can be used to achieve the film’s look.

Audio: We want to hire composers, audio technicians to make sure the sound is phenomenal.

Catering:  Without food, crew and cast aren’t happy, and not having a happy crew makes for a bad film.  This is very important to us.

Gear: Paying for gear rental for equipment such as lights, lenses and anything else we might need. 

Make Up: We want to make sure our talent is looking their best!

Post Production: This involves all post production such as editing, audio and coloring and bringing this short film to festivals. 

If you can't donate, that's okay! Here are some other ways you can support the project:

    •    Share the campaign on social media by either clicking on one of the links at the top right of the page or copying and pasting the URL for this page. 

    •    Telling friends and family about us!  The more who hear about us, the bigger our film family gets!

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at what we are working on. Any help is welcomed and appreciated. Thank you so much and we can’t wait to show you the final product.
 


MARCELO RIBEIRO CARVALHO - WRITER/DIRECTOR/PRODUCER

Born in New York and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil and Miami, Florida, Marcelo Ribeiro Carvalho graduated from the University of Central Florida with a bachelor’s degree from the Film and Digital Media Program. He founded Third Oak Productions LLC in 2009 and now, with over 13 years experience in the film and digital media industry, Marcelo has been deeply involved in a variety of productions.

His previous works include such titles as Blue Curtain, Twelve Past One, The Statue and Modele. His most recent work, a film series titled Liberty has been accepted onto Amazon's platform and can regularly be viewed on Amazon Video.  Marcelo's work has been well-received at many film festivals including the Orlando Film Festival, Central Florida Film Festival, and Fort Lauderdale Film Festival.

 

CORY KEITH - PRODUCER

In 2009, Cory Keith started Third Oak Production LLC, with his colleague Marcelo Ribeiro Carvalho to create digital media products in the greater Orlando area. With Marcelo’s video and graphic skills, and Cory’s audio and web development skills, they began helping local businesses and companies grow. Cory and Marcelo also began producing films which included short films, mini series and features. Today, Cory is a writer, producer and marketing expert within the company.

DURAND SAINT-HILAIRE - PRODUCER

A filmmaker with over 10 years experience in the industry; Working across feature film, shorts, web series, TV series and stage. A Full Sail University graduated, with a degree in Film/Video and Digital Media. He worked on numerous projects across many different roles, including editing, directing for La Fleur de Mai, producing TV pilot GCN and Third Oak Production. Mostly recently, Durand has produced Twelve Past One, a short film about one woman struggle to save her son from himself and producing seasons six and seven of La Fleur de Mai.

story:
Summary

Daniel is a young man struggling with an inner identity that is desperate to be realised. After leaving his parents to move to London, his subconscious desires begin to take control. Led by his new co-worker and upon finding London's Drag hotspot 'Lost & Found' nightclub, Daniel realises his life will never have to be the same again.

 

What's this all about?

Hello there! We are team 'Lost & Found' and we're producing a unique and exciting film set in the life of our lead character Daniel. The film is a representation of self acceptance, discovery and the process it can take to get there. 

The 'Lost & Found' Team consists of young Film makers who have come together in the last year during pre production for this project. The team started with budding actors, Charles Streeter and Jamie Bacon, who have always wanted to make a film together. We worked with the view to make a film that deserves to get made for no reason other than strong storyline and the message the film delivers.

'Lost & Found' came from Jamie's idea of a micro short about a young man dressing in drag and walking down the street, proud and determined, regardless of everyone sneering as the character passed. We then wanted to dig deeper with this idea and create a relatable character that struggles with the want to become a drag artist and what that would mean for his future life and happiness. This brought about a more in depth, 20 minute script and a chance to add characters, locations and make Daniels journey a lot more interesting. From here, finding the right director was essential. To be realised as a successful short, the script's focus on erotic, vibrant and surreal visuals deserved to be taken in an incredibly creative direction. 

The Director 

 

Visual artist/Director Lois Stevenson was third on board and is a huge asset to the team. Jamie first met Lois at an art exhibition in London. After seeing her work Jamie immediately contacted her with the view to bring her on board. After meeting at the BFI London the team was created instantly and they all thrived of eachother's ideas and direction. Having a female director was something Charles and Jamie wanted. After completing the campaign trailer, Lois has not only made her mark on the project but has brought her unique style and professionalism along with it.

Meet The Rest

DOP - Radu 

Editor - Bobby Miklausic

VFX - Ben Emrich

Sound/Composer - Daniel Mehes

Costume/Styling - Alice Bardgett

The final team came together to shoot the campaign trailer. Through each process leading up to the release of the trailer, we have found our working rhythm and are very proud of what we have created as a team so far. 

What We Need?

The £5000 target we've asked for is a number we have come up with very carefully. This Target needs to be hit to make this film! Below is a breakdown of where all your kind donations are going.

  • Location- 20% - This movie has 4 locations in total and each one has a price, the main and most expensive location is the 'Lost & Found' Nightclub itself.
  • Equipment- 20% - Ranging from our RED SCARLET 4K cinematic camera to lenses, lighting and other equipment, this is a large expense. 
  • Costume/Props- 15% - Every great film pays close attention to costume and props and as we plan to shoot a very stylised film with its theme of drag this isn't going to be a cheap thrill. 
  • Crew- 15% - To get this film made professionally hiring a professional crew is a must. We already have the team in place and most are taking a pay cut but they wont do it for free.
  • Post Production- 15% - Theres no point shooting a beautiful film without an experienced editor, our professional Editor Bobby needs equipment and man hours.
  • Talent- 10% - The Darling actors are responsible for this percentage 
  • Transport/Catering- 5% - Getting equipment to and from safely and feeding people means we can look after our equipment and most importantly our team. 

How can you help?

These Campaigns are only successful if people literally see this page and watch our trailer. If you like what were are doing or feel we deserve some help a Donation would be AMAZING. However if the least you can do is LIKE our page or SHARE it on social medias then this still helps us out incredibly and we all Thankyou for your support. 

Tweet us here - @lostNfoundShort

Like our Facebook here -https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lost-and-Found-short-indie-film/723293614460517

Email us on- lostnfoundshort@gmail.com

Location- 20% - This movie has 4 locations in total and each one has a price, the main and most expensive location is the 'Lost & Found' Nightclub itself.
Equipment- 20% - Ranging from our RED SCARLET 4K cinematic camera to lenses, lighting and other equipment, this is a large expense. 
Costume/Props- 15% - Every great film pays close attention to costume and props and as we plan to shoot a very stylised film with its theme of drag this isn't going to be a cheap thrill. 
Crew- 15% - To get this film made professionally hiring a professional crew is a must. We already have the team in place and most are taking a pay cut but they wont do it for free.
Post Production- 15% - Theres no point shooting a beautiful film without an experienced editor, our professional Editor Bobby needs equipment and man hours.
Talent- 10% - The Darling actors are responsible for this percentage 
Transport/Catering- 5% - Getting equipment to and from safely and feeding people means we can look after our equipment and most importantly our team. 
How can you help?These Campaigns are only successful if people literally see this page and watch our trailer. If you like what were are doing or feel we deserve some help a Donation would be AMAZING. However if the least you can do is LIKE our page or SHARE it on social medias then this still helps us out incredibly and we all Thankyou for your support. Tweet us here - @lostNfoundShortLike our Facebook here -https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lost-and-Found-short-indie-film/723293614460517Email us on- lostnfoundshort@gmail.com

story:
What is Paint?

Paint is much more than just a short film. Paint is about fighting for life, for happiness and for color. It's that little spark, the one that will never go out. 

Paint is for the child in all of us, who just loves coloring books.

My name is Nina Borghi and oh man, is it great to be talking to you. I am a young filmmaker who honestly just wants to make beautiful films about things that matter. I'm Brazilian, but currently live in Los Angeles and attend Relativity School, a really cool college inside a working film studio. 

I know that asking for money can be a difficult and delicate thing, and I almost didn't do it. But if I didn't, Paint would exist, and I couldn't allow that. Because it needs to exist. I need to spread this message that really should to be heard. A message saying that even when life is at it's worse, the key to happiness is within ourselves. You only have to dig deep to find it.

And Mika, my main character, does. And in the process, she finds treasures you wouldn't imagine. She is here to show that color, art and creativity are our most powerful weapon against pain and misfortune. And in the meantime, I guarantee you she's gonna have some fun!

What We Need & What You Get

You should know how you're helping by donating. So let's break this down:

  • I need to raise US$3000. It seems like a lot, I know. Making movies is expensive, and that sucks sometimes. But the fact is that Paint need a lot of props, set dressing and, of course, paint. So most of my budget will be directed toward the Art Department, so ensure that Paint looks as colorful as it should be. 
  • Another large part of the funds raised will go to my actors, who deserve to be paid  for exposing themselves to such a delicate and intimate subject. 
  • And if all goes well, which let's hope it does, Paint will be submitted to Festivals! Entree Fees are also part of the budget, much like another very cool thing:
  • PERKS! -- Everybody who helps me to get closer to my goal will get super cool rewards and different symbols of appreciation, all from the bottom of my heart. Who here wants to have their very own Paint paint jar? What about a DVD with a copy of this lovely lovely project? Check out all the perks you can get with your amazing donation!

The Impact

Paint is about Mika, but it is also about every child who has their childhood taken away from them, one way or another. And how does Paint help?

  • It shows that happiness is within ourselves, and so, it is always within our reach!
  • Gives children hope, possibility. Do you know of anyone who'd benefit from watching Paint? I know I do, and I want to make sure that this film has the power to influence those people and change their lives for the better!
  • And also, confession time: this is a big deal for me, in the most selfish of ways. I care so much about this story, and to make it come true would be such a huge personal and professional achievement.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute, and that's totally okay. But that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out! There is a super big chance you may know someone who can donate!
  • Use IndieGoGo sharing tools, or post a link to this campaign on your social media!

Either way, thank you so so much for taking the time to learn about my project!

Many happy and colorful days for you!

story:
I'm Arika Cullen, the executive producer of Nobodies. Nobodies is a new short film that explores questions of morality, what it is that makes someone a bad person, and what lengths people will go to for the sake of self-preservation. Nobodies juxtaposes two very different killers. One is a seasoned hitman; the other is a panicked college professor. I read the script and knew it was a story that needed to be seen, but I couldn't stand the thought of anyone but me producing it.

Perhaps this story spoke to me so deeply because some major changes in my life have had me on a search for a new moral anchor. Nobodies did not provide that anchor, of course, but the unique perspective it brings to what makes something right or wrong is definitely thought-provoking.

I'm new to filmmaking. Brand new. I've been a writer for years, but this is my first time producing. This is also the first time that Ken Hanenberg, the screenwriter for Nobodies, has been produced. This is us launching our careers. I truly believe that this film will not only get into film festivals, but it will also garner real attention.

And we aren't the only ones who believe in it. Artwork, music, marketing, catering for the film shoot... all of these things and more were made possible by generous professionals willing to donate their time and talents. I want very much to be able to thank them with a bonus so that they make more than zero dollars.

But first things first. We aren't done moving forward with the film yet. We need funds to finish the film in post-production. We need funds to be able to submit to film festivals. And we need funds for travel and promotion so that Nobodies can have the greatest impact possible.

Here is an approximate breakdown of the funding we need:

Thank you so much for whatever support you're able to give! We are grateful for contributions of all amounts. If you aren't able to give monetarily, please help us out by directing your family and friends to our campaign. From all of us at Village Idiots Productions... Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

story:
What's the film about?

The film is about Richard, a twenty-eight-year-old man who recently had to face a life-altering complication. As a result, Richard hides the worry through wearing a giant, fully headed, chicken mask. This new adjustment does not come easy for his girlfriend, Penelope. As the two of them begin a life together in one home, the mask starts to take its toll. A promise is made between the couple to improve on their weaknesses in order to live a happy life together… However, while the idea may have seemed simple to agree upon, promises are made to be broken.

MEET THE DIRECTOR!

Carina Daniele is in her final year of film school! She is originally from New York and is currently attending college in Los Angeles, CA. Carina has worked on many independent films in various departments such as a First AD, Second AD, Production Designer, Producer, and more! Currently, she is interning with AwesomenessTV. On set, Carina is hard working, energetic, determined, and a team player! This project is an amazing opportunity for her to showcase all of her hard work from start to finish!

MORE CREW!!!

Meet our three main men! 

First AD, Alec Benson (left)  Director of Photography, Nicholas Gooden (middle) and Camera Operator, Christian Tello (right) 

What We Need & What You Get

$3,000 dollars will give us the funding we need to cover every aspect of this short film. 

Where your donations will go:

Production Design: Set, Props, and Costume -  12.5%  

Location, Permits, Transport, Accommodation costs - 12.5%

Crew & Catering - 35%

Equipment, Rentals, Insurence - 15%

Post production Costs - 20%

Talent  - 5%

Incentives and rewards will be held to motivate people and stress the importance of their help, big or small, they are greatly appreciated! Shout outs, leaked information, countdowns, and reminders will all be posted during the duration of the fundraiser as well! 

The Impact

I couldn't be more grateful for your help! It’s people like you that contribute to the career paths of young filmmakers and put faith into independent filmmaking. As a young, female, filmmaker, I feel as though my dreams are coming true as this project comes to life. In the industry, producing a film on your own is a difficult task to achieve. I'm proud to say that I will be writing, directing, and producing this short film! We want this film to showcase the team's talent by giving you an absolutely absurd dark comedy.  If you felt this project was worth donating to, please spread the word! As this film is a big deal to me and the people involved, we want it to be an even bigger deal for the film industry. Share our campaign with others and do us a favor! Thank you so much for the love and support!

Risks & Challenges

The mask is such an important part of the film. Its look, its functions, its designs, are crafted for your enjoyment. A challenge for this film will be creating the right kind of mask that an actor can tolerate wearing while still creating the perfect “look” for the main character. Having the mask be HAND-MADE will mean affording to gather proper material and put the hours into creating TWO identical sets. 

Complications can come from using a live animal on set. Spoiler! A real chicken will be used during the filming of Richard. To ensure safety, an animal wrangler will be needed to make sure that no harm comes to any person or the animal.

Inclement weather happens. The film does take place outside in its most key moments, and unfortunately, water, and camera gear does not mix. We hope to use some of these funds to play it safe and ensure our gear against any possible damage. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Though some people can't contribute money, that's not all that we are asking for! Spread the word to your family members, co-workers, friends, peers, neighbors, friends of friends, and others! The word of mouth is powerful and we are thankful for any kind of support and attention that is brought to our campaign. Social media will play a big part in fundraising by spreading the word through sites such as Facebook and Twitter. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools and follow us on this journey!

story:
*Be sure to read to the end to find out about the BIG EVENT associated with this campaign...

As fans around the world know, Miche has been dabbling at creating an online series for years, beginning with "Guitar Lessons" (a non-instructional, behind-the-scenes look at the life of a guitarist), followed by a variety of other offerings such as "Lessons from a Lefty" (an instructional series from a conceptual perspective), and the varied "Miche Today" show (sketches, interviews with independent musicians around the world, "news" clips, etc.), and random pop-up offerings involving puppets (ex: Miche & Newton honor MST3000.)

All of THAT has been leading up to THIS - the series that makes sense of it all... (or not.)

The Yet-to-be-Named Miche Show (and yes, fans can make suggestions) explores the life, and life choices, of a senescent (maturing?) musician who just won't give up.  As Miche has said, "There comes a point when you just have to laugh... and keep going."  Viewers will get to watch in real time as Miche forges ahead, keeping hope alive - not only for himself, but for any who believe that dreams are meant to last a lifetime.  Because this is Miche, though, and not Hallmark - the series will involve a lot less "glow" and a lot more "oh no."  

But also because this is Miche, this series will be a musical smorgasbord - each episode containing at least one musical number (think: The Partridge Family - but with an old Black guy on guitar instead of David Cassidy.) (Ok, stop thinking about that now.)

The only thing standing between Miche and this official series is the budget for a crew, studio time, lighting/sound/video equipment, and a rabidly supportive fan base that INSISTS that this project succeeds.  We have created the most efficient (i.e. shoestring) budget we can work with to create a batch of episodes, enough to officially and substantively launch the show with the momentum needed to propel itself forward.  The more money raised, the more episodes can be produced, and the better hope there will be of the Miche Fambro Show finding a permanent home on YouTube (or - who knows - maybe on a Cable channel somewhere!)

Besides learning a thing or two about playing the guitar, tinkering with editing tools, and faking ventriloquism, Miche has also learned that this musical journey is only made possible by the gift of committed fans/friends.  So, we place an ENORMOUS, COLLOSAL, or as they say in Brobdingnag - Brobdingnagdian! (look it up) value on each and every person who is able to find a way to say YES! to this effort.  There are "rewards" on this page for financial donations, and we need as much or as little as anyone can manage...  But, if you are simply not in a position to contribute $$, you can still be a vital member of Team "I've Got Hope" by sharing this campaign around, along with Miche's videos, etc.  It's all about people who know people who know people.  Maybe one of those people knows that big Hollywood producer guy who's looking for his next big hit...

So, thanks - and let's get this show on the road.

*WAIT!  Remember that BIG EVENT that was mentioned at the very beginning?  On Nov. 6, 2016 from 3-5:30ish at the Riviera Theater in Geneseo, NY, Miche will celebrate his 60th birthday by performing at a GALA Event that will feature Miche as acoustic soloist, electric band leader and Big Band vocalist!  It's going to be an amazing night!  And there will be cake and cocktails!!!  You won't want to miss this - and you can secure your place by visiting the Rewards section of this campaign :)

story:
Short Summary

"The Stone Circle" is a phenomenal horror/thriller short film currently in production.  Now we're at a crucial point: the climactic end scenes that will make or break the movie.  These are outdoor scenes - to be shot overnight - and we would like to be able to acquire the best location and rent the equipment we need for some more complex but breathtaking shots.


What We Need 

We have the talent and experience.  What we need is to acquire the best location, rent the equipment, etc.  for some more complex but breathtaking shots.

$1600 - locations, transportation and related
$  700 - special equipment/rigs/lighting
$  300 - SFX
$  200 - craft services
$  200 - marketing/promotion/crowdfunding expenses
_______
$3000 CDN (total)

Any funds raised over the goal will be applied to Phase 2 and reimbursements for expenses prior to this campaign.


What You'll Get

Rewards/incentives include:
  • special thanks in the credits of the film
  • social media shout-outs
  • IMDB credits
  • custom designed, handmade jewellery
  • props/paraphenalia 
  • behind-the-scenes extras
  • festival screening passes


The Impact

We are filmmakers with jobs, families, and other obligations.  We have been able to self-fund to this stage, but we need a boost in order to achieve the quality we are shooting for (pun intended, maybe...).  We have the talent, the experience and the drive, but we need your support to make the film as great as we know it can be.

Indie films are integral to film in general.  They express viewpoints and stories that challenge the mainstream.  In a sense, they keep the film industry "honest".  Short films are more accessible than ever, with platforms like iTunes and Amazon.  They are the currency of YouTube and the Internet.  

Crowdfunding used to be an avenue through which indie artists could realize their dreams and put forth their projects.  Now, they have medium size studios and corporations to compete with; projects like this are why crowdfunding was initially developed.  Help us make our mark - you will not be disappointed!


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the love and spread the word!  We will be having prize draws for people who share our campaign!  More details on our fan sites (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram).  Of course, there are also Indiegogo share tools!

    Other Ways You Can Help Share the love and spread the word!  We will be having prize draws for people who share our campaign!  More details on our fan sites (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram).  Of course, there are also Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Plot Summary 

Jorina (23) surprisingly becomes the assistant of Jake (25), the Vice President of the children homing organization HCN. The more she works for the company, the more it becomes clear, that there is something shady going on.

 

Information

GENRE: Thriller/Fantasy/Social Criticism 

RATING: 14A or 18A

LENGTH: Ca. 90 Minutes 

 

The Characters 

JAKE: If there is one word for the for the first impression anyone has of Jake it is: Asshole.

He is one of the most powerful people on earth at only 25. He is feared and hated by most for his position as the right hand of the HCN president, Jacob Voland.

But while he is planning to take down the institute from the institute, the only thing keeping him alive is his mask of wit, violence and loyalty. 

JORINA: Jorina, called Jo, is an outgoing, witty and smart woman. Her big mouth and curious mind tend to get her into trouble, but she is genuinely caring and kind if she wants to be.

When Jake hires her as an assistant, she doesn’t realize what she is getting herself into. But it doesn’t matter eventually, when she realizes the truth behind HCN.

LOUIS: Louis is Jake’s best friend, but acts more like his big brother. He is trying to take care of him, which proves hard with the little influence he has over their lives.

But Louis is anything else than Jake’s gay sidekick. He is smart, educated and could easily be accepted to any university he wishes to go to. He is nothing short of a hero: Willing to make the ultimate sacrifice for the wellbeing of his friends and the world.

VOLAND: Voland is the president and founder of HCN. He is power hungry, manipulative and controlling and will make anyone, including children, do the dirty work that will make him even more powerful.

 

The Crew & The Script

Hello! My name is Martha, I am a film school graduate, costumer, author, director and producer. I have worked on several short films and music videos and now want to take my art to the next step.

"Encircled" is loosely based on my published (German) novel, called "Eingekreist" (transl. Encircled). This story and these characters have been in my life for many, many years and it is a dream coming true to be able to finally visualize them. 

The script was closely improved by writers and industry professionals in Vancouver. 

Working with me will be talented actors, artists, camera and lighting crew members from all over the world with all kinds of backgrounds. Most of us are working for free. We are all about living for our art and developing a unique project.

story:
Short Summary

Log Line- Olive, a troubled young artist, goes for a drive one restless night to quiet the obsessive thoughts that are swirling around in her head, and finds that her troubles run deeper than she thought. 

My name is Tristian Montgomery. I am the writer and director of this project. Making this film is important to me because it's my first chance to make a short film without boundaries. Being a film student, I was given limitations and guidelines to follow that didn't help me produce the caliber of work that I wanted. Long story short, this is a chance for me to create a film that is my full vision. Basically, this story is my baby. By contributing to this film you will help me give birth to a body of work that will truly show what I have to offer to this world.
This film will be my senior capstone film, which I hope to use to make my mark on the Independent Film Festival Circuit.
This is also a chance to contribute to the promotion of leading roles for female people of color in Sci-fi and fantasy films. 
The thing that makes this film Sci-fi is its strong spider motif that appears throughout the story. 
Olive, the main character, struggles with the task of killing a huge spider that has taken over her room. Why does she hesitate? Maybe she see that she has somethings in common with the creature...
We will bring the spider to life through 3D model animatronics and VFX.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 3,000 to make this story come to life. The funds will go towards equipment rentals, feeding crew, post-production and marketing materials. 
All contributors will receive electronic copies of the film before it hits the festival circuit. 
You can contribute any amount of money! All is accepted and appreciated.
Contributors that donate $20 and above will receive special thanks in the credits.
Contributors who donate $50 and above will receive an Executive Producer credit in the film.

story:
THIS STORY NEEDS TO BE TOLD

This is going to be a film about the discovery of an incredible new cure for PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder). Wolves rescued from around the country are rehabilitated along with U.S. war veterans recovering from the traumas of war in the Wolves and Warriors Program. At the Lockwood Animal Rescue Center, on a sprawling 20-acre sanctuary in the Frazier Park, California, we discovered a stunning, shocking connection between man and wild wolves. “It’s a slow transition, but what Veterans find here, working with the animals and getting back to nature, is that they belong,” W&W Program co-founder, Lockwood Animal Rescue Center founder and US War Veteran Matthew Simmons said.

 

WE CARE ABOUT VETERANS!

PTSD is an anxiety disorder that can develop after a person is exposed to serious traumatic events, such as war. Symptoms include disturbing recurring flashbacks, nightmares, severe chronic depression, insomnia, anger, paranoia. PTSD disrupts lives and leads to violence, drug and alcohol abuse, detachment from society, homelessness and suicide. According to the US Government, more than 20% of Iraq and Afghanistan veterans have PTSD, and 50% of those do not seek treatment.

 

WOLVES NEED YOU!

WOLVES were once the most widely come across wild mammals, inhabiting most of the available land in the northern hemisphere. They are top predators with an undeserved bad reputation, mostly due to children’s stories and legends. Owing to the destruction of their habitat and persecution by humans, they now occupy only about one-third of their former range worldwide, and only about 3% of the continental United States. Over time, worldwide wolf population has dropped 99%, and wolf hunting is now widespread in the US too, where wolves are often hunted by plane and helicopter, and with traps and poison.

 

WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING?

Each and every dollar that is donated will be used effectively and efficiently! We appreciate your donations and promise to put them to good use. We are already done with filming but we do need $25,000 for post production ($10,000 editing, $8,000 coloring, $5,000 sound mixing, $1,250 platform fee, $750 credit card fees). We consider this amount to be a minimum at which we will be able to function; however, with more money we will be able to invest more into the movie (promotion, marketing, social media, festivals submissions). We will reward donations, but the greatest gift we hope to give is an amazing movie.

 

FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK!  https://www.facebook.com/thewarinbetween/

story:
Short Summary

I am Johnny Perkins, executive producer for Hits: No Morals. I have had a camera in my hand since I was 8 years old and all I have ever wanted to do was create. Several years ago I wrote a short about 2 hitmen who were driving together and both were told to kill the other. This was a comedy. The awkward situation had potential, we wrote and shot it quickly. After I put the video up my roommate from college, who wrote it for me, said he could make it into a series and my response was, if you write it, I'll make it. A few months later we had a script and we went to work. 

Season 1 had many flaws but it was essential to put it out as fast as possible before we lost momentum. Now with season 1 out and finished we moved onto season 2, we decided this is where we would do it right. It took 2 years for the scripts to all be written and we now have 10 amazing episodes. We have done table reads and cast many new actors into our family. We want to make this season right. 

Making this season right is very important, everyone involved is in it for the passion and love of filmmaking. We love the script and we are a family now. Contributors will become a part of our family and help us create the best possible show. And we don't want to stop with No Morals, we have other shorts and seasons ready to go and we just need to get this first push. This is the beginning of something much bigger for us and we hope you help us get there. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to get money for props, craft services, and marketing. 

Props really help us tell our stories and with the bigger and getter scripts comes bigger casts who all need props for different scenes. 

HITS: NO MORALS BUDGET

CRAFT SERVICES - 8 DAYS LUNCH (10-20 PEOPLE)$1,000.00

MARKETING - $500.00

PROPS

CASE - $35.00

FAKE GUN - $40.00

FAKE KNIFE - $7.00

FAKE RAZOR BLADE - $8.00

FAKE BLOOD - $25.00

BATHROBE - $19.00

FAKE MONEY - $35.00

8 SUNGLASSES - $48.00

LOTION BOTTLE - $7.00

FAKE BULLETPROOF VEST - $50.00

FAKE FLASHBANG - $5.00

FAKE GRENADE - $7.00

BROWN BAGS - $5.00

WINE - $25.00

EXTRAS - STRETCH GOAL ITEMS

VIEWFINDER - $60.00

NEW MIC - $300.00

LENS RENTAL - $500.00

LIGHTS - $849.00

NEW GOPRO - $400.00

NEW DRONE - $800.00

Again with the larger cast and a bigger crew we will need more money just to feed everyone. This is the most important thing in our budget because we want to keep everyone happy and food helps us work better. 

Marketing, this is something we had no budget for in season 1 and it shows, our views are very low and with a marketing budget we can get ad campaigns and targeted advertising to get people who would love our show to see it. 

 

Our Perks:

 $1 - Our thanks and gratitude
$10 - Exclusive Digital Download code to view Hit: No Morals outtakes,
extras, and alternate endings plus all rewards listed above.
$25 - Signed cast photo plus all rewards listed above.
$50 - Private links to all episodes a week before normal release
dates, plus all rewards listed above.
$100 - Invitation for you and guest to Hits: No Morals premiere party,
plus all rewards listed above.
$250 - Your name mentioned briefly in script/episode as a previous hit
or acquaintance, plus all rewards listed above.
$500 - Associate Producer credit (and IMDB) on one episode of Hits: No
Morals, plus all rewards listed above.
$750 - You will be killed on-screen in Hits: No Morals with a minimum
of 2 speaking lines plus all rewards listed above.

 

If we don't reach our goal, we will try and stretch what we did raise to get food for every episode and a few essential props. 

The Impact

Our project is important because we are all creators here. We do this because we love it and it is our dream to keep making content  and with this push we may be able to move past doing this in our free time, to doing this full time and bringing you more and more content.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is getting our content in front of the right people, we need your help to do this because our content speaks for itself and it is only going to keep getting better.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please like the video, the page, follow us on social media and please share this page.

story:
CHECK OUT OUR CAST DIRECTLY ON IMDb:

 http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5892412/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1

MY CAST IS MAKING ME DO THIS! THEY CAN'T WAIT TO MAKE THE MOVIE! AND NEARLY EVERYONE WE TALK TO WANTS TO SEE THIS MOVIE! 

TRUE STORY! THIS FILM IS A MAGNET AND I DON'T KNOW WHY! 

READ ON.....

 

THE  RESPONSE TO MY FILM IS AMAZING!

"Due Justice" is my first feature film. I wrote the script, pitched it on IMDb Pro and Backstage and within days, I received thousands of talent and crew submissions from people who want to be in this film and from crew members  who have literally pleaded with me to let them WORK on this production because........as so many have said......"This sounds awesome!"

  • "Due Justice" has attracted a Multiple Award Winning Cinematographer.
  • "Due Justice" has attracted an Award Winning Writer (to polish the script).

Our cast has over 2 million + fans and followers (combined) that will likely buy tickets.

 WE CAN START FILMING & GET THE MOVIE INTO A THEATER NEAR YOU!

 

YOU GET MORE COOL PERKS!

The appeal to my movie from talent and production crew folks is absolutely amazing! I still get unsolicited (unwanted) emails nearly everyday from people pleading with me to "take a look" at them for this movie.

 

FOLLOW US ON TWITTER: @duejusticefilm

What We Need 

HERE ARE THE BUDGET FACTS:

covers "below-the line" and "post-production" costs including lawyers, stunts, music, sound, editing, set design, crew, travel, lodging, insurance, permits, catering, honey wagons, car rentals, security, etc....

​WE CAN  ADD THESE AWESOME MOVIE EXTRAS......

 

EVERY PENNY WILL GO TOWARD PRODUCTION! The funds will be used to:

  • Start the production process (file the production with SAG)
  • Sign Tara Reid and others! 
  • Prepare our filming schedule. 
  •  Market to Film Distributors & Secure Theatrical Distribution (already in progress)
  • .....and so many other production tasks that we can accomplish with what we get to prepare for actual filming and release.

The Impact

Your contributions will help:

  • Secure Tara Reid for the lead female role.
  • Secure all cast members for their roles. (Signed contracts)
  • Get the Production Manager in Gear (moving fast to setup crew, filming schedule)
  • Create jobs
  • Make the movie!
  • Get the movie in theaters!
  • Advertise and promote.

I have comments from numerous people such as....."If the hype is true, I know a lot of Asian people are going to want to see this!" Another...... "This film will appeal to people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and sports, hobby and recreational interests!" 

WHAT OTHER PROJECTS HAVE YOU DONE/CREATED?

I am currently working on an awesome SCI-FI FEATURE entitled "TRONDORA". Several top talent is already attached to the film and I am still writing the script. You can check it out at www.trondora.com  or at my corporate website www.at-hollywood.com

JETT BLACK - Feature film based on the character from this movie - is another film I am working on. The script is also in progress. Likely similar to the 'LETHAL WEAPON' movies, among others.

 

What You Get

Risks & Challenges

Everything and everyone is in place and ready to go! Currently, there are very little risks. The only challenge I have now is money!

  • Money is my only obstacle in securing Tara Reid.
  • Money is my only obstacle in making my extremely committed cast members happy.
  • Money is our only obstacle in getting this film made.
  • Tara Reid  has been waiting patiently for me to give her the green light.
  • My Production Manager has been waiting patiently for me to give him the green light.
  • My cast has been waiting patiently for me to give them the green light.
  • THE TIME IS NOW!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell everyone you know and meet to buy tickets!
  • Tell them about 'DUE JUSTICE' starring Tara Reid.
  • Tell them about 'JAMES DEAN' being in the movie.
  • Send everyone links to our Official Movie Website: www.duejusticefilm.com
  • FOLLOW US ON TWITTER: @duejusticefilm
  • Tweet it!
  • Facebook it!
  • Tell everyone at work.
  • Share our Twitter and Facebook pages.
  • SHARE WITH EVERYONE! EVERYWHERE!

SAVE ME FROM MY CAST MEMBERS!

THEY HAVE AN UNWAVERING COMMITMENT!

THEY DEMAND WE MAKE THIS MOVIE!

THIS CAMPAIGN WAS LAUNCHED AT THEIR REQUEST! 

THEY ARE AWESOME, SPECIAL, TALENTED AND WHAT MORE COULD A PRODUCER ASK FOR IN A CAST OF SUCH INCREDIBLE STARS & TALENT? 

FAQ's

  • 1) When will the rewards become available or ship? Each perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in the description. You will be notified of any delays. The script will be sent to you on, or after, the movie is released.
  • 2) What name can I use for the "Special Thanks Film Credit" perk? We expect you to use your real name and we will ask you for your real name as part of the campaign survey at the end of the campaign. We may ask for a copy of proof of your real name and identity. You may use someone else's name (family or friend) if you are offering the perk as a gift. Just let us know in the survey.
  • 3) Shirt, Hoodie, Jacket Sizes - How do I give you the size(s) I want for any garment items? When the campaign has ended, we will email you a survey asking for all the sizing information we need to fulfill your perk. You can also give us your shipping information and any other information we may ask for. We will need all of your information and details as soon as possible after the survey is sent.
  • 4) What if the perk I want is sold out? Sorry! When items are sold.....they are sold!
  • 5) Can I claim more than one perk? YES! Each perk that you contribute to is counted as a separate contribution. If you want another item, you will have to select it and contribute again for that perk.
  • 6) Can I change my perk? No! Sorry! We are unable to help with that. Be sure to select the perk you want before you make any contribution(s).
  • 7) What if I move or change my address? If you move before the perks are shipped, contact us immediately through your Indiegogo account and we'll do our best to make the change.
  • 8) Can I make a pledge or contribution for a family member or friend? You can make your pledge for anyone you want! Be sure to provide us with the person's information when we send out our surveys. You will be able to specify who you want the perk to go to.
  • 9) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? This campaign is a MASSIVE UNDERTAKING! We get many questions every day and we will try to answer back if possible. Please be assured that we do read all questions and concerns in our efforts to help everyone and run a smooth campaign as much as possible.
  • 10) What country is the campaign perks offered to? Everything is offered to the U.S. ONLY! However, we do have an item or two offered strictly to the U.K. as well. THAT'S IT!
  • 11) When will the movie be released in theaters? If our campaign is successful, we plan to film by the end of this year. A release generally takes another 4 months after post-production is completed. (film editing, soundtrack added, etc...)
  • 12) When will the Red Carpet Premiere be held? It will be held approximately 2 weeks before the theater release date.
  • 13) Will the CAST SIGNED PHOTO SET have the actor's pictures depicted in the campaign? My cast members have tried in their best efforts to submit the depicted photos you see for this LIMITED EDITION OF 100 set. However, some cast members are getting new photos. This happens all the time. Therefore, you may not receive the exact photo depicted for each actor. We hope you will still enjoy your set. FOR A CAST SET OF 14 or more photos at the price offering......IT'S QUITE A BARGAIN!
  • 14) Are all cast members offering individual photos? NO! You can only get photos of all cast members in the LIMITED EDITION CAST SIGNED SET! We are only offering individual signed photos from those actors who wish to offer extras for their fans and followers.
  • 15) Where will the 2018 NASCAR Event be? This will be in Las Vegas. It is the PENNZOIL 400 race and fans will attend with some cast members. There will be additional exclusive features with this package.
  • ​16) Why will it take so long to receive most of these items? The campaign will end in approximately 60 days or sooner. When it ends, then we have to wait for Indiegogo to transfer the funds from the campaign to us. When we finally do get all the funds, then we have to place our orders with all the vendors/manufacturers for the perks. Any items related to the movie itself, such as movie tickets, DVD's, 4k downloads, production photo cards, etc..., must wait until either during the filming of the movie or when the movie is filmed and completed before we can fulfill those perks. It takes time to setup a full blown production and get to actual filming. Therefore, your patience will be required as we will work as quickly as possible to get this movie made and get your perks to you. We appreciate your support and your patience more than you'll ever truly know! Just as Chris Routhe says in his video. THANK YOU!

Thank you so much everyone! You're awesome! Will post updates!
story_txt:
CHECK OUT OUR CAST DIRECTLY ON IMDb:
 http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5892412/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1

MY CAST IS MAKING ME DO THIS! THEY CAN'T WAIT TO MAKE THE MOVIE! AND NEARLY EVERYONE WE TALK TO WANTS TO SEE THIS MOVIE! 
TRUE STORY! THIS FILM IS A MAGNET AND I DON'T KNOW WHY! 

READ ON.....
 
THE  RESPONSE TO MY FILM IS AMAZING!
"Due Justice" is my first feature film. I wrote the script, pitched it on IMDb Pro and Backstage and within days, I received thousands of talent and crew submissions from people who want to be in this film and from crew members  who have literally pleaded with me to let them WORK on this production because........as so many have said......"This sounds awesome!"

"Due Justice" has attracted a Multiple Award Winning Cinematographer.

"Due Justice" has attracted an Award Winning Writer (to polish the script).

Our cast has over 2 million + fans and followers (combined) that will likely buy tickets.
 WE CAN START FILMING & GET THE MOVIE INTO A THEATER NEAR YOU!
 
YOU GET MORE COOL PERKS!

The appeal to my movie from talent and production crew folks is absolutely amazing! I still get unsolicited (unwanted) emails nearly everyday from people pleading with me to "take a look" at them for this movie.
 
FOLLOW US ON TWITTER: @duejusticefilm

What We Need 
HERE ARE THE BUDGET FACTS:
covers "below-the line" and "post-production" costs including lawyers, stunts, music, sound, editing, set design, crew, travel, lodging, insurance, permits, catering, honey wagons, car rentals, security, etc....
​WE CAN  ADD THESE AWESOME MOVIE EXTRAS......

 

EVERY PENNY WILL GO TOWARD PRODUCTION! The funds will be used to:


Start the production process (file the production with SAG)

Sign Tara Reid and others! 
Prepare our filming schedule. 

 Market to Film Distributors & Secure Theatrical Distribution (already in progress)
.....and so many other production tasks that we can accomplish with what we get to prepare for actual filming and release.

The Impact


Your contributions will help:

Secure Tara Reid for the lead female role.
Secure all cast members for their roles. (Signed contracts)
Get the Production Manager in Gear (moving fast to setup crew, filming schedule)
Create jobs
Make the movie!
Get the movie in theaters!
Advertise and promote.

I have comments from numerous people such as....."If the hype is true, I know a lot of Asian people are going to want to see this!" Another...... "This film will appeal to people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and sports, hobby and recreational interests!" 
WHAT OTHER PROJECTS HAVE YOU DONE/CREATED?
I am currently working on an awesome SCI-FI FEATURE entitled "TRONDORA". Several top talent is already attached to the film and I am still writing the script. You can check it out at www.trondora.com  or at my corporate website www.at-hollywood.com
JETT BLACK - Feature film based on the character from this movie - is another film I am working on. The script is also in progress. Likely similar to the 'LETHAL WEAPON' movies, among others.

 
What You Get




























Risks & Challenges
Everything and everyone is in place and ready to go! Currently, there are very little risks. The only challenge I have now is money!

Money is my only obstacle in securing Tara Reid.
Money is my only obstacle in making my extremely committed cast members happy.
Money is our only obstacle in getting this film made.
Tara Reid  has been waiting patiently for me to give her the green light.
My Production Manager has been waiting patiently for me to give him the green light.
My cast has been waiting patiently for me to give them the green light.
THE TIME IS NOW!


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know and meet to buy tickets!
Tell them about 'DUE JUSTICE' starring Tara Reid.
Tell them about 'JAMES DEAN' being in the movie.
Send everyone links to our Official Movie Website: www.duejusticefilm.com
FOLLOW US ON TWITTER: @duejusticefilm
Tweet it!
Facebook it!
Tell everyone at work.
Share our Twitter and Facebook pages.
SHARE WITH EVERYONE! EVERYWHERE!

SAVE ME FROM MY CAST MEMBERS!
THEY HAVE AN UNWAVERING COMMITMENT!
THEY DEMAND WE MAKE THIS MOVIE! 

THIS CAMPAIGN WAS LAUNCHED AT THEIR REQUEST! 
THEY ARE AWESOME, SPECIAL, TALENTED AND WHAT MORE COULD A PRODUCER ASK FOR IN A CAST OF SUCH INCREDIBLE STARS & TALENT? 

FAQ's


1) When will the rewards become available or ship? Each perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in the description. You will be notified of any delays. The script will be sent to you on, or after, the movie is released.

2) What name can I use for the "Special Thanks Film Credit" perk? We expect you to use your real name and we will ask you for your real name as part of the campaign survey at the end of the campaign. We may ask for a copy of proof of your real name and identity. You may use someone else's name (family or friend) if you are offering the perk as a gift. Just let us know in the survey.

3) Shirt, Hoodie, Jacket Sizes - How do I give you the size(s) I want for any garment items? When the campaign has ended, we will email you a survey asking for all the sizing information we need to fulfill your perk. You can also give us your shipping information and any other information we may ask for. We will need all of your information and details as soon as possible after the survey is sent.

4) What if the perk I want is sold out? Sorry! When items are sold.....they are sold!

5) Can I claim more than one perk? YES! Each perk that you contribute to is counted as a separate contribution. If you want another item, you will have to select it and contribute again for that perk.

6) Can I change my perk? No! Sorry! We are unable to help with that. Be sure to select the perk you want before you make any contribution(s).

7) What if I move or change my address? If you move before the perks are shipped, contact us immediately through your Indiegogo account and we'll do our best to make the change.

8) Can I make a pledge or contribution for a family member or friend? You can make your pledge for anyone you want! Be sure to provide us with the person's information when we send out our surveys. You will be able to specify who you want the perk to go to.

9) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? This campaign is a MASSIVE UNDERTAKING! We get many questions every day and we will try to answer back if possible. Please be assured that we do read all questions and concerns in our efforts to help everyone and run a smooth campaign as much as possible.

10) What country is the campaign perks offered to? Everything is offered to the U.S. ONLY! However, we do have an item or two offered strictly to the U.K. as well. THAT'S IT!

11) When will the movie be released in theaters? If our campaign is successful, we plan to film by the end of this year. A release generally takes another 4 months after post-production is completed. (film editing, soundtrack added, etc...)

12) When will the Red Carpet Premiere be held? It will be held approximately 2 weeks before the theater release date.

13) Will the CAST SIGNED PHOTO SET have the actor's pictures depicted in the campaign? My cast members have tried in their best efforts to submit the depicted photos you see for this LIMITED EDITION OF 100 set. However, some cast members are getting new photos. This happens all the time. Therefore, you may not receive the exact photo depicted for each actor. We hope you will still enjoy your set. FOR A CAST SET OF 14 or more photos at the price offering......IT'S QUITE A BARGAIN!

14) Are all cast members offering individual photos? NO! You can only get photos of all cast members in the LIMITED EDITION CAST SIGNED SET! We are only offering individual signed photos from those actors who wish to offer extras for their fans and followers.

15) Where will the 2018 NASCAR Event be? This will be in Las Vegas. It is the PENNZOIL 400 race and fans will attend with some cast members. There will be additional exclusive features with this package.

​16) Why will it take so long to receive most of these items? The campaign will end in approximately 60 days or sooner. When it ends, then we have to wait for Indiegogo to transfer the funds from the campaign to us. When we finally do get all the funds, then we have to place our orders with all the vendors/manufacturers for the perks. Any items related to the movie itself, such as movie tickets, DVD's, 4k downloads, production photo cards, etc..., must wait until either during the filming of the movie or when the movie is filmed and completed before we can fulfill those perks. It takes time to setup a full blown production and get to actual filming. Therefore, your patience will be required as we will work as quickly as possible to get this movie made and get your perks to you. We appreciate your support and your patience more than you'll ever truly know! Just as Chris Routhe says in his video. THANK YOU!

Thank you so much everyone! You're awesome! Will post updates!

story:
What if the "Golden Girls met Breaking Bad?"

What if you lost all your retirement savings in a Ponzi Scheme, and had nothing left in the bank? How far would you go to get it back, and help a friend in need?

Well "Nana's Secret Recipe" is a film that will remind you of the good ole' days of zany movies from the 80s and 90s.

The film is laugh out loud funny, has great strong female characters over the age of 60, and is all about the importance of friendship and sisterhood.  

My name is Mehul Shah, and I'm a filmmaker who wants to make films that are not only entertaining and engaging, but have a strong social message.

I found "Nana's Secret Recipe" to be an endearing  script from first time writer Yolanda Avery that not only touches the heart strings but makes you laugh out loud. It reminds me of  "Steel Magnolias," stressing the importance of a strong female community rallying together for a good cause.

Check out more from Kinetik Films, LLC

Those who contribute will not only be able to have their name on a film that stresses these important life lessons, but will also get access to exclusive behind the scenes content that will let you experience the thrill of being on a movie set!

What We Need & What You Get

We're halfway there. But we need the extra push to make this film really shine. Getting the right look to make this film as candy sweet and beautiful as we can, recruiting a strong wardrobe and art department, hair and makeup, and authentic Southern locations.

We've already found our nanas that are going to bring the characters to life, and we need to make sure that we have enough funds to get this film through post-production (color correction, sound mixing, music composition) so we have the opportunity to submit to the best film festivals out there to get our film out for the world to see!

Kellie's Baking Co. has graciously given us the go-ahead to shoot in their gorgeous location in Austin. And they really do stand up to having the best chocolate chip cookies in Austin. Yum!

Have you ever wondered what goes into actually making a movie? Well, we plan on giving you an all-access pass into the behind the scenes making of the film and you'll be with us step-by-step through the process. 

The Impact

There are so many life lessons in this film.  The importance of friendship and sisterhood, the need for the legalization of medicinal marijuana for those in pain, the use of humor to get through those difficult times.  

This will be the fifth film I've produced, and this fun story gets me energized and excited to show the world how hilarious a bunch of Southern ladies can be.  Finding films that pass the Bechdel Test  are far and few between, and I'm proud to say this film passes it with flying colors.  Females talking only about men is so last century!

The last films I've done have sold to Netflix, Blockbuster, Amazon, and numerous retailers including Walmart and Best Buy. Having these established links and relationships with distributors will give it the best chance to get distributed for the world to see.  

Risks & Challenges

The good news is that we have a dedicated and experienced film crew that work within the Austin film industry lined up to make this a success. This film is raring to go and we are dedicated to making this the best possible film we can.  

Other Ways You Can Help

What makes us different from other Hollywood productions is that we're a modest crew who wants to make the best possible film we can.  We're so lucky to be in the great city of Austin, TX, where southern hospitality isn't just a saying, but a way of life!

If you're able to help us find food donations, (cast & crew get hungry after shooting 10-12 hour days), locations for these lovely ladies Southern homes, or just want to shadow and assist and help us on set make this dream a reality, there are plenty of ways you could help "Nana's Secret Recipe" come to life. 

For more information, feel free to send us an e-mail at nanassweettreatsmovie@gmail.com

Facebook Page

Our Beautiful Cast:

MILLIE-LINDA BRADSHAW

 

After being in global sales of telecommunications equipment for 30 years, Linda always wanted to act, sing and dance when she retired, and attributes her success to her acting coach Carol Hickey. 

BRENDA-CINDA DONOVAN

Originally from Houston, Cinda moved to Boston and started her 20 year acting career in commercials and films along with being involved with theater productions in New York.

She's now back in Texas and enjoying the Hill Country life.

ABBY-NANCY GRAY

A producer, actress, and project manager with over 20 years of experience leading creative projects for television, video, marketing and education - both in front of and behind - the camera. 

YVONNE-TRISH POWELL

Both an actress and vocalist, Trish Powell's screen credits include "The Final Cut" and and "Accute Residue". 

SUZANNE-CHARLOTTE WHITE

Charlotte is represented by Linda McAlister Talent, and her screen credits include: "Grey", "Made with Love," and "Socrates."

BETTY-MICHELLE SHERRILL

A born storyteller, Michelle presently studies under Condrey at R.E.A.C.T. Studios, where she's devoted fifteen years, and has developed into an inspiring acting instructor as well. Her  screen credits include: "Chariot," "Camino," and "Conversations in the Grass."

JAMAL-AARON CAROLINA

Aaron Carolina will play "Jamal," Yvonne's steadfast cop son. His screen credits include "The Cliff," "The Real Trayjedy" and "Hillary's America."

story:
Four years ago I began making short films.  I had been a playwright most of my adult life, but in 2013  I accepted a position to curate a film program at a local art gallery. This enabled me to indulge my lifelong passion for independent films. As I had presented a short film series, a friend challenged me to make an original film. Not having the resources to undertake such a daunting task, I turned to the collage form which utilizes preexisting material, requiring no cameras, actors, sets, etc. Computer software like Apple’s Final Cut enabled me to become a “One man band” so to speak. I called my projects “Folk Art Films.” To my grateful surprise, my films were passed around on social media and I was lucky enough to develop a following on Vimeo. I have posted links to these films above.

With this campaign I am hoping to acquire new equipment to enable me to continue making films.  The equipment I have been using has become faulty beyond repair. I also hope to acquire software that will allow me to create more elaborate projects. These expensive programs are beyond my means.  

In the future I plan to make original short films as well, and I intend to launch a website where my films can be posted. Any help in the form of donations to achieve these goals will be very much appreciated.

Below are links to articles that have been written about my work:

http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Awesome-New-PACIFIC-OVERTURES-Mash-Up-Music-Video-20150520

http://expatriato.blogspot.com/2016/02/all-things-beautiful.html

http://www.mtishows.com/news/filichia-features-ed-cachianes-follies

http://expatriato.blogspot.com/2017/04/the-light-fantastick.html#more

http://expatriato.blogspot.com/2017/07/dreaming-on-our-dimes.html#more

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my page!

At its core, this film is about a woman struggling to make sense of life and overcome the past. I hope the film encourages audiences to reflect upon their humanity, their choices, and their limits.

A lot of pieces need to fall perfectly into place for this film to happen, but the one thing that will make it a true success is your continued support. I am in the process of launching a crowdfunding campaign through which I hope to raise $3,000 to make the film. The funds will help secure cast, crew, locations, materials, and entries into film festivals. Upon its completion, this film will act as a launch-pad for my career and an example of my skills and passions so I’m putting everything I have into it. This will be a lengthy journey and I invite you to join me. Any support is welcome support, whether monetary, prayers, or likes and shares on social media, any and everything will help bring this film to the big screen!
