story:
the story:

 

background: The Marble People- a distinct, mysterious type of beings carry the wisdom and secrets of the universe. They are non organic; made of star dust and rocks and are themselves celestial. They have accompanied humanity since it's first steps on Earth and were considered to be divine. 

synopsis:  Leo, a former surfer recovering from a severe brain damage caused from drowning, struggles through the exhausting process as he refuse to believe he drowned accidentally. Later we realize that the Marbles are related to Leo: they have a role in his fatal drowning and in his miraculous healing. 

Story an script by: Tsuk Ben Zvi

why is it unique?

Most types of aliens in popular culture are presented as a standard life form that is not much different from earth life forms. For examples aliens have heads, eyes, mouths, limbs etc. those are obvious things for us as humans, but who said that other beings will share those basic features with us? These popular alien figures were created by humans, who are restricted to the human perspective, and literally a out of this world creativity is necessary to create an art piece that will look actually alien. 

Marbles feature a new concept of a being. One that the physical experience is not as meaningful as it is for us, and that carries the wisdom, consciousness and frequency of the universe. 

 

why is this important for us?

In our team we are all young aspiring filmmakers and actors. Some of us are writers who have written incredibly exciting original material. Writing is a solo work, however to produce a film it's a complicated team work. The more experience we gain in producing our original works, the more work we can share out there with the world. 

This film specifically is intended to become a feature film in the future. The better the results we achieve now, the better our chances will be to have the support we will need for the feature. 

For each one of us it's a matter of shaping our careers and our individual styles. 

what do we need the funds for?

Mostly for these 4 reasons:

1. Cast/ Talents- we as actors believe that actors should get paid. There is nothing more frustrating than working really hard and not be rewarded for that. In general- more money at this front means more options for casting. 

2. Logistics and Equipment- we have most of the equipment needed for the production. However there will be several outdoor location in this production that require an addition of equipment, and a preparation in terms of transporting gear and manpower. 

3. Sets: there will be two sets that we will have to either build fully, or transform a location into- one of them is of a clinic where Leo has his sessions, and the other is of a cave in which we find prehistorical evidences for the Marbles. 

4. Special Effects: The creation of an animated characters and other effects will increase the cost of post production, and require a specific gear such as green screen. 

 

international networking

Director Tsuk Ben Zvi and producer Nicole Feinholz are graduates of the Vancouver Film School (VFS) in Vancouver, Canada. While shooting in Israel, advance editing and other post production elements will occur in Vancouver by other graduates of the school. 

Members of the cast and crew are of different nationalities. 

We hope that some of you from different countries will donate money, and later the film will be viewed world wide, and international networking with filmmakers and audiences will be made.

We hope to inspire filmmakers all around the work to create their original art.  

 

credits

Anyone donating 70$ or more will get a "Special Thanks" credit.

Anyone donating 500$ or more will get an Executive producer credit.

story:
Who I am

I'm Scott Danzig, a computer programmer, who lives and breathes filmmaking in every spare moment I get.  I believe in my creativity and technical chops, and have proven time and time again that I can make films people love.  It's not easy, and it always feels like I'm building a house of cards, but I found that by partnering with the right collaborators, and by simply refusing to give up, that house gets built, every time. Visit www.sneakyghost.com to see some of my work.

I don't do this for a day job. I hope to one day, but for now, it's been largely out of pocket. I'm running a crowdfunding campaign for this next film because I need the community behind me to keep going. I've gotten enthusiastic responses to my efforts, and I want to let fans of my work be a part of my crazy filmmaking adventures as I create more films that you can be proud of.

The film

Toddler Tartare is my attempt to be comfortable making uncomfortable art. It was certainly awkward applying for a grant for this! However, I love absurdist humor, and a cannibalistic restaurant certainly lends to that, but -- there are deeper layers. The restaurant serves as a metaphor for our world. Those we love are in this world with us in our dark times. We each decide for ourselves how we cope and what we prioritize.

Also, to improve my directing, I signed up for acting classes at the Actors' Workshop of Ithaca and not only did I learn a lot and make a bunch of great friends, but I also roped in three more awesome actors to add to my talented cast.

I love actors and am very excited to work again with all of them!

How I'll use your money

I'm asking for $2,000 to help make this film happen.  First, I need it for props, like fake yet convincing knives and body parts. Here are some I already purchased.

Also, there's set design, such as tablecloths, and things, including prepared food, on the restaurant's tables for various scenes.  For wardrobe we need outfits for the restaurant staff, and some accessories for the cast.  People in film need to eat.  Here's how much food was left over after a long day on my last shoot:

Also, I always need supplies like gaffers tape, black wrap, new bulbs, batteries, new gels. I'll have to cover transportation expenses as necessary too.  And the mansion has particular lighting needs.  I've already bought a powerful Rayzr 7 LED fresnel light for over $1500, but need "modifiers" that help me make the light look more natural and pleasing.  Specifically, I'll need a "scrim kit" plus another C-stand.  Then, of course, post production, which likely will include special effects work, music, and sound editing.

If I don't reach my goal

I spend a lot of my own money on good equipment, which is why I don't have to ask for a lot, but I can't sustain shouldering the entire financial burden. If I don't reach my crowdfunding goal, I've put too much work into this film to not see it through, and will pull out credit cards if necessary, but I will have difficulty starting the next.

The perks I'm offering include me answering questions. I'm a Top Writer on Quora.com, and also notorious for using my cat Luna to help do so. See www.littlechomper.com to see what Luna can do for you. While I'll provide quality answers myself for a $25 donation...

Luna will step in at $50.  See www.littlechomper.com for what to expect.

Binghamton, NY, while still economically recovering, has a vibrant theater, music, and art scene, and has been hungry to embrace filmmaking. On my last shoot, despite a raging blizzard, everyone, even the extras all showed up. They're true professionals that deserve opportunities!

Risks

The main risk for this film is the time we're allowed to film in the mansion.  Three six hour days.  I've been working hard on the shot list with planning, with shot lists and overhead diagrams, figuring out what shots are necessary, what can be combined, and, for the first time in my filmmaking career, I'm going to embrace greenscreening for every shot possible.  I managed to whittle down the number of shots we need to a manageable number, and have leaned on the advice of others for how to best light the set quickly. A lot of good collaborators are volunteering to help out, so I'm starting to feel confident.

Help my movies find an audience

In addition to funding, I also encourage you to spread the word about this project.  My pitch video, despite how silly it seems, deserves to be shared! I'm sure the baby that I used for this promo will be proud of her part in this project when she grows up, but you can show your pride now!  IndieGoGo provides share tools to help. Also, if you want to see what I come up with in the future, please like and share my Facebook page at www.facebook.com/sneakyghost! Like any good filmmaker, I want to connect with as many people as I can that like my work.

story:
What is this movie about?

Deeply concerned about the current racial and social divisions in America, songwriter and composer K Ishibashi (professionally known as “Kishi Bashi”),  takes a unique approach to creating his next album.  He traces his steps through his creative process, as he re-imagines the Japanese American Incarceration during WWII through his unique musical lens. 

In an effort to gain inspiration,  Kishi Bashi joins a group of Brown University grad students and visits incarceration sites along the west coast. As he improvises violin and writes songs at many significant locations, he is transformed by the daily discussions on the Asian American identity, as well as the gripping contemporary relevance that the incarceration has to immigration issues and vulnerable minority groups today. 

‘Omoiyari’, a Japanese word that means to have sympathy and compassion towards another person,  is the bedrock of the film. Kishi Bashi explores how empathy and the lack of it has played key roles in our modern quest for social equality. 

The power of the film score being the impetus behind the creation of the film, Kishi Bashi breaks down the barrier between composer and filmmaker, pioneering a new ambitious form of artistic expression:

the songfilm

The film will be an engaging mixture of dynamic cinematography, engaging commentary, fun insight, and a luscious and dynamic musical score by Kishi Bashi, as well as cutting edge film making and colorization of archival black and white photos. Rarely has a film followed the singular vision of an artist so closely, as he meditates  about the power of the human spirit. There will also be ninjas (Kishi Bashi's father is from an ancient ninja village). 

The Team: 

Kishi Bashi - Composer, co-director

Kishi Bashi is the pseudonym of K Ishibashi, an internationally acclaimed Japanese-American songwriter and multi-instrumentalist. Having graduated from the Berklee College of Music with a degree in film scoring, Kishi Bashi has been rapidly bridging the gap between pop music and orchestral music. A virtuoso improvising violinist, he has toured with and collaborated with Regina Spektor and the indie band of Montreal, and has appeared on most late night TV shows (including SNL, David Letterman, Conan, and Jimmy Fallon). His original music has been featured on major commercial TV campaigns and films (Microsoft, Samsung, American Express, Target, Apple, Gold). In 2012, NPR Music named Kishi Bashi "Best New Artist". He recently scored the blockbuster snowboard film, The Fourth Phase.  

Singer songwriter, Julian Saporiti (No No Boy Project) and singer Erin Aoyama, whose mother was incarcerated at Heart Mountain, are kindred Brown University scholars who quickly connected with Kishi Bashi and his passion for retelling the incarceration story through song and art. They will travel to Heart Mountain, Wyoming and to incarceration camps in Arkansas to find more stories and perspectives,  and will forge a creative bond that will fuel future scholarship and re-imagination. 

Justin Taylor Smith, director

Justin Taylor Smith is a filmmaker based in Bozeman, Montana. Growing up in California, as a child he began making short surfing and skateboarding films with friends with his family's camcorder. Later in life this passion turned into a career as he moved to Jackson, WY to work with some of the industry's top filmmakers making films, commercials and content for many of the adventure sports communities largest brands. Justin has worked on films such as We Are Blood and Travis Rice's films The Fourth Phase and Depth Perception. Self taught, rooted in music and rich visual storytelling, Justin aspires to deliver visceral, authentic film experiences.

Max Ritter - cinematographer

Max Ritter is a DIY independent film maker based in Southern California specializing in documentary and branded work. Max has strong roots in the action sports industry having worked for brands such as Hurley, DC Shoes, Skullcandy, and Fender among others. Max is an avid music fan, photographer, and seriously dedicated Dodger baseball fan. He is also a proud husband and father to his sons Duke and Dodger (beagle).

Andy Bardon - photographer

Always visually inspired, Andy began documenting the world around him as a way of sharing his adventures.  He made his transition into photography after years as a professional mountain guide for Exum Mountain Guides in Jackson, Wyoming. Through his climbing ability he was able to access remote locations with a camera firmly in tow, setting the stage for his photography and cinematography work on mountains around the globe, beginning with a three month project on Mount Everest with National Geographic in 2012.  He has since found himself anywhere from the sparkling waters of Tahiti to the tops of peaks in Kazakhstan and everything in between.  Now internationally published, Andy works for a select group of commercial and editorial clients, and is a regular contributor to National Geographic. 

Colorization of Black and White Photos

We are also collaborating with the leading colorization specialist, Marina Amaral, to help bring photos closer to the contemporary conscienceless:

What we need money for, and why this film is important:

Omoiyari  is a film about the resilience of the human spirit, and the more engaging we make it, the more positive of an impact this film will have. We are currently in the production phase.  We have several additional locations to film, and there are a myriad of costs associated with this, including travel costs, equipment costs, and personnel costs. We will also require funds for  post-production, which include editing, motion graphics, animation, colorization, and soundtrack creation, to name a few. In the end, it is Kishi Bashi's vision to tour with this film, combined with a live performance aesthetic that will give hope and understanding that we can learn from history and create a more compassionate society for the future. We invite you to be a part of a very unique creative statement that will have positive reverberating effects for years to come!
story_txt: What is this movie about?Deeply concerned about the current racial and social divisions in America, songwriter and composer K Ishibashi (professionally known as “Kishi Bashi”),  takes a unique approach to creating his next album.  He traces his steps through his creative process, as he re-imagines the Japanese American Incarceration during WWII through his unique musical lens. In an effort to gain inspiration,  Kishi Bashi joins a group of Brown University grad students and visits incarceration sites along the west coast. As he improvises violin and writes songs at many significant locations, he is transformed by the daily discussions on the Asian American identity, as well as the gripping contemporary relevance that the incarceration has to immigration issues and vulnerable minority groups today. ‘Omoiyari’, a Japanese word that means to have sympathy and compassion towards another person,  is the bedrock of the film. Kishi Bashi explores how empathy and the lack of it has played key roles in our modern quest for social equality. The power of the film score being the impetus behind the creation of the film, Kishi Bashi breaks down the barrier between composer and filmmaker, pioneering a new ambitious form of artistic expression:the songfilmThe film will be an engaging mixture of dynamic cinematography, engaging commentary, fun insight, and a luscious and dynamic musical score by Kishi Bashi, as well as cutting edge film making and colorization of archival black and white photos. Rarely has a film followed the singular vision of an artist so closely, as he meditates  about the power of the human spirit. There will also be ninjas (Kishi Bashi's father is from an ancient ninja village). The Team: Kishi Bashi - Composer, co-directorKishi Bashi is the pseudonym of K Ishibashi, an internationally acclaimed Japanese-American songwriter and multi-instrumentalist. Having graduated from the Berklee College of Music with a degree in film scoring, Kishi Bashi has been rapidly bridging the gap between pop music and orchestral music. A virtuoso improvising violinist, he has toured with and collaborated with Regina Spektor and the indie band of Montreal, and has appeared on most late night TV shows (including SNL, David Letterman, Conan, and Jimmy Fallon). His original music has been featured on major commercial TV campaigns and films (Microsoft, Samsung, American Express, Target, Apple, Gold). In 2012, NPR Music named Kishi Bashi "Best New Artist". He recently scored the blockbuster snowboard film, The Fourth Phase.  Singer songwriter, Julian Saporiti (No No Boy Project) and singer Erin Aoyama, whose mother was incarcerated at Heart Mountain, are kindred Brown University scholars who quickly connected with Kishi Bashi and his passion for retelling the incarceration story through song and art. They will travel to Heart Mountain, Wyoming and to incarceration camps in Arkansas to find more stories and perspectives,  and will forge a creative bond that will fuel future scholarship and re-imagination. Justin Taylor Smith, directorJustin Taylor Smith is a filmmaker based in Bozeman, Montana. Growing up in California, as a child he began making short surfing and skateboarding films with friends with his family's camcorder. Later in life this passion turned into a career as he moved to Jackson, WY to work with some of the industry's top filmmakers making films, commercials and content for many of the adventure sports communities largest brands. Justin has worked on films such as We Are Blood and Travis Rice's films The Fourth Phase and Depth Perception. Self taught, rooted in music and rich visual storytelling, Justin aspires to deliver visceral, authentic film experiences.Max Ritter - cinematographerMax Ritter is a DIY independent film maker based in Southern California specializing in documentary and branded work. Max has strong roots in the action sports industry having worked for brands such as Hurley, DC Shoes, Skullcandy, and Fender among others. Max is an avid music fan, photographer, and seriously dedicated Dodger baseball fan. He is also a proud husband and father to his sons Duke and Dodger (beagle).Andy Bardon - photographerAlways visually inspired, Andy began documenting the world around him as a way of sharing his adventures.  He made his transition into photography after years as a professional mountain guide for Exum Mountain Guides in Jackson, Wyoming. Through his climbing ability he was able to access remote locations with a camera firmly in tow, setting the stage for his photography and cinematography work on mountains around the globe, beginning with a three month project on Mount Everest with National Geographic in 2012.  He has since found himself anywhere from the sparkling waters of Tahiti to the tops of peaks in Kazakhstan and everything in between.  Now internationally published, Andy works for a select group of commercial and editorial clients, and is a regular contributor to National Geographic. Colorization of Black and White PhotosWe are also collaborating with the leading colorization specialist, Marina Amaral, to help bring photos closer to the contemporary conscienceless:What we need money for, and why this film is important:Omoiyari  is a film about the resilience of the human spirit, and the more engaging we make it, the more positive of an impact this film will have. We are currently in the production phase.  We have several additional locations to film, and there are a myriad of costs associated with this, including travel costs, equipment costs, and personnel costs. We will also require funds for  post-production, which include editing, motion graphics, animation, colorization, and soundtrack creation, to name a few. In the end, it is Kishi Bashi's vision to tour with this film, combined with a live performance aesthetic that will give hope and understanding that we can learn from history and create a more compassionate society for the future. We invite you to be a part of a very unique creative statement that will have positive reverberating effects for years to come!

story:
The Film

Synopsis

Thomas Mallory is a big-city detective, demoted to a small town after a series of scandalous incidents. He needs to solve a big case to earn his way home. A dead college student starts Mallory on an investigation that uncovers a centuries-old society of killers now dwelling in this small college-town. Mallory, always one step behind the bad guys, must expose and stop the murderers before he becomes the next victim, or killer.  

On THEME and GENRE

Watch Me is a film noir about the battle between the temptation to do wrong, and the desire to do right.  Noir, as a genre, is darker both visually and tonally, and allows us to more freely explore the darker sides of the human condition.  Classic noir's include The Big Sleep, The Maltese Falcon, and more recently L.A. Confidential, and Se7en.  Yet there is more to a film's story than just the movie's on-screen story.  

PROJECT HISTORY

Watch Me's script started in a Studio City cloffice (that's a closet/office) and was refined in Athens, GA.  At the suggestion of his wife, writer/director Brian Armes sent the script to her school classmate, Heather Shisler for consideration as the femme fatale, Vicki Wellington.  Ms. Shisler, a recent graduate of the Actor's Studio Drama School is joined by her fellow alumnus Dan Kellmer and Athens's own Brittani Bumb to round out the principal cast.  

Behind the camera, Watch Me will be directed by writer/director Brian Armes, an alumnus of the American Film Institute Conservatory and lecturer of Film and Digital Media at the University of North Georgia.  Joining him is cinematographer Tim Kang, a graduate of the American Film Institute Conservatory's prestigious Cinematography program.  Production Design will be helmed by Karen Ipock, a native of the Southeast.  The film will also feature the music of Seoul-based American-Korean punk band ...Whatever That Means (links and photos are below). 

The team is eager to introduce our growing audience to this project and ask for your support in making this film a reality.  We are here on this site seeking seed money to ensure a minimum funding for production. 

THE PLAN 
Production is scheduled to start in Athens, GA, on July 7, 2016.  Much of our crew, key equipment, and some supporting cast will be coming from the University of North Georgia's Department of Communication, Media, and Journalism.  Through this project, these students will have the unique opportunity for hands-on production experience, under the leadership of trained Los Angeles-based filmmakers, that will supplement their classroom education.  This start date allows a complete production window before the start of the fall school semester.  

Post-production will continue in the fall, based out of Los Angeles.  Upon completion in spring of 2017, plans for Watch Me include a celebration tour where we will share the fruits of our labors with our backers in a series of road-shows, a season on the festival circuit where we will continue to grow our audience of cinephiles, and finally, a journey into distribution where audiences may have an opportunity to experience our film in theatrical and video-on-demand platforms. 
But none of that will be possible without a funded and supported production.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The production needs $36,000 to fund travel, compensation, and housing for our attached elements.  Additional funds are also needed for production essentials:

crew  - because we need people to make a movie
cast – because we need people to be in the movie
food – because cast and crew need to eat
equipment – because we need materials to shoot the film
locations – because we need places to be when shooting the film
props and set pieces – because actors need to hold stuff
and insurance – because . . . well, let’s not talk about those things.

Check out the incentives on this site.  Contributors of any amount will be invited to regional backers-only screening events once the film is completed.  Other contributors can receive exclusive access to behind-the-scenes information, content, and experiences like set visits, meals with the filmmakers, pre-screening mixers, and even parts in the film!  We feel there is no better way to thank our partners than making you all a part of this experience.

While we have lofty goals in this campaign, and have posted a $36,000 goal, any funds pledged will go toward the production of this film. 

THIS SHOW'S IMPACT

The Armes Movie Factory, a Georgia-based film development and production company, aims to produce feature films honoring classic film genres and Hollywood filmmaking techniques.  Projects are planned for production in 2018 and 2020, and their success will be shaped by the success of Watch Me.  Coupled with passions for local storytelling and education, emphasis will be given toward employing younger Georgians, fresh from college and graduate programs, and producing these projects in their "backyard."  We believe this will help and equip them in acquiring skills of professionalism and an understanding of film industry best-practices and standards.  From there, the sky will be the limit for these storytellers and the stories they will tell.

OUR RISKS & CHALLENGES

Making a feature film is a major undertaking, and we are daily building a team ready for the challenge and committed to its success.  Cast and crew are listed below, and full bios are available at www.watchmemovie.com.  More will be announced in the days and weeks to come.  Check back frequently for the latest details.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

As the crew grows and the reality of production breaks the horizon, the logistical and support needs become more evident.  There are times when money is tight, and we understand that.  But everyone can still help.

1.  Join our campaign by spreading the word.  Use the Indiegogo share tools on your social media to encourage friends to join our campaign.

2.  Our team is seeking goods and services provided in-kind.  Contact us at brian@armesmoviefactory.com to discuss these opportunities or other ways to get more involved with the production!

Thanks for your consideration of our project.  We encourage you to join our campaign and lend your support.


The Cast

Heather Shisler (Vicki Wellington)          

Brittani Bumb (Patience McCreary)  


Jake Pearson (Officer Downey)           



The Production Team

Brian Armes (Writer/Director)                

Clay Brantley (Co-Producer)                 

Tim Kang (Director of Photography)  

Karen Ipock (Production Designer)    

...Whatever That Means (Music)

story:
"Crusade in Wonderland". 

"Rise of the Drumpf" a  satire about politics in America today.


Trump says adios to respect. Trump says adios to diversity. Trump say adios to a  united country. But we say hello to the idea of having a land where everyone fits in. A land where diversity makes us greater. 

Based on that dream was born Crusade in Wonderland, a short film that tells the story of an immigrant family. Martina, an 8 year old girl who was born in Wonderland to undocumented parents. Lupita, the older sister came to Wonderland as a small girl. Their father was deported to Mexico after having been caught working without documents in the kitchen of a fancy restaurant.

Rosa, the girls mother, and Don Choco, the grandfather, are raising the sisters and doing a great job despite the complexity of their circumstances. But in Wonderland, the malicious speech of the clowns who want to rule the place
promotes division and creates an atmosphere of hatred that damages the relations among neighbors.

For this project a group of artists from United States, Syria, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Pakistan, Ecuador, Venezuela, Poland, Haiti, Philippines,  have join to work together. We believe in film making as a way to reflect and question realities, we aim to tell stories that entertain but also affect our communities in a positive way. We want to see this world as a better place, a place where everyone fits, no matter what their race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or economic status. 

Help us to raise $7,000 or more; this time we don't want to end up broke


We're trying to raise $7,000 or more to cover our production and post-production costs, including: cast transportation, locations, production, food,  costumes, props etc. Since the movie has many scenes which take place in a fantasy world, we need specials resources to build that world.

Then, of course, we are going to need funds for editing, color correction, sound effects, special post production effects, and celebration for accomplishment, including pinatas and lots of cold beer.

STOP HATRED AND 

LET'S DREAM TOGETHER

In our movie we would like to show how the message of hatred that some politicians are spewing is causing devastating damage in our communities. We truly believe we all have a desperate need for a different kind of political order, less hate and bigotry, more love and tolerance. It is time to fight to find the path to a constructive dialogue, where there can be a safe middle area where people of different backgrounds can mingle, where everybody has a voice, where ideas can coexist, and where fair choices  beneficial to the community can be made and implemented. 

We know that making this film real is a challenge

Even though we know that making this movie is a challenge, even a bit of a mad enterprisse we are keen to make the project forward, we know with your help we can make it happen.

If you can't help us with money help us by

Telling your friends and making some noise about this campaign. Thanks!

CAST

Emely Grisanty, Dominican

Alexandra Gutiérrez, Venezuelan

Sully Bonnelly, Dominican

Karina Domínguez, Mexican

Omar Nassar, Syrian/Venezuelan

Ayiesha Alizai Sadik, Pakistani

Libia Gil, Colombian


Rosalba Hernández, Mexican

Andrés Martínez-Tutek, Colombian

CREW

Alejandro Marin

story:
Who are we?

Kibanda Pictures is a local Film Production company with a mission to tell Kenyan stories the Kenyan way. Last year, we participated in a short film challenge dubbed the 48 hour Film Project which is a competition which focuses on the development of short films (start to finish) within 48 hours. http://www.48hourfilm.com/how-it-works

We developed a 7 minute long short film titled ‘Bait’ for the project and won six awards including Best Short film and Audience Choice Award. In addition to winning at the 48hr Film Project, ‘Bait’ represented Kenya at the Filmapalooza Festival in Atlanta and was shortlisted among the top 15 short Films from across the globe to be featured at the Cannes Film Festival –short films corner- between the 16th May and 22nd May 2016. http://www.48hourfilm.com/home

Other accolades won by ‘Bait’ include:

? 2016 Best Short Film at the Riverwood awards.

? Best Script

? Best Actress

? Best Supporting Actress

Kibanda Pictures would love to get our award winning Director (Likarion Wainaina) and our celebrated Writer (Brian Munene) to the 2016 Cannes Film Festival. Their physical presence at the festival is crucial because:

? It would be a show of support for our local talent and local productions.

? It’s not every day that local productions get showcased abroad…this is a feat that needs representatives and who’s better suited other than the brainchild behind ‘Bait’?

? The Festival provides an opportunity for Kenya to be recognized on International platforms as a film destination and a potential key player in the Film Industry

? Give Likarion and Brian an opportunity to benchmark and interact with industry players from diverse places and backgrounds

Where/how do you come in?

We cannot afford (financially) to send Likarion and Brian to France. So, we are looking for support in either cash or kind to ensure that they get to France by the 16th of May. We therefore appeal for any form of support from you towards this noble cause. Whatever support you will give us will go towards catering for:

1. Return Air Tickets to France (2 pax)

2. Accommodation

3. Visa Application Fees

4. Upkeep while in France


We are in love with what we do and really want to go to France but we cannot make this happen without your help.

Thank you for your consideration.

You can watch the short film BAIT through the link below.

http://www.48hourfilm.com/nairobi-ke/films/11508/Bait-by-Kibanda-Pictures

story:
The Journey to Space Journey

Space Journey first came to be fifteen years ago when a young Benjamin Blue wrote a short script about four ridiculous characters in their ridiculously humongous spaceship. Since then, many things have changed, including the introduction and popularization of the web show, which presented itself as the opportune platform to share Space Journey with the world. 
Ben convinced a few of his film school comrades to join him on this crazy venture, which grew into a cast and crew of twenty five crazies ready to make Space Journey a reality. Thus, our proof of concept pilot episode. We really want to make Space Journey professional quality entertainment with great sets and eye-popping effects, so we brought it to IndieGoGo to gain momentum to shoot the first four episodes, which complete a story arc. 
We've all grown to love and embrace Space Journey, even those of us who aren't sci-fi or Star Trek enthusiasts. These characters and stories are full of hilarity, adventure, and plenty of reverent satire. If you like what you see and contribute to Space Journey you are helping us create a new and colorful world to share with the real one. We firmly believe comedy is essential to living, and laughing essential to sanity. Help us keep the world sane by allowing us to share the insanity of Space Journey!

The Effects of Your Efforts

We are looking to raise $150,000 for the first four episodes here on IndieGoGo. This will be crucial to lease a space big enough for all our necessary set construction including the bridge, halls, and dining quarters of the USS Abnormalinsize. As you can infer from the name, this spaceship is HUGE, and the sets need to match. We also want to bring back the amazing cast and crew, plus some, at industry standard rates for a professional shoot. 
Here's a little insight to the cost breakdown we're looking at. A small portion will help pay off our loan used to shoot the pilot, a larger portion to the actual production of the first four episodes, and the largest to pre-production. 

In exchange for supporting Space Fleet (us) we are offering some exclusive and unique Space Journey rewards for you to enjoy! These range from a special Space Journey patch to show off around town, to a T-shirt designed by our own stunt coordinator (he's multitalented), to a Supporting Producer credit for one or more episodes of the show. You can also get a poster signed by the series cast members including a Mighty Morphin Power Ranger! 
Even if we are unable to raise the desired amount here on IndieGoGo, your contributions will still go toward Space Journey, and only Space Journey. First and foremost we will be paying back our loan and acquiring the studio space mentioned above, then stretching your support as far as we can in design and set construction while looking for other means of funding to shoot the episodes if need be. 

Deep Impact

For far too long independent science fiction has been dominated by the pensive and morose, but Space Journey shall finally loose sci-fi from the angsty shackles of futurism so that it can frolic across the starry meadows of hope and bring laughter to tiny children (and grown up children) as it was meant to. 

We want to take this journey with you! 

Dreams on the Edge

This campaign is specifically for the first four episodes. The first season alone has sixteen episodes total and we have three seasons of the show outlined and raring to come alive. So this is merely the beginning. 
Obviously, to shoot the entire season the way we desire to we will need oodles of money. Once we have the four professional, polished, and hilarious first episodes we will be looking into other means of fundraising as well as IndieGoGo, like shooting our own commercials for products and companies willing to help us out and gain some marketing. 
There is, of course, the constant risk of ultimate failure and demise, but we believe in Space Journey and its appeal to the masses. So we shall fly on and fight for what we know to be good and true silly sci-fi spectacle, while humbly asking for your support in this endeavor. 

Other Ways to Support Space Fleet 

We understand not everyone has the money to support our cause, goodness, if we had the money ourselves we wouldn't even be here! But we appreciate any help you can give. Share! Like! Spread the word! Make some noise! We surely are, and people aren't sick of us yet (we think). 
Don't forget, it's super easy to use the IndieGoGo share tools! Fly on!
story_txt:
The Journey to Space Journey
Space Journey first came to be fifteen years ago when a young Benjamin Blue wrote a short script about four ridiculous characters in their ridiculously humongous spaceship. Since then, many things have changed, including the introduction and popularization of the web show, which presented itself as the opportune platform to share Space Journey with the world. 
Ben convinced a few of his film school comrades to join him on this crazy venture, which grew into a cast and crew of twenty five crazies ready to make Space Journey a reality. Thus, our proof of concept pilot episode. We really want to make Space Journey professional quality entertainment with great sets and eye-popping effects, so we brought it to IndieGoGo to gain momentum to shoot the first four episodes, which complete a story arc. 
We've all grown to love and embrace Space Journey, even those of us who aren't sci-fi or Star Trek enthusiasts. These characters and stories are full of hilarity, adventure, and plenty of reverent satire. If you like what you see and contribute to Space Journey you are helping us create a new and colorful world to share with the real one. We firmly believe comedy is essential to living, and laughing essential to sanity. Help us keep the world sane by allowing us to share the insanity of Space Journey!   
The Effects of Your Efforts
We are looking to raise $150,000 for the first four episodes here on IndieGoGo. This will be crucial to lease a space big enough for all our necessary set construction including the bridge, halls, and dining quarters of the USS Abnormalinsize. As you can infer from the name, this spaceship is HUGE, and the sets need to match. We also want to bring back the amazing cast and crew, plus some, at industry standard rates for a professional shoot. 
Here's a little insight to the cost breakdown we're looking at. A small portion will help pay off our loan used to shoot the pilot, a larger portion to the actual production of the first four episodes, and the largest to pre-production.

You can also get a poster signed by the series cast members including a Mighty Morphin Power Ranger! 
Even if we are unable to raise the desired amount here on IndieGoGo, your contributions will still go toward Space Journey, and only Space Journey. First and foremost we will be paying back our loan and acquiring the studio space mentioned above, then stretching your support as far as we can in design and set construction while looking for other means of funding to shoot the episodes if need be.

Once we have the four professional, polished, and hilarious first episodes we will be looking into other means of fundraising as well as IndieGoGo, like shooting our own commercials for products and companies willing to help us out and gain some marketing.

Don't forget, it's super easy to use the IndieGoGo share tools! Fly on!

story:
We are KamiyaSoft and are currently developing an otome visual novel called The Multidimensional Underwear Drawer.

We have come quite far in development but have now hit a financial roadblock. This is why we seek your help so that we can pay our illustrator and composer as well as a translator who will take care of the English translation of the game. We’d also like to increase the value of our visual novel by adding several stretch goals which will present us with the opportunity to add more content.

But first, we would like to showcase our project in detail including what we have accomplished so far!

If you prefer to take a direct look at the game without us telling you everything in advance, you can download a free demo here: DOWNLOAD

We would also greatly appreciate your support on Steam Greenlight.

After a long time, Hana is single again. The breakup with her boyfriend Jan has hit her quite hard. While her best friend Kerstin and her childhood friend Furio try their best to free Hana from her depression, she focuses completely on her work and drowns herself in self-pity on the weekend.
But her gloomy mood summons two entities far worse: Two demons start inhabiting her apartment, in order to feed off her strained soul: Tymoteusz and Einar – One residing in her underwear drawer (which he also has happened to turn into a gate to hell itself), while the other possesses her teddy bear.
Adding to that chaos, her neighbor Blanche seems to have taken a rather special interest in Hana as well.
It’s the dawn of a hard time for her: Two demons occupying her home, a lesbian besieging her and two friends constantly pampering her. On top of all that, her ex shows up to reconquer his lost love …

Which way will be the right one for Hana? Which will lead to bliss? Which will lead to loneliness or even death? As Hana decides, so do you!

  • No false bottom! The Multidimensional Underwear Drawer is a full game with five different routes, including one for Yuri-enthusiasts! <3
  • No DLC or microtransactions. You pay once and get EVERYTHING!
    Every Decision Matters! There is no meaningless decision. Every single one influences your Lovemeter!
  • Atmospheric CGs! Every route will receive their own CG. (The more our campaign goal is exceeded, the more CGs we will add! See: Stretchgoals)
  • Linguistic Proficiency! We strive to bring you amusing and intelligent dialogue, both in German and English!
  • How Often Do You Die? With our Death Counter, how many times you have failed to achieve eternal bliss!
  • Rewarding for Achievement Hunters! Over all 5 routes you will be able to unlock a total of 46 achievements!
  • Educational! Over the course of the game, you will encounter several Info-Boxes, filled with funny as well as hilarious explanations for references within the dialogue so that nothing bars your enjoyment of The Multidimensional Underwear Drawer. But don’t worry: You can simply choose to ignore the boxes if you don’t want them ;)

Once we advance in a certain part of development (no matter, how far!), we will update the corresponding chart and inform you via Indiegogo and email.

In case we exceed our campaign goal, we will invest the additional money in more content an illustrations. See: Stretchgoals

Backers will receive rewards organized in 12 separate tiers. The rewards are as following:

  • Tier 1: Taking Part! (5€)
    Your name will appear in the credits!
    You will receive email updates regarding the development process
  • Tier 2: Quick and easy (10€)
    Everything from Tier 1!
    Artwork/Documentation – Everything about the development process
    A short story about a character of your choice
    A wallpaper for your desktop
  • Tier 3: No Frills (20€)
    Everything from Tier 1!
    A digital copy of the game!
  • Tier 4: With Frills (27€)
    Everything from Tier 2!
    Game Guide – That’s how you play!
    A digital copy of the game!
  • Tier 5: Digital Enamorment (32€)
    Everything from Tier 4!
    A digital letter from a character of your choice
  • Tier 6: Fashion Victim (100€)
    Everything from Tier 5!
    A T-shirt in a size of your choice
  • Tier 7: Einar the Huggable (250€)
    Everything from Tier 6!
    A Handmade Einar plushie
    Your t-shirt will be signed
  • Tier 8: Forge your Destiny (1.000€)
    Everything from Tier 7!
    We will create a 30-minute route with your original (not pre-existing) character. You will have a hand in choosing artworks and story! Your route will be playable for all buyers free of additional charge!

  • 8.000 € - Every route will receive an additional CG (+5 CGs). (Bad End CG)
  • 8.500 € - Every route will receive an additional CG (+5 CGs). (Event CG)
  • 10.000 € - Additional route: Narrators’ route (approx. 30 min play time)
    3 new Character Sets for the narrators
    1 CG
    Additional music
    Available in Englisch!
  • 10.500€ - Every route will receive an additional CG (+5 CGs). (Event CG)
  • 11.000€ - Every route will receive an additional CG (+5 CGs). (Event CG)
  • 13.000€ - Additional route: Kerstin‘s route (approx. 1 h play time)
    1 new Character Set for an entirely new character
    2 CGs
    Additional music
    Available in Englisch!

Additional Stretch Goals will be added as we reach existing ones, such as: additional languages, English dubbing, German dubbing, etc.

story:
DEPARTURE is a science fiction/horror short film that follows a mother and scientist, Lisa Abram, who is still grieving and blaming herself for the accidental death of her son. We join her as she prepares to embark on the first manned mission to a parallel universe. As a result of the immense sense of guilt and unbearable depression she's been struggling with since the death of her son five years previously, Lisa has convinced herself that this parallel universe has to be the afterlife, hoping that maybe she might be able to see her son again.

 In this film, we pick up on the morning of the mission, closely following Lisa from the time she wakes up after seeing her son die in a horrible recurring nightmare, to when she and her team arrive in the parallel universe. There, they are attacked by an enormous, grotesque flying creature mere moments after their arrival. 

Heidi Azaro as Lisa Abram

Versatile NY native Actress Heidi Azaro has played roles on prime-time from 30 Rock to Law & Order, held lead & multiple character roles Off-Broadway including original works such as Yo Soy Latina and Tales From the Tunnel, as well as memorable & quirky performances in Independent films. She has appeared in dozens of TV & web commercials throughout the Midwest.

She has studied with Richard Scanlon, one of New York City’s most innovative producers, co-founder and award winning director of the New York Performance Alliance, as well as with award winning actor/instructor Tom Noonan (Manhunter, Heat).

Robert Grant as Abel Eldridge 

Classically trained, Rob has played roles from Shakespeare to Chekov, working in theatres such as None Too Fragile, and Karamu House, as well as several independent films. He currently holds a B.A. in Theatre Arts from the University of Akron, where he has played such roles as Petruchio in The Taming of the Shrew and Vershinin in Three Sisters. He is also studying at the Houde School of Acting. Througout the independent film world, he has acted in several films, such as Project E.1337 , King, and Colt Navy. Rob is truly excited to work with a diverse cast of remarkable individuals and is blessed to have this opportunity as a storyteller. 


Mikhail Tot as Scott Thompson 
Mikhail Tot is an actor and director. He has worked on multiple full-length feature films, over 150 short videos, and numerous commercials and music videos. He currently lives in Cleveland, where he and his team are working on their feature film "In Production". In his free time, he enjoys long walks on the beach and Chipotle. He and his team "Tot Films Production" are very well known in Cleveland night-life. With their promo videos and photos, they are slowly making a name for them selves in Ohio.

The biggest thing we still need to make this project as successful as it can possibly be is funding. While I'm putting a lot of my own resources into it, it's still not enough, which is why we've opted to ask you, Indiegogoers, for help. Your donations will help pay for many things necessary for this project's success such as-

- COSTUMES: Building three awesome looking spacesuit-type costumes isn't going to be cheap or easy, but who would want to see people travel to a parallel universe in normal clothing?

- THE PHILADELPHIA SET: When our three scientists travel to another world, they board a large, heavily modified and re-purposed Apollo capsule named the Philadelphia. This is what carries them to the parallel universe. While some of the exterior shots of this will be of a model composite, done in post production, we still need to build the interior of the ship.

- GEAR: As a student at Cuyahoga Community College I have access to a ton of great equipment to use during production, free of charge. But given the nature of the way we want to shoot this project, there are still a few things that are going to need to be rented, such as a wireless follow focus system, and wireless video transmitter.

- PROPS AND SET DRESSING: In order to make the world that DEPARTURE takes place in as immersive as possible, we will be needing to buy props and other items to make each and every scene look as amazing and real as it can be.

- VISUAL EFFECTS: Everything you see that we can't do on set, we're going to need to pay a visual effects artist for. Things like the enormous monster at the end of the film will need to be modeled, animated and composited in post-production, and all of that is VERY expensive, but with a visual-heavy project such as this, it's a necessity.

In return for your investment in this project we have a number of awesome rewards. This includes the basic things like posters, shirts, early downloads and behind the scenes footage. Other rewards include props from the film,  costumes that will be worn during the mission to the parallel universe and access to a special on-set live feed during production! 

I want to stress that, in the event that we don't manage to reach our goal with this campaign, this project will still be completed. Funds raised here will be directed towards our biggest necessities for production, like props, costumes and the set. Since visual effects will be completed in post production I'll have more time to raise the money for them if we don't reach our goal, it'll just take longer to complete!

The impact your donation will have on this project will be HUGE. Trying to create a great looking science fiction film on this small of a budget means that we are and will be stretching every penny to it's fullest extent. Every single dollar counts and and will be used to elevate DEPARTURE 's production value, and quality for which I, and everyone else involved, will be eternally grateful! If we somehow manage to surpass our goal, all of that money will still be going directly into the film. More funding = better effects. 

There are several challenges with a project of this magnitude. The biggest one right now is making sure we can afford to pay for supplies to build the costumes and set before shooting begins. I've already begun to work on overcoming this obstacle by redesigning the costumes (they still look cool) and simplifying the set design (also still looks cool) in the event that we can't raise enough money.
Another thing is locations. Almost every scene in DEPARTURE takes place in a different location, and a good location is hard to come by. We are still scouting and making huge amounts of progress in this area though, so we will definitely be prepared when we begin shooting!

Even if you can't afford to donate you can still help out! Tell your friends, parents, acquaintances, distant relatives and maybe some people you've never met about this project! Word of mouth is an incredibly powerful tool so tell everyone you know! 

You can also help out by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, tumblr, google+ or whatever else you use.
Anything you can do to help will be greatly appreciated!

story:
SET, a hired Killer who makes a deadly mistake, finds herself in a cat and mouse chase with the most murderous men in the country as she battles for her life to make it all right again.  


Filming is underway, and the finish line is in sight!   

The filming has already begun! Back in November of 2015 we ran the very first Indiegogo campaign for the film and with the grace of our friends and family we came away with close to half of what we were asking for!

  Where some filmmakers might try to push for more funding, we decided to take action. 

Instead of trying to fill out the budget then, we decided to show you all what you were buying into, so we took what what small budget we had and started making the movie. 

With a team of dedicated crew and a killer cast, we ran off to Phoenix, Arizona and began the production literally from the moment we drove out. 

Now that the first half of production is complete, with the finish line clearly in site, we only have FOUR more days of production left to shoot! So, to make this possible with the most efficient and effective means, we decided to try for one final Indiegogo run! 
But this time, we've got so much more to show you : ) 

(The whole team in a Junkyard gets ready for an intense choreographed sequence between Lead Actress Dorée Seay and the Freelance Killer played by Jax Menez)

(Shooting night sequences in downtown Phoenix, Lead Actress Dorée Seay establishes dominance over a dangerous man played by Az Actor A. Calion Maston) 


(Sitting down with Lead Actress Dorée Seay as we go over blocking for the scene) 



Shooting an intense argument scene between LA Actors Maryam Cné and Christopher Labadie, who play brother/sister Dana and Samuel in the film) 



(Lead Make up Artist Brooke Darwin working her magic on Dorée Seay's face before a heavy post-battle scene) 


(Cold Late Night Desert shoots with Dorée Seay and A. Calion Maston) 


Meet some of the bad guys 


Chris Labadie as 'Samuel', a quirky good natured introvert who reaches out to help 'SET' and finds himself tangled in a very dangerous and violent web. 


Maryam Cné as 'Dana', overly protective loving sister to 'Samuel' who will do anything to keep her brother safe and the deadly 'SET' at arms length, despite 'Samuel's' good intentions. 


Dorée Seay as 'SET' , A hired Killer who makes a deadly mistake and enters into a cat and mouse chase with the most murderous men in the country as she fights to make it all right again.  



Harrison Page plays 'Karl; The Owner' The only thing more dangerous than a killer is the man who owns the killers, and Karl owns the entire west coast. A partitioner of freelance murder gigs, Karl is the man behind the curtain that sicks the world on 'Set's' heels, despite being the man who first took her in from the streets. 



Drue Schaefer Crookston as 'Handsome' an ex mob hitter who's gone freelance. His perfectionist tendencies in life never make it his horrendously gory murder scenes. 



Robert Aldredge as 'The Doorman' The first freelance killer out the gate to come after 'SET' and put her in the ground. 



Jax Menez as 'Alexander Marks' One of the hardest hitting highest ranked killers in the West Coast, and he's got his eye on 'SET's' price tag. 



A. Calion Maston as 'Darkman' a Shooter with a hell of a resume who's goal is to take SET down before the freelance Killers can get to her. 



Behind the scenes photo with Harrison page 



Behind the scenes photo of Robert Aldredge and Dorée Seay 


Behind the scenes shot with LA Actor Marq Wharton 



Title for poster design by Benjamin Whitt of Behold Design and Nicholas Sheffield of Nikolaus Design 


Alternative Poster Art by Nicholas Sheffield of Nikolaus Design
story_txt:
SET, a hired Killer who makes a deadly mistake, finds herself in a cat and mouse chase with the most murderous men in the country as she battles for her life to make it all right again.  
Filming is underway, and the finish line is in sight!   

The filming has already begun! Back in November of 2015 we ran the very first Indiegogo campaign for the film and with the grace of our friends and family we came away with close to half of what we were asking for!

  Where some filmmakers might try to push for more funding, we decided to take action. 



Instead of trying to fill out the budget then, we decided to show you all what you were buying into, so we took what what small budget we had and started making the movie. 

With a team of dedicated crew and a killer cast, we ran off to Phoenix, Arizona and began the production literally from the moment we drove out. 

Now that the first half of production is complete, with the finish line clearly in site, we only have FOUR more days of production left to shoot! So, to make this possible with the most efficient and effective means, we decided to try for one final Indiegogo run! 
But this time, we've got so much more to show you : )  

(The whole team in a Junkyard gets ready for an intense choreographed sequence between Lead Actress Dorée Seay and the Freelance Killer played by Jax Menez)   

(Shooting night sequences in downtown Phoenix, Lead Actress Dorée Seay establishes dominance over a dangerous man played by Az Actor A. Calion Maston) 


(Sitting down with Lead Actress Dorée Seay as we go over blocking for the scene) 



Shooting an intense argument scene between LA Actors Maryam Cné and Christopher Labadie, who play brother/sister Dana and Samuel in the film) 




(Lead Make up Artist Brooke Darwin working her magic on Dorée Seay's face before a heavy post-battle scene) 


(Cold Late Night Desert shoots with Dorée Seay and A. Calion Maston)

story:
The story of Martha Curnutt 

Martha is a short-film centered around actual events that occurred in Missouri in 1843. In a crime that shocked her small town a woman by the name of Martha Curnutt was found guilty of the brutal murder of her husband. At the time of her conviction, Martha was one of two women  who had ever served in the state penitentiary and was forced to live among the male inmates.

In the 1800’s under the laws of coverture, a woman’s rights and privileges were given up to her husband and he was allowed to make any and all decisions in her regard. Under this system women were allowed to be beaten by their husband and be fully protected under the law of the United States. Martha was a product of that law and it is only when she took matters into her own hands did she start to have some control over her life, and the safety of her children. That freedom however, was short lived. She was quickly charged and forced to pay the price of her crime. Originally charged with murder, she was able to procure a lesser charge of first degree manslaughter and evaded the electric chair. 

While in prison she was harassed, threatened and tormented. The horrors on the inside of the penitentiary forced Martha to fight for her life and face her biggest challenges yet. The story of Martha is one of survival against all odds and perseverance against immense injustice. 

Now, to make this film we are looking for a little help in securing a budget, in order to fund locations, costumes, equipment and so much more. We  believe this project can be something special and we are depending on the generosity of friends, family and even strangers to bring her story back to life.  So if you at all feel moved to help with the project, any contribution would be appreciated. No donation is too small and we appreciate anything that you can give.  If not a donation, we would be equally as grateful for a share on Facebook! 

Now let me introduce you to the team! 

DIRECTOR:

ASHER MARKWORTH 
Asher is a second year student at the Colorado Film School currently pursuing a degree in Writing and Directing. He spent two years studying English and Communications at the University of Wyoming before moving to Colorado to pursue a career in the film industry.  

PRODUCERS:

 

ERIN TURNER
Erin is in her 2nd year of film school studying Post Production & Producing. She is a Washington State native with a B.A. in Music. Erin has produced her own projects such as The Waltz and is excited to be Producing this short.

MELISSA RIDGEWAY
Melissa is a current student at the the Colorado Film School working towards a degree in Writing and Directing. She comes from Kansas City Missouri and made the move west to explore her passion for documentary filmmaking. During her time at CFS she has become known for investigating  deeply personal stories in her films and had a special interest in bringing exposure to the LGBT community. Other interests of Melissa's are red wine, her love of cats and her friends. She will be graduating in the fall of 2016.

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY:

MORGAN ELLER
Morgan Eller is a graduate of the Colorado Film School with a degree in Cinematography. Her contagious energy and undeniable work ethic make her a true asset to any set that she steps onto, just ask anyone who has had the pleasure of working with her. She is a true blue Colorado native and is proud to live and work in the city of Denver. She is the owner of Mile High Moyg photography, a company that provides both still photography and videography for clients all around the state. Her other passions include the Denver Broncos, her family, her friends and of course her ability to bring joy to those around her through the art of the visual medium.

SOUND & EDITING:

JESSICA CARTER

Jessica Carter is an award winning sound designer and editor located in Denver. Owner of Edits by Jess post production company, she works with clients all across the Denver area and nationally. Jessica holds two bachelor’s degree in Mass Communications and Kinesiology from Kansas State University, as well as a Post Production degree from the Colorado Film School.

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR:

BETSEY VANHULLE

Starting out her journey in the back of a pickup truck, watching a cowboy rescue an astronaut, Betsey has been in entranced by the cinema ever since. While other kids used their summers to party, Betsey used hers to explore further into the world she adored. By day her and her family would plan out the short and by night they would each take turns directing and starring in their own shorts.

Coming a long way from such small beginnings, Betsey has now spent numerous hours cultivating her skills in movie making by spending her adult life studying even father into the world of cinema. She has been anywhere from Production Designer and AD to Writer and Director. She loves every second of it and plans to continue to help on every movie she can.

CAST 

Lynne Jordan as Martha


Gary Neuger as the Warden


Jennifer Scott as Lenora, The Warden's Wife

*cast and crew will be added as they join our team!

What a Team!

I am so lucky to have a great team and  we hope you will join us in support as we make this film.

story:
Bref résumé

SPORTWIZME.com est un tout nouveau site internet vous permettant de trouver tous les sportifs près de chez vous en quelques clics.

Le sport tout seul, c'est bien... à plusieurs, c'est mieux !

Il vous est possible de géo-localiser les sportifs inscrits, et de filtrer les différents profils par:
  • sport
  • niveau
  • disponibilité horaires
Ensuite, il ne vous reste plus qu'à contacter les sportifs qui correspondent à votre pratique via notre messagerie interne.

Et hop, on chausse les baskets et on va faire du sport ensemble !


L'idée de ce site est venue tout simplement...
"Après un déménagement (changement de région), moi qui pratiquait beaucoup de sport, le tennis notamment, il m'a été très compliqué de trouver de nouveaux partenaires avec qui jouer. Hier, c'était encore un problème, plus maintenant grâce à SPORTWIZME ! "

Jean-Sébastien Volpé, Co-fondateur de SPORTWIZME.com


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Aujourd'hui, le plus important pour nous est d'enrichir notre communauté et d'avoir le plus de sportifs inscrits sur notre site internet !

Cela tombe bien, cela ne vous coûte rien, seulement 2 minutes de votre temps ! :)

Si toutefois votre générosité l'emportait... nous sommes à la recherche de financement pour nous aider à mieux communiquer autour de notre site internet.

Qui dit participation dit contrepartie (et c'est bien normal), c'est pourquoi en fonction du montant de votre participation, vous bénéficierez d'équipement sportif aux couleurs de SPORTWIZME, car vous deviendrez alors nos premiers Ambassadeurs !

Exemples de contreparties:
  • Veste softshell


  • Manchettes


  • Bidon 500ml



L'impact

La force de SPORTWIZME réside et résidera dans le recensement de tous les sportifs de France.
C'est pourquoi votre engagement à nos côtés est plus qu'important.

Risques et défis

Le but de SPORTWIZME est très simple, devenir le réseau social des sportifs !

Au delà de la plateforme communautaire qui rassemble tous les sportifs de France, SPORTWIZME, c'est aussi SPORTWIZME Events.

Nous proposons effectivement une solution simple de gestion des inscriptions et paiement en lignes pour les clubs ou associations, qui organisent des évènements sportifs tout au long de l'année.

D'autres façons d'aider

Ce n'est pas car vous ne pouvez pas contribuer pécuniairement que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider...

Inscrivez-vous sur notre site, déposez votre annonce de sportif, parlez-en autour de vous !

Merci d'avoir pris le temps de lire tout ça, à bientôt et bon sport !

A vos baskets :)
